title: Love it!
text: This is perfect for small places. I first saw it on YouTube and thought it couldn't be that good but it is. I hate going to the laundromat and waste so much money to do a couple loads. Now I can do laundry whenever I want. It's quit and efficient.  The little dryer doesn't use heat but pressure to get most of the water out your clothes, then it only takes like maybe a day or even less for everything to dry. I put it in my bathtub on top of a box so the bottom won't get wet.

title: Pretty Good Despite Some Small Complaints.
text:
I received this washer today and ran it for the first time as soon as I unpacked it. It does what it's supposed to do. The agitation is powerful, surprisingly powerful. The spin dryer does an amazing job and is pretty quiet once the spinner gets going. I was not about to haul this thing atop some makeshift platform in order to make the gravity drain work, and I certainly wasn't going to carry pots of drain water to dump into the sink - I simply kept the drain hose in an upright position attaching it to the provided clip on the side of the washer and then slipped a smaller hose down inside the main drain hose - the other end of the smaller hose is attached to a small little pump I bought at my local home improvement store and drains into the kitchen sink. To drain the water I simply switched the washer to the 'Drain' setting and flipped the switch on the pump. Easy as pie. I did the same when running the spin dryer.
I do have a couple of complaints....
1. The washer arrived very, very dirty, especially the bottom - there was gross brown crud all over the bottom.
2. There was a number scratches and deep gouges on the outside.
3. The provided hose to fill is worthless - I simply attached a small hose used for normal full sized washing machines to my kitchen sink spigot and filled the washer that way - super easy and fast.

It definitely cannot handle adult sized bedding, and I have my doubts that it can handle even one pair of jeans - not because of power, because it's pretty powerful, but I say this due to it's size - it's crazy small inside. But it's great for very small loads....a couple of shirts, with some socks, undies, etc..

title: Small , some noise but not too loud.
text: Like , like , like  .Easy to use for washing and is fast, clean very good.

title: ... a year and I have to say I am amazed with it
text: I've had this product now for almost a year and I have to say I am amazed with it. It cleans my clothes better than anything. I use an oxy laundry detergent but just a dab because you don't want anything too sudsy. I usually use cold to temperate water unless it's socks and undies then I let them wash, sit for 5 mins and wash again. Sparkling white. The washing cycle agitates wonderfully and the spin cycle almost completely dries the clothes. They're barely damp. I turn on my fan and they are dry in a half an hour. I have to put the machine up on a small table that's about the same height as my bathtub because there's no pump to get the water out of the machine, it drains via gravity. I thought about buying a small pool pump but for now it's fine. I've saved 30 dollars a week not going to the laundromat anymore and it's convenient and easy to use. I let it dry after I'm done (keeping the lids open) and I spray it with lysol because I don't want mold to grow on it. Also, keep the lint filter clean after every wash before you rinse so you don't get the fuzz on the clothes in the rinse cycle.  I use my long hose hand held shower head to fill it but it has leads for a small hose. My sink would work but it doesn't come apart to attach a hose. I've never had a leak with this item and I did buy a warranty just in case. But so far all is great!!!!! I've recommended this to other people as well.

title: Perfect for an RV when a laundromat isn't available
text:
I've seen some YouTube reviews on this and similar items. I live in an RV full time without a laundromat near by. So I purchased this to wash my clothes.

The washer is a little noisy but if I shut my bathroom door, I don't hear it as much. When I first got it the back wasn't properly snapped into place but that was easily fixed. The hose provided to fill the washer is useless, I just put my shower head into the tub.

When I use this, I put about a tablespoon to 1.5 tablespoons of liquid laundry detergent for a large load with about half a scoop of oxi clean. I run my machine for 15 mins and then let it sit. I will drain the dirty water and rinse the tub a little bit. Then close the drain and fill with clean water and run for 15 more minutes. Then I will drain again. Pull half if the clothes and spin them for at max 4 mins. After the spin, they are damp but quickly dry.

There are water levels for low, middle, and high water marks on the lint filter but they are hard to see. The lint filter is a nice way to catch loose thread but it doesn't filter all of the water.

I store it behind my entertainment center and it fits really well there. The issue is getting into my bathroom. I have to go up a small set of stairs to the bathroom and it's a little bulky to easily get up there. Because it has legs, I can have it in my shower when it's draining and not have to worry about the motor getting wet.

Overall, it's a nice machine. I can put 2 pairs of jeans and several shirts in a load. I have even fit my entire queen sized sheet set including pillow cases into it.

title: Great for small spaces
text: If you only have 3-4 items to wash, this is amazing. It’s exactly how it’s portrayed online and is so adorable and small. I don’t have hooked to water source. Using buckets to add water, it is a lot of work but no more than hand washing anything.

I’ve contacted the seller to get a refund and not gotten anywhere. I would look at other options before settling in this one. Seller just send the same response when attempting to contact.

title: Giantex -  Practical Innovations for people who are not afraid to do a little extra work
text:
This was a life saver for me. After our washer stopped working and then our dryer, again, I was just so done. I decided I needed a backup as going to the laundromat is a huge problem for me time wise. My schedule is just way too hectic for that. So after trying hand washing alone and messing up my hands in the process (hello joint pain), I needed another option. This little gem did just that for me. No, you cannot wash a lot of stuff in here. I usually am able to fit in about 3-5 shirts, 2 pants (depending on the type). I can even fit sheets in there, at least 2-3 twin size and 3-4 pillowcase covers, no blankets obviously. Nevertheless, it seriously does the job. My clothes do come out much cleaner and I also noticed that when washing my clothes in this little bit of practical magic that my skin did not itch as opposed to when we use a traditional washer. Furthermore, the little spinner also does a pretty good job in that when I hang my clothes up to air dry they are done usually within an hour or two. However, I do not do a lot of loads in one day as I do wring out any excess water before adding to the spinner and that can further take a toll on my hands so I just wash at best 2-3 loads a day with this. Now I no longer keep a hamper in my bathroom I just put my things in there until I have enough for a load.
I have set up a little laundry station in my bathroom. This little baby does not take up much space. I place it in the bathtub when using and add water directly from the faucet from the tub by simply tilting it directly underneath. When the load is done I switch to drain and lift one side, let the hose hang down to drain the water and repeat until the water is out (usually takes me 2 times to completely drain). I know this sounds more cumbersome but its not a strain for me. When I'm done using I put it back in its place after its been thoroughly drained. FYI: I tend to let it sit in the tub for a little while after basically manually draining to make sure all of the water is out to prevent leaks which have not happened. It's not really heavy at all at 20lbs when empty and close to 50lb+ when fully loaded. But, I like it and I no longer have to worry if my machines conk out again.
As for the company, the product came in good time with excellent packaging. Really pleased with this purchase. I only wish I had been aware that these things existed years before.
Thank you for reading and thank you to the company!!!!!

title: good for small spaces,high noise level and shakiness upon spinning clothes

title: It works great! I'm so glad I took a chance on it.

I do a whole day of laundry (4 med/lrg) loads every other week and have been since I bought it. I haven't had any problems. I love it.

title: It works great! I'm so glad I took a chance on it.

title: It's small but powerful.
text: I've had it three days now and done several loads. As everyone else said, the hose will not fit a sink in the US. For the first day, I used bowls to fill the machine which was a lot of work but did the job. The next day, I bought a funnel big enough to cover my shower head, drilled two holes on opposite sides at the top, and used a small bungie cord to put a hook into each hole and then hang it over the shower head. I then cut two slits into the hose to allow the funnel to fit inside the faucet end, then duct taped it to seal. I attached the hose to the machine and it worked perfectly. My shower is low flow so I could turn it on full. I put the machine in the shower and ran it from there with no issues, other than to hold the machine when the spinner starts up because the vibration is very strong. My overall reaction is that it does a good job cleaning and the spinner is very good. Similar to a spa's machine to dry your bathing suit. It is labor intensive because you must move the clothes a few at a time to the spinner and you can only put a few things in at a time, but my clothes dry beautifully on a rack and the towels only need 15 minutes in a dryer at the laundromat until I can string up a clothesline in the summer. I did purchase a warranty, though. I'd rather pay $13 than lose $110 if it breaks.

title: Too small, super short hose,
text: This washer is way smaller than I expected, very light weight. The hose is super short. However it wash the clothes good enough and the spinner is very good but so small. Good for small loads, compact size. Can fit a lot of small pieces like tshirts, shorts, undies, etc. And a couple larger pieces. I'm giving a 3 stars because it's way smaller than I expected and does to the short hose it's not convenient and it doesn't drain automatically. Everything has to be set manually.

title: Five Stars
text: A best-in-class item, to be sure.

title: Weak Pump but overall great machine
text: I live in a small apartment and there are no washer/dryer hookups and the laundry facility is tiny and always packed. This machine is a time saver and great. It is a little bigger than I thought, but fits right into my bathroom. The only problems I had were that the pump was very week so I had to move it to the master bathroom where there's a shower (not tub) and just let it drain down. The pump pipe is also very short and the pipe for water does not fit any of the sinks, but since we have the long shower heads, that wasn't a problem.

title: Company does not honor 5-year warranty.
text: I bought this machine and I absolutely loved it. Perfect size for my studio. I just put it in the bathtub and put a nylon sock over the end of the hose capture all the excess lint. It was perfect. I bought the 5-year warranty. After a year it started having complications. I reached out to have it fixed with no response. I was still able to use it by having to do things I shouldn't have had to. Last night the spinner went out. I reached out to the company many times about the warranty with no response. I bought another portable washing machine last night but not by the same company.

title: Do not buy.
text: I bought this to use in my tiny home (camper).  I have a full size washer and dryer but they are in a shed and have no hot water.  I thought it would be cheaper to buy this than a water heater.  I have only used it 3 or 4 times and I love the washer part.  I usually just take the closes out and throw them in my other washer to rinse and spin.  The spinner side never worked from day one.  I decided to keep it because having  my other washer and dryer, I really don't need the spinner, and sending it back would be too much trouble .  I would recommend not buying this.  Based on the reviews its not worth it.  I wish I had just bought a small water heater instead.

title: This really does the job and is a super cute, convenient way of washing a small load
text: This really does the job and is a super cute, convenient way of washing a small load.  I'm rating a 3 because the tubing is very odd.  The drain tube is short and must drain from the floor while most sinks for the water in are lifted. It does it's job if you figure out how to make it work for you.

title: Favorite Amazon purchase EVER!
text: So then, after living full time nearly 3 years in my RV, I discovered this gem and IT HAS CHANGED MY LIFE! Wishing I could take back all those many grueling trips to the laundromat I made, when I know now that I didn't need to. Other than when I take a shower, this amazing little machine lives in my shower stall, where I have it sitting on 4 plastic bed risers, just because I don't like the idea of an electric appliance sitting in water as it drains. It's easy enough to lift in and out of the shower stall, as it only weighs 26 lbs. I wash my single queen size sheets one at a time, and they come out beautifully. The spin side of this thing is crazy powerful and does an amazing job of wringing out every little last bit of water in whatever I just washed. If you watch a few videos about it on YouTube, you'll know exactly what to do, and see how amazingly simple it is to operate. DON'T HESITATE... BUY IT TODAY! : )

It has a hook for it on both sides and under the machine it has the recess chanel for either side you decide to have the drain tube.

title: Small but Mighty
text:
Used this for about two months now and am loving it in my tiny apartment with no W/D hookups (or room for a w/d anyway, ha). It's been absolutely excellent for the price. I wish I could tell everyone at the laundromat about it. That being said, it is a small washer and you can't expect it to be capable of the same things as a full size machine. Treat it right, and it should last.

What are the steps?
The basic order is either wash in the washer -> drain -> rinse in the washer -> drain -> spin dry in the dryer - OR - wash in the washer -> transfer clothes to the dryer and fill for a rinse (conserving your washer water for another load) -> drain dryer and dry. You can either rinse in the washer or the spin bucket, so you are able to re-use your washer water if doing multiple loads.

Pros
> Gets your clothes clean. I feel like my clothes are cleaner with this than a laundromat washer, ha.
> Runs relatively quietly (There is the sound of water, and a light humming while it spins).
> Slim size fits in/on top of many places
> Lightweight. I'm a 130 lbs marshmallow and have no problem lifting it (without water in it, ofc)
> Fast...wash cycles run ~12 minutes, rinse ~9, and dry ~9.
> SO much more convenient than leaving the house to do laundry
> Eventually pays for itself if you don't otherwise have access to a free washer/dryer.

Cons(?) More like, things to be aware of and how to work around them:
> I can't stress enough, this is not a full-sized machine. You can't work it like a traditional large, sturdy, metal washer. It makes a light burning plastic smell with larger loads, & I've never filled it higher than about halfway between the Med and High fill lines out of fear of over-stressing the motor. Not made to do all your weekly laundry in one day (unless it's a single person's maybe), but more like 2, 3 loads max a day...meaning multiple laundry days a week may be needed. This is in order to preserve the life of your machine becaaauuusseee...
> The only -actual- con: this company seems unresponsive with inquiries about replacements/repairs, as other reviewers have noted.

> Must elevate to drain properly. If the drain hose makes the water travel against gravity at any point (i.e. UP), it won't drain all the way. I've remedied this by putting it on a storage tub to drain ~90% and then lifting it a couple inches to completely drain the rest.

> No heated dryer. Spin dryer does get clothes about 90~95% dry though, much dryer than just-out-of-the-wash. I was in disbelief when I first used it, ha. To prevent stiff clothes, add a bit of white vinegar to your washer run. It's a little stiffer than your usual heated dryer, but not like you paid for starch at the dry cleaners. It hasn't bothered me at all.

> How...do I...fill it? It does come with a hose but that probably won't fit your sink. I use the shower-head from my bath tub and fill it directly. Others fill buckets and then pour in the water from there. Others have bought adapters for -make- the hose fit their sink. Others utilize the dustpan sink funnel technique

> It's super noisy/wobbly/chaotic! = It's probably overloaded. Aside from the first and last ~7 seconds of the spin dryer, it shouldn't be moving much at all. Neither tub should be filled to the top; your clothes need room to move!

title: Nice But..
text: Hoses are too short and flimsy cord is too short to use it in the tub maybe ill use a heavy duty extention cord. You'll need to do a lot of bucket dumping not for people with back problems. Nice wash and spin drain is awesome! The clothes get do get washed clean which makes me happy! :-)

title: Impractical For Doing The Laundry. Would Not Recommend.
text:
We've only used the "Giantex Portable Mini Compact Twin Tub Washing Machine 17.6lbs Washer" a couple of times before having to request a return. It is fairly easy to set up. However, it fails to wash the clothes well and is extremely time consuming to do even a small load of laundry. The washer has rough edges along one side that would simply just damage the clothes while washing. You would have to drain and refill the water multiple times in order to rinse the clothes well. As another reviewer had accurately stated, it is literally just a step above hand washing. Be cautious of water dripping along the tube as well. As for the dryer, it is poorly designed. It uses a spinning effect vs. heat. On the contrary, it is more rough in drying clothes than a standard dryer. It also lacks a way to filter all of the lint. The new towels and clothes laundered came out looking like they were old and worn/torn and had to be disposed of. It may seem like a good concept but is not practical at all.

Would not recommend.

title: Excellent cleaning and maximum user control at a very low price.
text: I bought this as a backup washer when my Whirlpool forgot how to function.  I used it heavily for a month while waiting for service on my large he machine..Using this is very satisfying even if it requires more intervention from the user.  I have it set up in my bathroom on a bamboo coffee table(see another review).  It has no pump so it must be manually filled and drained, but this is easy with the tub connections and drain. It is much like using an old wringer machine, except that it has a separate spinner to do the wringing.  I love having total control over the amount of water and agitation time, the number of rinses and the length of spin time.  It has turned out to be an awesome way to wash my soft slippers and fabric shoes.  I can control the quality of the wash and rinse entirely.  The only caveat is being careful with the spinner, which is nothing more than a terrific centrifuge.  Balance your spin load symmetrically, especially slippers, and watch it until it achieves maximum spin( about 20 seconds).  If there is a load distribution problem it will sound wrong.  Stop it and rearrange your items.  This does not happen often. I know it paid for itself may times over while my big machine was broken.  I would easily have spent more than $100 at the laundromat.

title: Good customer service
text:
Unfortunately, I received a defective machine, however, I still wanted to leave a review because I believe this would have been a great little washing machine, had it worked as it was supposed to. It is nice and small to fit in small areas. The part that did work AMAZINGLY was the spin cycle! It got almost ALL moisture out of the clothes to the point that the clothes were literally almost dry.
The tube was way too short to run from the faucet to the machine, so I had to fill with a bucket, which kinda sucked but still did the trick.
Customer service was friendly and fairly quick about responding to my concerns. And when I asked for a refund, they did so in a timely manner.

title: Great washer for the price!
text: Purchased the 17 lb version (largest). I got it two days ahead of schedule. We did a lot of research before choosing this washer/spinner. We live in a large apt building and the washers in the wash room are gross to say the least. Our main concern was longevity, I want to still have this washer a year from now. And it is looking like Im going to. It seems built really well and doing laundry is amazing with it. I was already hang drying a lot of my things, but this thing cleans and dries things so well that it cuts my hang dry time in half. Extremely happy! I would give 6 stars if I could!! I am very choosy on amazon, buy it, you wont regret it! :)

title: Worth the try
text:
I bought this mini washing machine thing cos of the many reviews here. The price is right give it a try and see for yourself. 5 day washing and drying in a roll and still smoking strong and clean. I didn't mind the hoses to filling up water and draining as many people said here sucks. But I assembled mine by the tub on a rubber container I bought from Walmart to raise it up to a little bit below my knee. This improved gravity draining impressively than fancy built-in pump

Updated: Aug2020 still working. I ordered another one, hey the price is 50%up. Guys be warned Amazon prices are like the stock market today

It's compact for convenience, I love how it washes the clothes you don't have any clothes get stuck in the bottom of either side, and it's simple to use. title: Goodbye Laundromat!
text:
Digging this thing so far! Beats going to the laundromat any day!! My items are clean and it seems gentle enough for delicate items. Pretty quiet and easy to move around. I only have a few small complaints.

1. The provided hose is not very useful. It's kind of short and the sleeve on the end doesn't actually fit on any of my faucets.
2. It's a bit more labor intensive than I was expecting when it comes to rinsing. I'm going to try some different detergent in hopes of finding something that rinses out easier.
3. The power cable could be longer.

All in all, these complaints are in no way deal breakers and I would recommend this to anyone living in an apartment where you can't have a real washer.

title: Five Stars

title: 1 year and still doing great
text: Its a great washer for my apartment. It saves me so much time and money. Ive had it for about a year now and it's still working great! It had water inlets but I've found it easier and faster to fill it up by using a plastic bucket to fill. It can take about one pair of jeans a load with multiple other garments and sometimes two pairs depending on the heaviness of the fabric. It gets my clothes clean and stain free. The spinner does a good job of ringing out the clothes, but they still need to be dried. I bought a standard plug in magic chef dryer that works well to finish the drying or I put them on the drying rack. It's a nice little washer for people living in small spaces or without hookups for a washer. I included a picture of my wall plug dryer as well if anyone was curious.

title: It does the job
text: So far so good. Purchased this for our RV. It fits 2 towels at a time and the dry spinner is pretty weak when it comes to towels but if you wash a couple articles of clothing at a time this is great. It's better than nothing and multiple trips to the laundry mat.

title: It’s okay.
text: The one thing I’ll say is it’s SUPER loud. Sounds like an actual JET taking off. I have neighbors so I was definitely a little embarrassed when I first used it.. otherwise everything else works fine and I don’t have any complaints.

title: So far so good..

title: Life saver for someone sharing laundry with other people
text:
[[VIDEOID:7d287831a48dd1d3f2296ed1b92a7e06]] I live in a building where we are not allowed to install our own washers and dryers in apartments. We have laundry room in each floor. I got tired of bringing my laundry and sharing machines with other people. Also paying for doing laundry every time.
I did my research for portable washers and this one stood out for me. The reviews were great and I decided to buy it. I am so glad I did! Yes you have to drain it manually and pour water manually but this doesn’t bother me at all. It does phenomenal job at washing I am not joking! Much better than washer in my building! The trick to draining well is to slightly elevate the machine. I will buy a bench for that. Other than that I have absolutely nothing negative to say about it. Spinner is amazing I get my things out almost dry! It is also lightweight if you need to move it around. Noise level is minimal For expected it would be really loud but it’s not. I can’t recommend it highly enough!

title: MINI quality and MANY problems
text: Most of the reviews were good - I'm not sure why.  This is a COMPACT washer/SPIN drip dry.  Its light weight and will probably work well for students in a dorm.  Or maybe not - because it DOES NOT DRY clothes - it spins clothing which then has to be hung (in your house).  Okay - I get that.  The BIG PROBLEM(S) come when you try to put water in and take water out.  NEITHER OF THE HOSES is compatible with my bathroom, bath tub or kitchen sink hose.  The both the water in hose and the water out hose are TOO SHORT and one is forced to find/make/contrive a MAKE_SHIFT hose each time - to get  water in and get the water out.  So I resorted to filling 5 (1 gallon) buckets of water to wash clothes (WHICH ALWAYS CAME OUT SUDSY AND funky...I never felt like my clothes were truly washed).  Then I had STAND AND HOLD the hose to let water once the 15 minute cycles finished - then repeat the water in process AGAIN to try to "rinse" the suds off before putting the SPIN wring dry - BEFORE HANGING to completely dry in my home.  So perhaps some college kid would find this fun...but most would not.  I'm an adult in a studio and this just  did NOT WORK FOR ME.  (Also - Giantex made it VERY DIFFICULT for me to return - 2 weeks and I'm still waiting for my credit).  WOULD NOT BUIY again or recommend purchase.

title: Decent
text: I’m updating my review. It had stopped working and I began the return process. I opened the back of the machine and found a small leak. I think that leak got wires or maybe the motor wet, because it quit spinning in both sides. After resealing the area where I found the trickle, and letting it dry out. It is working again. It’s small in size, and gets us by. Especially while stuck home on quarantine.

title: Three Stars
text: ehhh for 1 MAYBE 2 people is fine, but for 3 FORGET it, too much work involved

title: Best invention ever!
text: Such a powerful machine and yet so compact. Totally love it!!!!

title: I ended up Liking this Machine, it works well
text:
How to Wash Clothing with this Machine (Short)

I filled it up with a bucket. When you add your clothes make sure there is enough water so they float around when moved by your hand.

Filling : the water supply must be higher than the inlet, or use a bucket. Easy on the soap... you will need to rinse the soap out of the clothes. Mine was about half full. Wash at setting 15

Drain the wash cycle when done and filled again with water for rinse using half the time as wash. Wring a bit of water out of each clothing as you add clothes to the spin section. Set Spin to 5

The spin cycle is quiet and doesn't shake the machine and gets the clothes a bit damp. Keep spinning until very little water comes out of drain. Clothing should be slightly damp.

Better than washing clothes in a laundry room. No more unwashed laundry!

title: Okay for what it is, but not great.  And will be amazed if it lasts.
text:
This washing machine isn't terrible. The spinner works great, and the washing portion is okay. I bought it and a Magic Chef dryer to save me the 1.5 hour round trip to the laundromat.

I think it is worth what I paid, but it comes at a price. The obvious one - and it works fine for me in my tiny house - is that a full load is now about 1/3rd of a load. So laundry does take longer; more than 1.5 hours longer. Somewhere there is a small leak that I hope doesn't get worse. Perhaps the hose attachment? I have to track it down.

And speaking of the hose, the first time I drained the tub, I had a challenge getting my container low enough to siphon off the water. So those that put the machine up on a sturdy stand know what they are talking about. An odd quirk occurred after that first use of the drain. The tub will continue to drain until and unless you elevate or clamp the drain hose. I suspect some kind of stuck valve or shutter.

As I said, the spinner (though very small) works great and only takes a minute or so to get the rinsed garment (one or two at a time ONLY) ready for the dryer. Just make sure it is balanced as even small items can really mess it up.

I used septic-friendly detergent, so I use the drained water in my toilet tank. Water conservation to the max.

Ironically, it is raining as I write this, and we are having near-record rains. Still, I will conserve.

I haven't saved time, nor do I think I am saving money over using the laundromat. I will have to keep records and see.

That leaves the dryer, which is a different brand and is reviewed elsewhere.

title: Extremely labor-intensive, and effective. Ties clothes in knots. High water and detergent usage. Incredible but fussy spinner.
text:
This machine appears to be identical to http://amzn.com/B01ICBLBL0 (Best Choice Products), except for minor cosmetic differences. Surely the same manufacturer. (Which seems common among things in this class.) This review is for that machine, which I purchased from Amazon.

To minimize the water-wasting and labor-intensiveness problems, get the large size - typically listed as 11 to 13 lbs capacity. (Don't worry, it is still small and light.) To minimize the knot-tying problem, always use small washable laundry bags!

This is obviously meant to be used in a bathtub or shower. The inlet "hose" is completely useless (but might make a fun drinking straw), and the gravity drain hose is only long enough to get the water to the floor. The only way to fill it is with a detachable shower head, regular hose, or a bucket.

PROS:

* Clothes get cleaner than from any other regular consumer-grade or laundromat washer you've ever used. Seriously.

* The spinner is far more effective than regular washers. (Thanks to a much smaller size and correspondingly lower mechanical demands, with significantly higher RPM, and overall more angular momentum.)

* Very fast. You can get a a wash/rinse/spin/rinse cycle done in less than 20 minutes.

CONS:

* Extremely labor-intensive! You have to move the clothes no less than NINE times between dirty clothes hamper, and dryer! (Load dirty clothes into tub for wash, move half of washed clothes into spinner, remove spun clothes, move other half into spinner, move spun clothes into tub for rinse cycle, move half of rinsed clothes into spinner, remove spun clothes, move other half into spinner, move spun clothes into dryer.)

* High water usage for the amount of laundry capacity it can handle without choking.

* Ignore the people that say you don't need much soap. For typical soil levels, you need 1/2 to a full capful of liquid detergent.

* If you put too much clothes in it (more than 2x spinner's worth of dry clothes), it will grind and fail to circulate clothes properly.

* This machine ties long sleeve shirts, pants, and straps into knots that Houdini would struggle to undo. (You MUST put those items in wash bags, or your clothes will literally be one big knot and won't get clean. The smaller the bag the better, otherwise the bags themselves get turned into knots.)

* The spinner is EXTREMELY fussy. Getting it properly balanced is a nightmare, no matter how few clothes you load in it. (And it won't work if unbalanced - instead punishing you with a loud, slow banging.) On the very rare occasion that you get it balanced right the first time, you may be prone to audible, giggling, as if you just won the lottery.

Overall, I'm happy with the machine. Although it is difficult if not impossible to keep up with laundry for a small family, it is still a little better than the laundromat grind. And my clothes are the cleanest and cleanest-smelling they've ever been!

title: I LOVE this!
text:
I absolutely love this little washer/spin-dryer! I have washed blankets, delicates, and sturdy fabrics so far and it works great! I love that I can decide how long the cycle (both washing and drying) needs to be, and can pick how much water I need to add for the size load I want to do. No longer will I have to wait until my laundry basket is full to do a load!

I found it very helpful to watch the video reviews on this page to learn how to work it most efficiently. I put mine in the tub, fill it using a bucket, and drain it right there. The spin dry works great at removing almost all the water from the clothes, and I have a retractable drying line where I hang the clothes to get that very last moisture out of the fabric.

I feel like using this method to wash my clothes also reduces my energy and water usage, so it's a greener way to do laundry!

title: Good for small spaces
text:
[[VIDEOID:752d6f773106b8b92c8cccbe37b1e464]] Mine arrived very late cause of the crazy snow storm that took over the United States, but all in all it’s a great product for small spaces.
Here are a few things you need to know before buying it...
The drain hose is short, so make sure you place it right next to where ever you are going to drain it. (We used the toilet) The cord is pretty short so get an extension cord if your outlet isn’t close by. The tubes they come with don’t fit my sink faucet so we use a bucket to put water inside the washer. The “dryer” like every one likes to say isn’t a dryer, it a spinner. You’re clothe will still need to be hung to fully dry after using that. Keep that in mind. The drain system is gravity based, meaning the washer needs to be elevated in order for it to drain. We got a shoe rack from target and placed the washer on top of it that way it’s elevated.
This product does require you to by other things to make it convenient to use, but in general it does it’s job. Like I said.
It’s good for small spaces and small loads. It’s not very loud either.
It does shake at first and the washer stops and goes a lot but it’s ok.

title: Nice

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
THIS WAS THE BEST MONEY I HAVE EVER SPENT! I can wash pretty much a medium size load and get them almost dry with the spin cycle. I can wash them for ever how many minutes I want without the washer draining on me while I'm occupied with something else. The wash and spin cycle REALLY REALLY moves the clothes around. Holy spin!!! It fits perfect in my abnormally small shower. Great for quick loads or for an all day laundry project. Just don't wash you blankets. Just because it fits in the wash part DOES NOT mean it will fit in the spin side. Trust me on that.
The ONLY issue I had so far is that sometimes I have to break up the spin loads and spin out half the clothes at a time because the spin side is a bit smaller than the wash side. BUT MAN DOES IT SPIN. HOLY CRAP. it scares me sometimes because I think it's gonna take off.

title: FABULOUS
text:
I live in an older Victorian house (apt.) with clawfoot tub. The washer sits perfectly in this tub and I used the Styrofoam packaging from bottom of box to help with potential noise. I couldn't be more thrilled with this unit! My apt. is on the second floor and dragging baskets of clothes up and down to take to laundromat was a huge problem. Now I can wash at home! I will say, I will still take bigger heavy items to laundromat such as large bath towels, jeans, small throw rugs - it is common sense not to do more than the machine was made for. The washer side is large enough, but the spin dryer is smaller so heavy items wouldn't work. At least as far as my thought process. I fill the washer with water by hand as the connection won't work with either of my sinks. But that is MUCH easier to fill and pour dishpan of water than the whole trip to do laundry. It was interesting to see the dirty water going down the drain!
I didn't think my clothes were THAT dirty but great to know they are really getting clean in the washer.
Agitation is incredible for such a small machine and the spin dryer really extracts the water from items. I stand at the machine when starting spin dryer as it sounds like a lawn mower for first few seconds and tends to shake unit, so I hold it to keep steady for those few seconds. It then quiets and does its smooth motions. I did a LOT of research via Amazon reviews and videos before purchasing this unit. I really couldn't be happier!!!!!

title: Almost 3 years later NOW 4 years later
text:
First off, the customer service is wonderful. I had received an initial order that was damaged and the product was replaced immediately. I average about 3-4 loads a week and that averages to about 500 loads overall. Still washing like a champ, and if you take these same numbers times the trips to the laundromat (and the time, which is my biggest drawback) you have saved a lot. The laundry comes out the spin cycle so it needs about 5-10 minutes dry time. Most often, I just hang to dry. I hope I never need another, but if I do, I am most certainly getting another one of these.

UPDATE: Over 600 loads later, the spinner has died. Just doesn't respond. However, 600 loads of laundry and when I bought this it was a good deal cheaper. I more than got my money out of it. Without the spinner, it's almost unusable. Will take a screwdriver to it tonight and then off to dump this weekend, not hopeful. BUT it is the best buy ever. Over 600 loads of laundry. If the price hadn't jumped so, I would have another in my cart right now. Looking for a cheaper replacement. But if this is in your budget, I highly recommend. Even with a 600 load lifespan.

title: Very Nice.
text: I just got this today.  I imagine my ability to use it without making a mess will improve over time.  It's a very nice machine.  Functional and  fairly easy to work.  But I had to learn by watching many videos.  The instructions were not that helpful.  My messes were the result of losing control of the hose while draining water, and from spilling while filling the machine with water with my shower hose.  Consequently, I had to wash another load, this one consisting of towels I used to mop up water from spillage.  Two things left me baffled while using this washer/spinner:  1.  If the manufacturer knows you need to elevate to machine 4 inches in order for it to drain properly, why didn't they just add 4 inches to the base instead of requiring the buyer to buy something additional to use the machine; 2.  some type of rack should have been attached to the machine to wrap the cord around when not in use--similar to vacuum cleaners.  Due to these two design flaws, I am giving this washer/spinner 4 stars instead of 5.  I will try using the washer in my bathtub, as I've seen some others do in their videos.  Seems less messy.  I'll have to get an extension cord for that. One final thing.  The hose for the water inlet that I received has some dirt and glue on the end that you attach to a water source, which leads me to believe that it was previously used.  Hope this isn't true of the rest of the machine.  All-in-all, I like the machine very much and would recommend it to others.

title: Great little machine!
text: Packaged nicely.  Arrived on time.  Gets the clothes clean and has reduced our carbon footprint.  No noticeable increase in our power bill, and we use it almost every day to keep our family of 3's hamper constantly empty.  The only negative is that it does leak slightly out of the bottom ever since the first use.  Probably a gasket/seal issue, but it's not bad enough that putting a towel under it does not resolve.  A great alternative to going to the laundromat, and small enough to not be in the way.  When we are done using it (in the kitchen) we store it out of the way in a back room.  My cottage does not have washer/dryer hookups, but between this amazing little washer and a collapsible clothes rack for drying, out laundry has not piled up at all.

title: Worked with it for 6 months
text:
I went out of my way to try to make this work for me in my space but there are a few glaring things you are not ready for:

- You're not going to use this with a bucket out of the box unless you live far away from the laundromat or you're a stay-at-home

- This unit works best if elevated and used with a few garments at a time

- This unit vibrates a lot and makes a lot of noise

I bought this 4/19 and for a while it held its own and kept my clothes clean. Now that we are past the height of summer it did nothing for sweat stains on my lighter shirts and im not a heavy sweater. Also occasionally water would not leave the rinse area for whatever reason making it so i couldnt use the unit (probably soap that foamed too much)

At the end of the day i rate something on whether it solves a problem. While this did save me some money and paid for itself its still going to end up on the curb. I would spend more and get a stronger unit if you absolutely have to go this route. Also something that manages the water, getting water in and out of this thing is a hassle without some kind of pump.

text: I've had this for a while now, and used it enough times to safely say this is one of the best expenditures I've ever made. It cleans very well. I even wash my queen size bedding in it.  Just give yourself a little time to get it figured out - ratio of water to clothes, soap, procedures, etc. The written directions are a joke, but it's not rocket science, and you can't really mess things up. Not as easy as automatics, but does a way better job cleaning, and  I appreciate the control it gives me.  The spinner works so well it's amazing how fast the clothes finish air drying. As I am in an apt. I can take them to the laundry room for a dryer, but often I just skip it, and hang dry them.  It's easy to do small loads or even quickly wash one item if needed. title: Awesome
text:
I purchased this because i do not want to use common laundry because of coronavirus outbreak.

Amazing for apartments, we are 4 member in a family 2 adult,2 kids. You can wash 2 day cloths of full family at one time. Around 4 tshirts,4 lowers, 4-5 kids clothes . Around 15-16 clothes at a time. Dryer is little small but still you can dry around 7-8 adult clothes.

title: Love it!!!!!!
text:
I love this portable washer! It works great for my little studio home as I have on washer/dryer hookups nor space for a full size washer and dryer. As previously noted by other buyers, the sink attachment hose doesn't work unless you go to a hardware store and get a special rig for it. However, I do just fine filling up a bucket with water and pouring it in. The instructions are hilarious as they make no sense whatsoever, but you don't really need them. It's easy to use just by looking at the machine dials.

Washing:

You only use a tiny amount of detergent. If you use to much, you'll have to do an extra rinse cycle. For my rinse cycle, I dilute a small amount of fabric softener so my clothes come out soft and non-wrinkly. You can do a decent sized load in the washer of shirts, underwear, socks, and non-jean shorts. For towels, it washed three full-sized bath towels easily. For jeans, I only do a max of two mens jeans or three women's jeans.

Lint:

It has a lint tray, but it's not very good. Since I have the hose draining into my shower, I put a kitchen strainer in my shower drain to catch all the lint from the clothes. After each load, I clean the lint tray in the machine and wipe up any lint residue in the machine basin.

Drying:

This spin dryer is excellent. Clothes come out barely damp. If I'm washing smaller, light items, I can usually arrange and fit the whole load evenly in the spin dryer and I spin for 2 minutes. For heavier items like jeans or towels, I do them one at a time and set the timer for 1 minute. Make sure to evenly arrange the clothes in the dryer or it'll rattle and move around like crazy and probably wear out your machine quickly. Once dry, I hang them out to dry on my clothing rack dryer. When you're done with all of your laundry, I pick up the machine to get any excess water out of the hose. It's super lightweight so no back problems here!

I've recommended this dryer to all my friends that have to go to the laundromat and they're excited to buy one of their own. It's also a nice looking appliance that fits in tight places.

title: It's ok
text:
After a week of use:
I wish I would have gotten the smaller all in one model and "he" low suds detergent (intended for high efficiency washers) works best, otherwise you have to use so little, you doubt clothes are clean.

title: Works great
text: This little miracle machine will pay for itself in under a year. Drain in a tub or walk in shower.

title: chinese junk
text:
Had a few minor issues but overall, excellent machine. Washes great and the spin dryer is very efficient.
Won't get the clothes 100% clean but it gets them only mildly damp. They line dry in a few hours instead of 10+ hours.
The issues I had was the hose split on the bottom, its a cheap plastic hose but still meh.
I looked at other units, same style but slightly smaller but claim higher load limits. Probably BS and this one s a bit more truthful. I can do maybe 5 pairs of jeans on a max load. I have an old maytag wringer washer and this is so much easier to use.
The lint trap is kind of useless though. Need to buy one of those flower lint traps you throw in. Probably the built in trap is to high.
The spin washer doesn't need to run more than a minute. A 5 minute wring is just as dry as a one minute.

Update: lasted maybe a grand total of five wash loads and the agitator broke. Probably made of cheap plastic.

title: Effective overall, does need some DIY effort
text:
It's small, compact, and requires some tinkering to setup. It's worth the initial effort to adjust and figure out how to adapt to your faucet sink. A shower hose, turkey baster adapter, or bucket method can work. It needs 14 inches ground clearance and good positioning to not move about while cycling.

I can't open a new pipe line or electrical line. This beats wasting money at the laundromat. It's meant for real small daily loads and does spin dry effectively.

Don't expect miracles for $100, calculate the math on your cost per load versus this little tub.

title: Works Surprisingly Well.  Spin Dry Is Amazingly Good.
text:
Works surprisingly well. I have an extra large washer, but the wiring and plumbing in this newly acquired +100 year old farmhouse needs to be completely redone. The plumbing can in no way handle the output of my washing machine, so I bought this for the interim and let the bathtub handle the excess water. The only things to be mindful of is that it'll handle only so much. I can do a couple pairs of shorts, tee shirts, skivvies, and socks in the summer, but only a pair of lined jeans, a hoodie, a tee shirt, skivvies, and socks in the winter - not even a day's worth of clothing. I think the key is that the clothes have to be fully floating to agitate correctly, meaning fill it up to the overflow every time. I typically run two wash cycles for every load to get things clean. Again, I live on a farm and my clothing tends to get pretty dirty, so YMMV.

The spinner is crazy good, but limited as well. I spin half a load at a time for just one minute, then run yet another wash cycle as a rinse cycle, then one minute spins on half loads to finish. From there things go into a Magic Chef MCSDRY1S 120 volt mini dryer which is also surprisingly good.

I keep forgetting to buy laundry detergent, so I've been using a tablespoon or two of Dawn (a good squirt, really) and a couple tablespoons of borax.

title: Amazing choice for small spaces
text:
THREE MONTHS. I waited three months before writing this review because I wanted to accurately attest to the longevity, functionality, practicality and overall efficacy of this machine.

Longevity: So far so good. I haven’t worried at all whether or not it had died on me.

Functionality: It cleans well enough for a machine this size (definitely beats hand washing, which is what I was doing beforehand). Our family loves the outdoors. We’re covered in dirt from head to toe often. I do small loads (less than half the wash bin full) and it cleans well enough. Just wash the load again if all the dirt doesn’t come out in the first wash. It dries about 80% of the water. I do hang out all the clothing I wash to dry. Takes about 20 minutes for most clothing to dry. Jeans and towels take closer to 1 hour, but considering this thing can handle jeans and towels, I’ve got no complaints.

Practicality: I have a 700 square foot apartment. This fits nicely in our tiny kitchen. I barely notice the space it takes up. It’s easy for me to haul it from the kitchen to the bathroom, and I’m not a big person.

Efficacy: I love this machine because it does what it’s designed to do: provide in-home laundry for tiny spaces. It does what I expected it to do. It’s a definite game changer.

Here are things I learned:
1. Pack the washer at most 1/2 full. If it’s too heavy (due to water or clothing), it won’t wash as well.

2. Fill wash bin up to the second line on the filter. Any more and you risk leaking. Don’t up your water bill just to wash water down the drain.

3. The dryer usually holds only 1/2 of what was in the washer.

4. If you’re washing jeans, wash only 1 pair at a time.

5. Less water for smaller loads is fine. I always fill at least to half-way mark to avoid stressing the machine.

6. Turn knob to NORMAL for washing and DRAIN for draining and drying. If you do back to back loads, make sure to switch the knob back to NORMAL so your washing water doesn’t simply drain out.

title: Great compact washer.
text: This portable washer is perfect for my daughter, she lives in a apartment & doesn't have washer & dryer in her unit it was a hassle going to the laundromat. I got this for her & it works great! The clothes comes out almost dry from the spinning cycle, it dries in a couple hours. It will also be great for an RV.

title: Horrible horrible horrible
text: My mother in law bought this for us so it’s not on my amazon account but this washer IS HORRIBLE. First off, it stinks bad every time I use it. And Second, the spin dryer DOESN’T WORK. Third, it has to be super close to an outlet AND water so unless you have them side by side, you have to spend 5 minutes using buckets to fill it.  It’s cheap and horrible. Don’t buy it!

title: Good washer - Bad delivery
text:
This is my first small portable washer. I've used it a few times now, and am satisfied with it getting my clothes clean. The washer side is simple to use, just remember it is only for smaller loads. The side with the spinner works well, but I was disappointed in the size of the spin basket. It is half the size of the washing basket, so you have to spin half a load of clothes at a time. Having said that, the spinner gets results like a regular washing machine. All the water was spun out, and it took little time for my clothes to dry (hanging up).
The washing machine is rather noisy, especially if you, like me, have to sit it in the bathtub when washing, mostly for water drainage purposes. I recommend a small sturdy stand to put the washer on, so the drain hose can be laid over the side of the bathtub to drain into (washer must sit slightly higher than the tub or area its draining into; at least 2-4 inches at minimum).
The reasons I gave a 3 out of 5 star rating were:
1 - the machine, when washing, is very noisy
2- ***The package, upon arrival to my home, was torn up, literally falling apart, being held together by the plastic straps, with the bottom loose from the rest of the box, as well as improper packaging (no padding inside box and the machine was just jostling around inside). The box, the machine arrived in, also looked as if it had been opened and repackaged (new packing tape sloppily over the original tape). Once removed from the box, the machines electrical power cord was chewed up. It appeared to have been caught under something and scraped across.
All in all, it appeared the washing machine was a returned product, to Amazon, which was sent to me in extremely poor condition. Further more, I never extended any indication I'd accept a used product, especially when paying full price (cost of machine brand new).

title: Still happy after 6 years of constant domestic use.
text:
I'm updating my remarks from 6 years ago by saying that I remain happy and very impressed with this machine. I use it frequently, several times a week. I've learned to maximize it by doing small loads often.

I still have a lint problem considering my two cats and use a lot of lint rollers and my vacuum cleaner.

Nevertheless, if one is willing to do the manual components of monitoring the wash, this machine is well worth the expense. Very durable and helpful compared to using the coin laundries. If you live alone and don't have laundry hookups, this is a great answer. Easily lifts in and out of the shower for use.

Review on Purchase 2016:
I'm giving this five stars because it surpassed my expectations in every way. It is more substantial and heavier than I expected, and the motor is up to the task of washing a queen bedspread. Plus, I've been using a coin operated laundry for 5 years, and this is so much better than making that journey, waiting in line, and all the other nuisances of sharing facilities. But to be prepared to enjoy this, first toss out any idea you may have of "automatic washing machines". This is not automatic.
1) The connector to the sink is ridiculous and won't work in most cases. But it's easy. I place my washer in the shower and simply unscrew the sprayer head and attach the hose to fill.
2) similarly, the electric cord is too short. I'm using an extension cord but caution that of course no extension should be allowed to drag on the floor depending on where the outlet is because should the hose become detached one may experience a spray of water all over the floor and bathroom which could cause the shock referred to in the directions.
3) The machine will seem to start and stop - that's o.k. The rotator is simply changing direction.
4) Naturally, you will have to drain and refill for as many rinses as are required.
5) the clothes seem to get thoroughly washed, but cat hair is still a problem. Electric dryers remove cat hair. The filter in this washer does collect lint, but there is still quite a bit of cat hair on the clothes after a round in the spin drier. Never mind. Cat hair is a manual process anyway.
I've been using this machine about a week nearly every day and am pretty happy with it.

title: Loud
text: I brought this because I'm disabled and it's hard for me to get down the basement steps to use washer in basement of my apartment building. I love the unit but it is loud and at times smell like burnt rubber.  I will be ordering a different brand.

title: Espacio reducido
text:
Compre esta lavadora en Mayo de Este año,antes de hacerlo leí muchas criticas,casi todas positivas,me gustó mucho como lava,deja la ropa bien limpia,aunque la manguera que trae para llenar la lavadora no entra en ningún grifo,y la de botar el agua es muy corta,a pesar de estos inconvenientes están a feliz con mi compra,pero con tan sólo unos pocos usos el agua de la lavadora comenzó a pasarse a la centrifuga,entonces está no esprimia la ropa,no se si es un defecto de fábrica o que,ahora no puedo usar la centrífuga y cuando lavo tengo que voltear la para que bote toda el agua que tiene la centrifuga..Me comunique con el vendedor y quedó en remplasarla,no se si la otra me hará lo mismo,estoy realmente disgustada con está situacion...gracias

Espere un tiempo para volver a evaluar esta mini lavadora,el vendedor se comunico conmigo inmediatamente y me mando una nueva lavadora,esta ya casi tiene un ano y no me ha dado ningun problema,actualmente veo que ha subido mucho de precio,bueno para mi lo importante es que sigue lavando muy bien,Gracias

title: Hurry Up and Buy!
text:
Excellent Excellent machine, sturdy washes Excellent. I have had no problems at all. I love this washing machine!

Update: 3/26/19 Still works EXCELLENT. I am very happy with my purchase.

title: Clothes come out clean!
text: Love this machine. Best $ I’ve ever spent.

title: Pretty Good Machine
text:
The Good: it works quickly. 5 minutes to wash and 5 more to rinse (I rinse twice), and 1 minute to spin dry. The spin dry really works well!! It’s small so I can take it RVing when I am camped at the same place for a long time. The price is great.

The Bad: Loads are small. I can wash 1 hooded sweat shirt, 2 t-shirts, and a couple of pairs of socks. You can spin dry 1/2 of that load at a time .
I rinse twice, even when using only a little detergent. You are better off using not enough detergent then too much. The machine shakes a bit. It runs for 5 seconds, then stops for a few, then runs again. Sometimes I have to hold the machine at the start of the spin cycle until it gets going so it doesn’t shake so much.
I have found the smaller the load the better. My usual load is 2 t-shirts, 2 pairs of shorts, 2 pair of underwear, and a few pairs of socks.
I use a hose to fill the machine, drain into a 5 gallon bucket and dump the bucket in the sewer I’m connected to in the campground. When I get time, I will rig the drain hose to a small piece of garden hose and drain right into sewer system I can do away with bucket.
After spin drying, you could hang clothes up to dry, but I have a small 110v dryer that dries the whole load in about 35 min or so.
Overall, it has worked well for 2 weeks.
It keeps me from going to laundry mat twice a month, so if the washer and dryer last for 12-18 months of use, it will pay for itself.

title: Life saver
text: Just perfect for a apartment

title: Twists clothes
text:
Works well. Clothes do seem to end up more twisted than with other mini or full size washers. The spinner does a great job extracting water. Many clothes (light weight - not jeans) are wearable an hour after air drying.

UPDATE : Almost three months of regular use and going strong. I find the intake hoses are too small to be efficient so I use a bucket and fill manually. That’s a bit more work but faster overall.

title: This product is very good, with excellent features, but spin dryer will disappoint you very soon
text:
This was my review when i started using the machine: This product is very good, with excellent features, and it works perfectly, but they should make drainage hose longer.

Now today: Get ready to be disappointed. After three months of using this machine, the spin dryer broke down. You'd think it would last .longer, but no it won't. I thought those people who left a bad review about the spin dryer were exaggerating, but unfortunately for me they weren't, and the sad part is that they don't have warranties to cover damages/ break downs. All you can do is wait till the washer component also gives out on you then you can throw it away.

title: A True Game Changer!  Small Living Life Saver :-)
text:
[[VIDEOID:95037017fece0fa9597755118ff29a40]] After a few months of hand washing, I was ready to quit! This is my review and demonstration of the Costway Twin Tub Washing Machine, sold through Giantex, available on Amazon. It's a wonderful little machine that's incredibly spacious and relatively quiet. It gets out even the toughest stains (my daughter loved yogurt and mac and cheese!) for 100 bucks.

I was NOT endorsed for this video and I did NOT receive this item for free or at a discount. I reviewed it because I wanted to and I love spreading the word about good products that work and make women's lives easier! :-)

title: Looks are deceiving, This Thing Really Works!!!
text:
I guess I'm spoiled because I'm used to living in a home with a washer and dryer. I was forced this year to move into an apartment that did not have washer/ dryer hookups. Went to the community laundry mat one time and decided I would try and find an alternative.

I ordered this. It arrived quickly packaged very well and when I opened it I laughed at it because it was so small and made of plastic I just assumed it was a piece of crap that wouldn't
Work and that I had been ripped off. I even began the process of returning it. But the Box got lost in the shuffle of moving and it took me two months to find it. By then, I owned it.

I finally got around to breaking it in. I've been up all night washing clothes in this thing and I am amazed at how clean it's getting everything and how dry the spinner is getting everything. Some of my clothes were spun dry enough I could have worn them right then and there.

This would be perfect if the hoses were longer and if the rinse cycle was longer instead of having to turn the dial every 5 minutes to add more time.

It's already paid for itself. I spent about $100 for it and I have done more than $100 worth of laundry since I started using it. I bought a dolly for it and it easily moves from room to room as needed and I can put it in the closet can put it out of sight when company comes but I leave it out because it's so cute and everyone is so curious about it. I do recommend this for anyone living in a small space who hates going to the public laundromat.

December 2016 update

I meant everything I said in the above review, however using this thing daily for almost a year, I find myself wishing this thing had a better inlet hose, a better drain hose, and a pump to drain the water out. Also even though it's like I wish it had casters or something. I'm getting tired of lugging it around LOL. Finding replacement hoses for this thing is a nightmare, at some point I just gave up and decided to go ahead and buy a fully automatic portable washing machine because it has the Quick Connect hose, a pump and wheels. I hope I enjoy it as much as I have enjoyed this one.

title: perfect
text:
I have now used this at least 20 times, and it works great. BC it is portable, it is smaller and so I don't recommend trying to wash three bath towels at a time (too heavy when wet), but it is great for smaller loads and especially for intimate apparel.

A friend even got one for their cabin (has a generator).

title: One Star
text: Worked great for two cycles, then it just stopped.  Tried to troubleshoot with no luck.  Pile of junk

title: Perfect!
text:
I've had This for a few months. This is surprisingly light. It was easy for my 14 year old daughter to bring up the stairs to our bathroom. We use it daily and love it. It's not a full size washer of course but it's perfect for our small apartment. The washers and dryers in our apartment buildings are gross and expensive. So is the laundry mat. This saves so much time and money. The washer holds quite a bit of clothes. You can wash a sheet or two, kids blankets, and any clothing with the exception of maybe a very large winter coat. The dryer is smaller than the washer so keep that in mind. One wash load is two dry loads. They don't spin 100% dry but pretty close and definitely not dripping. An hour or so (depending on fabric and size) hanging up and they are dry! Highly recommended. Plus, grab the super cheap 5 year warranty just in case!
Also, an easier way to fill is just taking our shower head with hose and putting it directly into the washer tub and letting it fill. Before that we used buckets of water. The hose isn't the best.

title: Awesome Little Washer/Dryer
text: Awesome washer/dryer. Clothes is pretty close to dry, doesn't damage clothing. So much more gentle than a washer or dryer. Small and compact but gets the job done. Only problem is the hose is short but that really isn't and big deal for my family.

title: The breakdown of time, water consumption, and efficiency...
text:
I'm impressed. This little machine packs a lot of power. I am happy to list both pros and con's of this machine. I've owned another brand (Panda) and model of this same type of machine. I bought it roughly a year ago to date and love it. It also gets clothes exceedingly clean and fresh, no spot or stain goes untouched. Even hard to get out grease spots from cars, etc. Both the Panda brand comparable machine and this Conway machine accomplish the objectives. With that being said, here are the Pros to owning this machine verses other similar compact twin tub washing machines. And verses regular sized standard machines

1. If used properly it does in fact save water. I've done a comparison to the amount of water used in my standard full size washing machine and this particular model of twin tub compact washer. Again, IF used properly, and you do not over load the machine,(which means a small load -roughly 1 pair heavy denim jeans, 2 cotton knit shirts some socks, 3-4 pair of boxer or panties, a couple of hand towels/ OR a lightweight sheet set & pillow cases/ OR 2 large bath towels, 2 hand towels & 2 wash cloths) you use roughly 6-7 gallons on each cycle. Compared to 15 gallons per cycle for similar sized small load in a regular full sized washer. By cycle I mean each stage of washing. The main wash cycle, then a refill after spinning (rinse/softener added), spin again, then the final rinse & spin. You have the option to rinse while spinning each spin cycle however I find you can opt that aspect out and the clothes are still rinsed properly. It saves on wear & tear on the spin motor. (they tend to burn out easily on these machines if over loaded or weighed down)
*Total wash time can be narrowed down to 19-20 minutes if your cloths aren't heavily soiled. Breakdown on that time table is as follows:
5 minutes for wash cycles (drain while adding clothes to the spinner to save time, clothes will spin out fine even when drippy wet)
2 minutes on initial drain
2 minutes on spin cycle (heavy clothes will need maybe 3 minutes)
3 minutes on rinse refill - fabric softener added during this stage (when small load and with 6-7 gallons of water used)
2 minutes on second spin cycle
3 minutes on final rinse refill and cycle
2 minutes on final spin/ Then goes straight to clothes line or dryer depending on weather.
19-20 minutes total time.
**Heavier loads, larger loads or loads that require soaking, or longer washing & spin cycles will of course, take longer.

2. Compared to other machines of comparable size/function others take longer to drain with the pump drain feature. This is a gravity drain which requires it to be elevated off the floor /surface & near a drain outlet to work properly. This can be accomplished by placing in a large full sized shower stall or tub in a bathroom, OR on a counter in the kitchen/laundry room then drain fed into a basin/sink. OR placed on a physical lift/sturdy flat wide object then placed near floor drainage in basement, etc. Simply switch to drain option and it does the work rather quickly. The Panda brand machine uses a motorized pump drain & can take quite awhile to actually pump out the water. Usually 10 minutes compared to the 3 minutes this Conway machine takes using gravity with no motor pump to break down or wear out (which happened to my panda machine which thankfully was under warranty)

3. You can do larger loads even though the wash basin & spin tub are smaller. This is due to the power of both the washer & spin motors. I've washed 4 bath towels, 4 hand towels 4 wash cloths at once, they all got clean. I've washed a full king sized heavy jersey knit sheet set, it came out fine, highest water level used (10 gallons). Still a water saver compared to a standard regular sized machine. Times for each cycle & spin were slightly longer (roughly 2 mins added to each timer) with a normal full sized small load of clothes (5 knit tops, 4 pair of socks, a pair of lightweight pants, 3-4 pair underwear.) water was filled to just bellow the lint filter top and run on the lowest setting for 15 mins. Everything came out clean & fine.

I've read in comments that people have difficulty with some clothes coming out torn. I've never had this happen on either machines of this kind. don't over load your clothing or add delicate fabrics like thin knits and silks or light weight fabrics to the machine on a heavy load and not enough water, and set your delicate fabrics to soft cycles and you should be fine. I've washed my satin nightgowns, lace panties, or dress slacks for my boy & husband several times and it's all in tact. Read your labels on your clothing & use common sense and you will be fine.

Ok so the cons:
1. If you aren't able to stay focused on just doing the laundry at each interval it can be longer to do a single load given each phase of the load requires manual exchange from washer tub to spin tub & back again.

2. You have to e mindful of the water filling the basin. It is manual. You can choose to hook up the hose to a water source and fill it OR opt to use buckets, gallons, ect to fill it by hand but that's a bit more time consuming and lots heavy lifting. I opted to hook it up to my bathroom shower outlet by unscrewing the shower head and using a small o-ring to tighten the hose to the pipe itself. A simple flat head screw driver (or butter knife if you're lacking a flat head screwdriver) then tighten it so there are no leaks. I used the rubber bulb (top) of a turkey baster with a cross slit cut into the rounded top side and attached it to the faucet with the panda machine hose. However the hose on this machine is slightly more narrow/smaller and wont fit the same.. It's a bit DIY depending on your water outlet/faucet/ pipes, hose, etc. but nothing complex. I recommend using a timer set on your mobile phone or a dial timer to set each fill basin so you don't have an overflow problem. (I found this out the hard way when I didn't realize this machine would not automatically shut off the water fill like my regular machine) So a timer helps..ALOT.

3. If you're looking for a quiet machine that makes little to no noise or expect that there will be no water touching your skin, ever OR if you're looking for large capacity or little effort in doing laundry, this is probably NOT the machine for you. If you're into saving water, your time is valuable , and you just like really clean clothes that can be done in a simple efficient machine that may make a little normal racket from time to time on a spin cycle winding down, or you need a decent good machine for a small space then this is your dream come true.

TIPS:
I use HC friendly laundry pods (specifically Gain Pods). One pod for each load gets everything really clean & fresh without too many suds. I use Oxi Powder (3 tablespoons for 6-7 gallons of water, 1/3 cup for anything over 7 gallons water) This helps to deodorize, sanitize and is a color safe "bleach" without using harsh chlorine that also wears down the thin plastic hoses quicker.
I also place my washer on heavy grade plastic cube crates tied together with zipties to keep them stable and together to elevate it for the gravity fed drain then place it in the tub in the bathroom. The water doesnt splash on the floor & the drain water goes right into the tub & down the drain, no fuss no mess. Any leaking it may or may not have ( I personally have not experienced any leaking with mine but some customers have said this can be an issue for them) is not a worry since everything is contained in the tub/stall. The electrical plug obviously goes outside the tub & up away from the water source. A small watt appropriate extension cord can be helpful in keeping everything dry & helps if you need more length in the cord to reach an outlet. Be mindful of the wattage that your outlet cranks out so you don't blow a circuit running the machine in the bathroom on a circuit not meant for that kind of motor/ampwattage(this has not been an issue for me, just wanted to include it)

All in all this is a great machine. Very efficient. Since I now own 2 of these types of machines for the price of one standard full sized machine my clothes have never been cleaner.and is a huge time saver for me to be able to do 2 separate loads of 2 different kinds at the same time. It's also space savvy for anyone in a tiny home, apartment, RV, Boathouse, or just a really space conscious person. It's light weight & can be reasonably lifted to store away. This is a lighter machine than the other brands of comparable capacity, function & size. significantly lighter in weight than my Panda machine of comparable size. I also recommend getting the warranty on it. For the price, it's a good safety measure to have in the event any mechanical issues or parts are faulty. The customer service is friendly and helpful if you are also friendly and polite.

title: Great option if you don't have a washer
text: Although it's a little more time consuming to wash than using a regular washing machine, it works well and beats having to go to the laundry mat. Watch the videos others posted on their reviews to learn how to use properly as the instructions aren't really helpful.

title: Powerful little washer
text: This little washer cleans clothes, sheets and rugs very well. I recently moved into an apartment that didn't have hook ups. I set this washer on top of my portable dryer and set it in the bathroom next to my tub. I fill the left side of the washer with whatever temp water I choose and put the soap in. It agitates really well and the drain cycle is pretty handy. The spinner is very powerful and get a lot of the water out. Over all I'm very happy with this purchase and have been recommending to friends. The only part I dislike it the fact that you have to monitor the washer. It's not like a standard washer where you set it and go about your business. It definitely takes time out of the day but it gets the job done.

title: It really cleans your clothes
text: I didn’t even knew these things existed after seeing it on YouTube. It really washes your clothes as long as you don’t put too much in at once. I even wash my small fleece blankets and jeans. The spin dryer removes most of the water from the clothes and it’s like my clothes are close to being dry. I live in a studio apartment and it doesn’t take up too much space.

title: Great item
text: I’m pretty impressed.. I was reading many reviews before buying it and it does it job . It dries your clothing for about 95%. . It’s not too loud

title: Love this little machine for washing my many strange orthopedic ...
text: Love this little machine for washing my many strange orthopedic socks, wash cloths, and clothes that need immediate attention (like kitchen towels) or a quick turnaround--even a small blanket. Can soak stained items overnight in a combo of Oxy Clean, Clorox 2 and Cascade. Saved some items with this soak. Socks can't go in the dryer anyway.  Also added a few drops of essential oils and sometimes vinegar to the final rinse since I work in a college next to the Vet tech department and these oils discourage critters and bugs. When you are allergic to bug bites, it is nice to be able to do this easily. Helps me participate when main laundry is two floors down in my house and my knees  are challenged. Really does a good job cleaning. I set the unit on a rolling base--covered the base with a memory foam bath mat which cushions the unit, catches drips, and stabilizes it during spin cycles. Roll it easily to the shower to drain it. I thought about it a long time. Glad I finally bought one.

title: Great machine, great price with little work for your laundry
text:
[[VIDEOID:aa9bc148b07cb648ec5088ecbd46d27c]] Works great, actually better than the laundromat a lot of the time. The real time saver is in the drying attending time, 5 mins to spin dry then the rest is air dry. Swap our your dryer sheets for fabric softener/vinegar mixture, run that in your rinse cycle, then spin dry and air dry for at least half a day. Depends a little on the humidity of your environment.

We have standard washer dryer hookups, finances and pending hand me down are why we needed an alternative for the moment. Bought some extension hoses and have the machine elevated to drain out of the outlet pipe and it’s minimal maintenance through the washing process. This does a through job, gets the dirty water stains out of the knees of my pants and the poop stains out of bf’s undies. It is lots of little loads but you save more water, and combined with the detergent and machine operating costs of the laundromat this is definitely worth it. Feels like I’m not even doing laundry but for maybe 20 mins max for my loads, and that’s just a one way driving trip time for me, and I get to stay home and hang out on my couch while I wait!

I do wish it had a beeping timer to remind you when the cycle finished but you could buy a kitchen timer or set a timer on your phone. The cycles aren’t more than 15 min for the longest one so as long as you remember to check it it isn’t a huge issue.

title: This product is great. I have only done one small load
text:
This product is great. I have only done one small load, but everything worked great.

2) The bottom of the unit was also dirty (I had to clean the unit before I used it)
3) The washing lid had scratches all over the top, and a sticker. I don't know what the sticker was because it appeared someone attempted to take the sticker off but couldn't get all it and gave up, so I am guessing that's where the scratches came from.
***The spinner lid had a clear wrapping on the lid to protect it, so I don't know why the washing lid didn't.***

I would recommend this.

I no longer have to go downstairs to a community laundry room I share with 27 other apartments. Thank goodness!!!

title: Four Stars
