title: Spinner broke within 3 months
text: The spinner broke after 3 months..... Now i have to buy something else. Not happy.... 2 stars because it cost the same as going to the Landry matt this whole time. Would not recommend to anyone.

title: Fantastic Beast!
text:
The product is listed as a Giantex washer but my washer, as in the image of the product in the ad, is as a Costway product. I don't know what the difference is - The Costway Giantex model?

I have four floors of living space and the laundry room is in the lowest level (basement level). I have a full-size washer and dryer, but little motivation to walk down to the laundry room to wash and dry small loads. I bought this machine for the bedroom levels. This washer makes it possible to wash items you might need the next day, but are too few to wash in a large washer. It is also good for keeping teens from creating massive piles of self-walking laundry.

Without an agitator, make no mistake about it, this small lightweight washer is, in essence, a miniature top loader and is highly effective in removing dirt and stains. I have used this machine often since purchasing it. There are two wash cycles: "soft" (for delicate clothing) and normal. The normal cycle is actually pretty strong. The normal cycle removed a kid-friendly food stain from a white shirt - pre-treating the shirt as I normally would. I have also washed a queen-size sheet set with room left over. I purchased this particular machine because of its relatively large wash capacity.

There are so many pros, with so few cons. It may be annoying to have to transition clothing from the wash basin to the spinner, and back, but even then, it takes less time to wash a load of clothing in this mini top loader than my full-size front loader. The spinner is as amazing as cited in other reviews. The clothes are nearly dry when leaving the final spin cycle.

The only real con is the hose attachment. It is useless to fill the washer. Others have posted solutions to avoid the issue of the useless fill-hose. If you raise the washer high enough to avoid the electrical outlet when draining, you can place the washer in the shower and use the shower hose to fill to wash tub.

My only other concern about this machine is not so much a concern but a gentle warning. It would be easy to become overly reliant on using it - which means you could end up using more water than you save. HE washers use between 15 - 30 gallons per wash. This machine, when washing a full load, uses around 5 gallons.

Overall, this is one of the best purchases I have made through Amazon. My daughter-in-law loved it when she saw it. I am planning to buy one for her and my son to help them manage the endless toddler/preschooler laundry battle. This machine is advertised as great for people who are in small spaces or who don’t have ready access to a larger washer/ dryer, I think it is far more flexible than that. It is great to have a second washer, without the plumbing nightmares that come along with that.

title: Its worth every dime! Best investment yet!
text: I absolutely love this machine! I live in a small studio apt. and there is no washer/dryer. This little machine washes as well as a regular size washer and the spinner practically spins my clothes dry! I even talked my sister and a friend into buying one. They love it too!!

title: Ok
text: Ok for the price

title: this is a great machine to buy

title: NOPE
text: Received as a gift. It was filthy, used, and broken in multiple places. The box it came in was damaged and totally soaked. I tried to give the machine the benefit of the doubt. Cleaned it off and decided to give it a go. Filled it up with water and it leaked everywhere! Words cannot describe how disappointed I was with this machine. Something THIS expensive should not be so cheaply built and they should never send out used ones unless the customer knows they are receiving one. Never again. Ever.

title: DEFECTIVE UNIT & VERY POOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT
text:
The first thing I noticed upon receiving this machine was that the unit had rusty nails and was dirty and scuffed up as if it was a return. I contacted the third party Seller to exchange but they did not initially respond. I then contacted Amazon to complain. The Seller finally responded by asking me to take several pics, make a video and to complete their questionnaire. Annoyed, I contacted Amazon a second time and they sent the Seller a notice asking them to simply replace without me having to do the video, pics and questionnaire. The machine was now out of stock so I decided to try it out while waiting for a resolution. Well, the spin cycle stopped working after two uses and there was a lot of loud clanking from the motor on the washing side - although I only had 5 t-shirts in the load. I followed up again with the Seller but never received a response. I was under warranty so a return/exchange should not have been an issue. I once again followed up with Amazon and expressed that I wanted to resolve the matter while still within the warranty/exchange window. Amazon assured me not to worry, that a record of the issue had been documented and the matter would be resolved.

Please note that Amazon would have fulfilled the replacement but they did not have the same washing machine in stock as the third party seller.

When I called Amazon yet again, I was now outside of the return window. Amazon apologized, and expressed embarrassment for how this return/exchange had been botched. Amazon subsequently sent another message to the Seller and assured me that I would receive a refund if the Seller didn't respond within 48 hours. Period. Well, the Seller did not respond. I called Amazon to request the refund I was promised. However, the representative I spoke with about-faced on what was promised, saying there's nothing they could do since I was outside of the return window...(sigh). I requested the matter to be escalated but once the pandemic hit, Amazon ceased its phone support and I can't get anywhere via their online support system.

So, BUYER BEWARE. If you order one of these portable washers, I strongly recommend purchasing one that is fulfilled by Amazon and spending the extra money for an extended warranty.

title: So cute and fun
text: Love this machine. I add detergent and cycle it 1.5 times then I drain add more water with softener and cycle it another time+ drain and add a few pieces to spinner at a time and spin up to 3 times per load depending what's in it. Mine broke after 3 weeks due to electrical problems but that was probably on my side due to RV issues.

title: Great job cleaning clothes, is easy to move, a money-saver, but a little time-consuming.
text: I've used mine nearly 100 times (I've kept a tally) (2 times for each load, 1 wash and 1 rinse cycle). So far, this unit has worked flawlessly. Here's how I use mine: put the unit in my bathtub, add my clothes, fill the washer tub using two 5-gallon buckets (for max loads), run the washer then drain it, put clothes in extractor, put back in washer and refill, empty rinse water then put clothes in extractor, hang clothes to dry or take to laundromat (which is close to my apartment). The extractor spins out most of the water in the first minute, which is all I do before the rinse cycle. I set the timer for about 3 or 4 minutes after the rinse cycle. This unit has been a money-saver (it costs $2.50 per load to wash at the laundromat).

title: Great washer, I've used it a few times now ...
text: Great washer, I've used it a few times now and the only problem I had is that sometimes the spinner doesn't work.  I called the number they give you for customer support and they offered to refund me half the price of the machine to try and get it fixed locally or to send me a replacement.  I took the refund and my husband and I tinkered with it, turns out that the safety feature that prevents the spinner from going while the lid is open was loose or something (it looks like a flat thin piece of plastic with a paper clip on it).  We just tightened the wire by moving the paper clip to a lower hole (you'll know what I mean if you're looking at it) and a viola!  It worked!  It still has problems going if I do too many spin cycles in a row, but as long as I wait 5-15 minutes in between it works great

title: Easy peasy lemon squeezee
text:
Little background...I'm a Ferry Captain that lives and works on a river, we have a flood plain that prevents alot of discharge into our septic, as we are also a national park we have alot of visitors that flush toilets that also adds to the septic. This discharges less than 5gallons of water and is just perfect. (Keep in mind I only use this when park is closed)
Since the unit is so light I place it in my bathtub disconnect my shower head and fill and then drain that way.
Since I can get pretty dirty with grease and whatnot I only use dawn dishsoap as my detergent on the case it ever makes it into the river. I understand that may be odd but everything comes out very clean and after 5 hours hanging in my bathroom with a small space heater its better than laundering my clothes.
I even tried some of my winter clothes (flannel carharts) and I was impressed.

title: The solution to not having an in-unit washer dryer
text:
I moved to NYC a few months ago and after trying several wash and fold places that lost and damaged my clothing or just didn’t get it clean, I was desperate. I ordered this based on the reviews and I am so thrilled with how amazingly it works! It’s portable and small enough that I can store it in a closet and pull it out when I use it. But it’s big enough to fit about 10 pounds of clothing in the washer! I can even wash my full size sheets in here. It has WAY more power than you’d think, especially the spinner. It gets clothes about 75% dry. As someone who always likes to hang dry everything, this is perfect.
Yes, it’s a bit tedious to use. But to me, it’s worth it to not have to lug my laundry multiple blocks and pay to have it ruined or not get clean. Like other reviews state, the water hook up doesn’t really work, I just use a bucket to fill and drain it. With some quick DIY skills you could make the water hook up work though.
Overall, this washer gets clothes super clean and is a perfect solution for people who don’t want to have to do laundry outside of their home!

text:

I got a used one with damaged parts. The filter had been busted previously and they taped and then glued it back together. The tubes are gross and used. The inside has a blue stain. I tried to scrub it out but it didn't come out. I can't believe they send obviously used washers and expect people to be fine with it.

I did test it, I was impressed with how it washed a load of towels. The spin dryer did a really great job at getting the towels around 80% dry.

The crap thing is that I'm moving full time into my RV next week and I know they're not going to get this sorted to send me a new one before I don't have an address to send it to. Shady. I'm so happy I got the extended warranty from Amazon now so that I can replace it when I inevitably find out why the original owner returned this one!

title: Inexpensive alternative to replacing washer/dryer
text:
update -- a year and a half later and this is still going strong! One of the best Amazon purchases I've ever made compared with the cost of buying a full size washer/dryer.

I have had my dryer, washing machine and the associated plumbing conk out on me in the past year. Things break faster than I can afford to fix them...enter this nifty little washing machine. It really does as advertised and is a great solution for my problems. Goodbye semi-clean clothes, this little washer requires little soap to get a good suds going. You just fill and wash. Drain and fill to rinse then spin. Right now I'm using a bucket to fill it and it's no big deal.

The unit handles more than you'd think, I was able to wash two king size sheets in one load and several shirts, leggings and a pair of jeans in another. The spin unit is very handy, gets most of the water out though I do hang things up overnight to complete drying. I have it set up in a shower that is not used and just let it drain there, I don't need to elevate it as some people do. I am thoroughly pleased with this purchase and would recommend it to anybody stuck in a situation where it's not practical to have a full size washerdryer or where funds are limited (I feel your pain)

title: Beautiful in the beginning.... but
text:
I purchased one of these througha different vendor. It couldn’t be any easier to use. After reading all the reviews and such I chose to just park mine in the bathtub and fill by aiming the shower head to spray directly into the washer.

I started with a bit of extra caution for the first few loads until I got a full measure of the pattern of use. It always kept up with whatever I came up with to wash. I even decided to challenge it with some bedding basics just to see what it could handle. The really big stuff from my queen size bed wouldn’t fit. But the sheets and some lightweight blankets were no challenge at all.

I was absolutely thrilled by the new found independence and convenience this gadget brought to me. And then...... it stopped.

I checked the fuse.. I checked the timer.... I checked the belt. I’m no electrician by any means. I’m less of a mechanic. If anyone has a repair manual I can keep trying to fix it but I’m a bit disappointed that it only lasted me for 5 months. Not every day use either. I’m not interested in buying a new machine after just 5 months. So, I am off to explore longer lasting options.

I place my shower head in the washer, fill him up, add detergent (no more than a 3rd of recommrnded or you'll be clear washing a few times) and turn the knob. When it's done, I drain it right in the shower, add clear water with a smidgen of fabric softner, then hit the button again. When that's done, I put a third at a time in the spinner to dry no heat just spins like a centrifuge the water out. I find that 2 x's is perfect. title: CONVENIENCE OVER EVERYTHING
text:
I live in a house with roommates but there is no laundry machine :-( I HATE public laundromats and it's ultimately the biggest hassle because I have to stay there until it's done since I don't feel comfortable leaving and coming back. After debating and researching for a couple months, I finally decided to purchase this. I'M SO HAPPY I DID!!! Having my very own mini laundry machine (Washer & Spinner) in the comfort of my own home/room is amazing! I watched many video reviews and read all the amazon reviews prior to purchasing it, and again when I received it before testing it out. The manual is a joke and hard to understand so don't even bother. Although, it does mention to keep away from water. Many users seem to keep it in their bathroom/shower, but I want to avoid any/all risks so it's actually in my room!.

The main complaints with this appliance are that the drains/tubes are short/small/useless. Because it is drained by gravity (the appliance must be elevated so that the tube can be facing down to drain all the water. I have a mini tv stand and just placed the machine on top of it. I also have a huge bucket which I placed under/next to it so that it can drain all the water. I don't use the thinner tube that you're supposed to use to fill the machine with clean water. I simply use another huge bucket and pour the water into the washer tub directly. That way, I don't have the struggle/problem of the tube being too short or small (seriously, it's useless.) My bedroom is right next to the front door so I have easy access to pour in/out water from the garden hose in the front yard too.

You can wash up to 15 minutes each load and can choose "Normal" or "Soft" setting. I washed my delicates and socks together for my first load (roughly 20 undies and 15 pairs of socks) they are all very thin and light so it actually all fit without any worry/paranoia that it was too big of a load. I poured buckets of water so that all the clothes were soaked and until an inch or two of water was above the load. NEVER FILL TO THE TOP! It needs space to swish/wash! I set it on "Soft" and for the full 15 minutes. You only need two or three tablespoons of detergent since the load is much smaller than your average laundry machine. Once it started, it would spin for around 5 seconds and stop for a few seconds. And it repeated the same spin/stop process for the entire 15-minute cycle. A word of advice, make sure there aren't any long strands of hair or strings/loose ends because my lacey undies got kind of tangled. But I purchased a mesh bag for future washes of delicates which solves that problem.

After the wash cycle ended, I placed the drain tube into my empty bucket and then changed the setting to "Drain." (It will drain as soon as you change the setting so you better make sure there's something at the end of that tube because the dirty water will begin draining immediately!) Once the draining is finished, keep the setting at "Drain." Then place HALF your load (I just separated undies and socks) into the Spin/Dry tub on the right. Place the rubber/plastic lid (provided) directly on top of the load and lay it flat. Close the tub and set your spin time. I set it for 3 minutes. The spin is very powerful! After the first 3-minute cycle, I touched the load and the top portion of the load was 75% dry and the bottom portion was 50% dry (AFTER ONLY 3 MINUTES!!!) I put the bottom of the load on top to get a more even dry and spun again for another 3 minutes. After that, my entire load was 80% dry and ready to hang on my drying rack! It was very clean and I was so impressed!!! Then I proceeded to the second half of the load to spin/dry. Keep in mind it's still on the Drain setting. So you can't wash and dry at the same time. But it's so quick anyway so it doesn't even matter! During the whole process, I'm free to do whatever I want since I'm not at some public laundromat. The convenience is worth the whole bucket thing in my opinion if I compare it to public laundromat visits.

The volume level is average. Definitely not silent but it isn't obnoxiously loud like many laundry machines tend to be. For some reason, I imagined the machine to be smaller but it is a very good size for a mini machine. I am still amazed that this sells for under $100.00 honestly even if it was a little over, I think I would still buy it and it would be worth every penny.

Always remember to drain after every wash and empty out the little filter inside the washer tub. Remember to unplug the machine after you're done using it. Keep away from direct sunlight or water to prevent any damage. Make sure if you do elevate the machine, it is on top of something flat and sturdy!

This is literally my favorite purchase of the year!

Update 09/05/18: My mini washer just died! Started a load then noticed I didn't hear it washing. Sure enough the washing tub was not rotating at all. I have always been careful not to stress the machine by overloading. In fact, this time there was 1 pair pants and a pair of shorts. That was it. I checked the fuse inside and that seems fine, so I have no clue. There's no bands loose or off and I know very little about these type of repairs. It was a great little machine but should have lasted more than 2 months.

title: My new best friend
text:
I LOVE this machine. It is exactly what I wanted. I spent several days reading reviews on all the different styles, brands and top 10 lists from credible websites. In the end, I felt like this was the best choice.

It took 2.5 weeks to receive it from purchase date, which was earlier than the delivery date Amazon estimated. It was worth the wait.

The instructions provided are poorly translated and not very helpful. I used other reviews and videos for clarity and found that to be more useful.

Some tips:
1. I usually put enough clothes in the main tub to fill the spin tub two times, you'll be surprised how much better this machine cleans your clothes compared to a standard washer.

2. Use the water inlet on the spin tub provided to maximize each load and have fresh clothes each time.

3. I re-use the same water in the main tub 2 or 3 times before it's drained and then let the machine rest for a few hours. I don't want to overload the motor.

4. You don't need much soap to get the job done, I am saving on the cost of detergent and not having to pay for each load.

5. I bought a Rinse-a-roo and use that to fill the machine on each side.

I am still taking the big stuff to my laundromat -- comforters, towels and large blankets. But everything else is washed through this machine and it's such a relief not having to drag 6-10 loads down my stairs, to the car, into the laundromat and back home again. The money and time saved are well worth the cost.

My biggest concern from reading reviews was the machine breaking down after 3-6 months, so I purchased a warranty from Amazon and that gave me some relief.

Good luck!

title: Compact and effective
text:
People already got great reviews to give you the low down on everything about this machine. Thought I'd try and add to theirs a little. I took a picture of it in front of my door to show it's size against an everyday object.

I also took a picture of the inlet hose to show why it's pretty much useless, unless you MacGyver it in some way. That is a AA battery I stuck in the hose to show just how small it is vs. any kind of faucet.

My apartment has a washer/dryer hookup area so for my setup I bought regular washer hoses then got a 3/4 to 3/8 barbed hose adapter. The 3/8 barbed end fits perfectly into the water inlets on the machine.

The noise level isn't too outrageous. As someone else stated it sounds like an AC unit that keeps turning off and on. This is because the motor spins the wash cycle one way, then stops and reverses the cycle the other way.

When you start the spin "dryer" the machine will shake pretty good, but when it reaches top speed it will steady itself out. As the dryer winds down, it will also shake the same as start up until it comes to a stop. Also, if your item takes up the whole space of the spinner, do not use the water guard disc. It will shoot off into the nook and cranny recesses around the spinner and will be a pain to get it back out. Depending on which side it falls into, you might never get it out without having to dismantle something. I got lucky. I had to attach a hook to a thin broom handle to reach in and retrieve it.

I live by myself so don't usually have a ton of laundry most of the time so this machine is perfect for me. Now gotta find a perfect personal dryer and I'm set laudry wise.

UPDATE : Got this July 5, 2019. It is now October 3, 2019. So far this thing is working great. I added another photo of my setup. I currently have this on a cheap TV stand. I don't recommend using products for non-intended purpose, as it's a "use this way at your own risk" but I accept it. I'm looking for something of the same dimensions with a thicker, sturdier build, but this stand has held up with all the shakes and rattles of this machine. Just wanted to show a possible setup idea for people still wondering what they can do. I do recommend finding a sturdier platform for yours though. I might have to end up building my own platform to replace the TV stand, because it's the perfect dimensions for my space.

text: This is the BEST little compact portable washer I've ever had or seen.  I mean I've only had 3 and only seen 3, but really this thing is great! And the spin tub- jeez, if you leave the clothes on the spin cycle for like 4 minutes they're darn near dry when you take them out!  This is the best money I've ever spent. title: it works fine. Suggest you check out the videos before buy

title: Great machine!

title: Works great so far!
text:
I've used this a few times and it's working great. It's going to pay for itself in a few months, saving me trips to the laundromat. Honestly, even if it breaks in a year and I have to buy a new one, I'll be money ahead. I bought the extended warranty which I think cost 8 bucks, so I should get at least 2 years out of the machine.
I still have to take blankets and big stuff to the laundromat but they don't have to be washed as often as clothes.
One word of advice--if you're washing grimy work clothes, don't throw your less-dirty clothes in the same load. Super-grimy or muddy clothes may require emptying and refilling the machine several times and it wouldn't hurt to spin them between agitations to remove more dirty water. Don't add more detergent to the additional washes though, there's enough trapped in the fabric to keep washing them.
I have a small farm so muddy, grimy work clothes are the primary thing I wash. I have decided to not keep wearing the same work clothes day after day like I used to because this small machine can only do so much. It will be better to change clothes more often and wash stuff before the amount of dirt overwhelms the machine's ability to get them clean with one or two wash cycles.
The spin dryer is amazing. I only turn it on for about 2 minutes and it really removes so much moisture. If you did it for 5 minutes, the clothes would probably dry in the sun in a matter of minutes.
Anyway, if you're on the fence, just buy it. I love it!

title: Perfect small washer.
text: Perfect size for in-between washes.  Placed in kitchen corner and I use it often.

title: Love, love, love it

title: Wonderful, works so much better than I expected

Due to the machine being one year and one month old it is out of warranty and the company does not sell parts to replace it. it is a $10 part. title: good
text: Love this! huge problem solver, wish I bought it soon. I just wish the spin cycle was the same size as the washing part....

title: Poor Quality Control?
text:
Update only one day after my initial review: We noticed a light flashing on the washer side every few switches in direction. I'm assuming it's coming from the back as there is a gap where the door connects that leads to the back of the washer and that is the only place I think this light could be coming from ... Nothing the seller has posted explains this but based on other reviews this isn't an isolated incident. I'm definitely concerned at this point about safety since there has been no answer from the actual seller on this and it appears to be sparking when it switches. Definitely disappointed. It's sad because the washer and spinner work exceptionally well, however with it coming marked up/dirty and being on the flimsier side.. now this potential safety hazard? I recommend investing in something higher quality, reputable, and with great customer service if possible. In hindsight that is what we would have done.

I'm leaving this review after 2 days of use and testing and will update if anything changes!

Overall: The washer was shipped one day after ordering. We did notice some smudges, scratches, etc. on and inside of the washer which I'm hoping was just manufacturing related... Based on my own experience and others I suspect poor quality control. Everything was tested and functioned as normal. I do worry about the longevity of the machine as it has very strong motors in a plastic body. I did several loads of shirts, pants, jackets, towels, sheets, etc. and overall the machine does a great job at agitating the fabric of various items. Just as others have mentioned, the inlet tube didn't fit our sinks and just to test the functionality of both sides we rigged it with a funnel. Everything worked fine. However, after a few times we opted for the ole' bucket filling method as it went quicker.

I would also like to note that when running the washer it had a bizarre odor that you could smell inside and behind the machine. After investigating and not finding anything obvious or concerning, I will assume the motors created this smell. It was very off putting but seems to have decreased with every use.

Washer: While the washer is running/filled you can see and feel the plastic moving. It is thick/sturdy enough to hold everything though, just not the strongest body. I don't know that I would ever use it at the High line again as the water tends to splash big time and seems to stress the washer spinner with bigger loads. The part of the machine where the top connects to the body appears to leak when it splashes up to the top as well (included in pictures). Medium and halfway to High seem to have the best functionality and is the most productive with this washer in my experience so far. There were times where the machine handled the amount of items well and would suddenly catch when it would move the clothes in the opposite direction. I would pull something up and back in, and it would be fine again. I suppose to play it safe, less is better and definitely keep an eye on it while it is running. It does switch the movement of washing the clothes very frequently which again makes me question the longevity of the motor. To drain the water you will switch the center setting to drain and it will empty through the drain tube. We had the washer on a raised shelf and drained into a bucket (gravity drain). It worked well enough and haven't noticed any issues at this time. You have the option to set the timer to 15 and honestly for each cycle I have found 6 works well and we added onto it as needed.

Spin Dryer: The spinner is very strong and definitely does it's job effectively! You can usually fit around half of your washer load into the spinner depending on what you're washing/spinning. Overloading it will give it a hard time and won't sound good at all. It's loud initially while the clothes "catch" onto the sides, and once they have caught, it is actually not bad- sort of like a hum. The trick is to make sure there's not too little and not too much. Balancing the clothes so they aren't clumping to one side helps as well. It comes with a disk to put on top which I'm assuming is to prevent them from popping up and getting stuck in the sides of the part that holds the spinner. Also to keep everything level. While testing the water inlet on this side, I noticed for whatever reason the water leaks just the slightest bit and pools around the inlet while running water through. It gets louder when the water is running into the spinner and quiets down as it drains again. Also, the spinner always drains regardless of the setting- this may have been obvious but just in case I figured it was worth mentioning because I didn't catch that right away. You have an option to run it up to 5. I have found we have never needed more than 1 for normal clothes and 2-3 max for heavier materials like jeans.

As for how much the washer/spin dryer can hold... it's not so much how many of each item of clothing as it is the sizes, materials etc. The spin dryer will hold about half of what you wash depending on the material. Even if there is more space available, that does not necessarily mean the machine will handle more very well. If the washer looks like the clothes are catching/stuck with each turn, it's probably too much clothing or not enough water. If the spin dryer is shaking and very loud for more than a few seconds, there may be too much clothing in it or it is not balanced enough. It catches fairly quickly, sometimes immediately if the amount is smaller and you can tell by the gentle "hum" it changes to. I recommend testing it out and going from there!

Final Thoughts: While the price for the washer and what you get is decent, I was disappointed to see scratches and black specks on the washer lid, smudges on the inside and outside of the washer/dryer and what looked like some kind of yellowish residue in the drain tube. I was also not thrilled with the leaking from the top of the washer with bigger loads. Whether or not we would buy again when needed will depend on how long this washer lasts of which I will definitely update!

title: Spin Dryer Stopped Working
text: I have had this product just over a month and already the spin dryer stopped working, only makes a very loud noise and no spinning.  Very disappointed.  Ordered a different brand with a much better rating.  Save your money, do not buy this product!

title: 1 year and still going!
text: Honestly, this simple thing has saved me so much money. Great for people who are tired of spending so much on the laundromat.  Go easy on this machine and be gentle, give it time too cool off, dont do 10 loads back to back. It absolutely cleans better than a regular full size machine, you use so much less on soap! Its not a set it and forget it type thing but it sure beats hand washing or skipping meals to afford clean clothes! This toy-like Chinese plastic washer has changed my life. I love it<3 theres a few great YouTube reviews on this by the way 😊 i hope this helped!

title: This is a total game changer for my SPORTS family
text: My daughter plays competition softball and we travel to tournaments across state lines frequently.  Washing uniforms is always a concern because not all hotels have laundry facilities, there isn’t always a nearby laundromat that’s open when you are off the field for the day, and who wants to miss your kids game to wash stinky socks?  This machine is SMALL BUT MIGHTY.  I can’t believe how well it cleans - on VERY LITTLE detergent.  I wouldn’t recommend using softener, because that would add another cycle-through.  And the spinner - AMAZING!  There is no way any human could ever hand wring clothes to get them as dry as the spinner does.  Just be careful not to have it out of balance, or your machine will make a ton of noise and it wont work too well.  We filled ours with a 5 gallon bucket from the hotel bath tub and drained it into the shower pan.

title: Instructions impossible to follow; Better to wash in the sink
text: This is a well engineered piece of equipment with motors that run silently and well.  It works just fine, if you don't mind doing about 10x the amount of work it would take to wash the equivalent clothing in your kitchen sink.  I bought this to take in our new travel trailer, and it's a bit big, but that's not the problem.  Problem is you do everything manually from putting the water in (I don't have that much water in my trailer tank, so I have to carry a bucket from an outside pump and I'm not strong), and then move the thing somehow to raise it up high enough to gravity flow.  We'll end up putting wheels on it.  Here's how it works since there are NO INSTRUCTIONS even slightly legible! 1) Put clean water in from a bucket or hose, 2) add a SMIDGE of laundry detergent, 3) put clothes in, 4) use dials to wash clothes about 6 minutes for most, 5) turn drain dial and empty out the bottom hose, 6) refill with clean water from bucket again and again until clothes rinse (same bin as washed in)(add fabric softener if desired but only a LITTLE BIT), 7) once they appear to be clean and rinsed, put into other side (right) but only 1/3 of what you had in the wash bin, 8) spin until they are smashed against the sides, 9) hang to dry because they won't be dry or fluffy, 10) repeat spin for rest of load using only tiny bits of laundry per spin.  NOTE: water will come out of the hose for spin too, so make sure it's draining to somewhere not on your floor.  ALSO NOTE: there's an inlet for water on the spin side too.  Have no idea why, because it comes out the bottom.  I thought that was for rinsing, but it doesn't go into the spin chamber; goes right on out.  Like I wrote - this works well, does what it says it will, but in a trailer you don't have all that water and waste water capacity.  Much better to wash in a little bucket outside with a hose, or if you're in an apartment, just wash your clothes in a sink.  They'll be softer, air dried anyway, and it's a heck of a lot easier!  I'm sorry I wasted my money - really sorry.  I'm sure this is very good for some situations, but truly not mine.  3 stars because it's a lovely piece of machinery, but is a waste of time and money and pretty much worthless for my purposes.  The instructions make no sense at all, not even a problem with translation.  They just make no sense.

title: Five Stars

title: This product is amazing. Such a great value

title: Life saver
text: I lived in a small efficiency with no washer and dryer connections. This little guy was a life saver for when I couldn't get to a laundromat. I used it for 7 years then gave it to a friend once I moved it was still working great!  My only complaint was that when I got it, it didn't come with the water inlet hoses it was supposed to but I made it work!

title: This Is A Great Product
text:
After losing the use of my regular washer and returning a compact, fully automatic washer that I wasn't able to use, I bought this and honestly, I could not be happier with it.
First, a little clarification: The washer/spinner you receive will say Costway on it, not Giantex. This seems to be the only company whose company name is not the same name as on the washer they sell. Evidently, Giantex is the company that sells it and Costway is the the brand name of the washer.
No confusion there, or anything!
That having been said, the washer does a great job. As others say, it will wash about half a normal sized load and it gets the clothes very clean. I really love the spinner as well, it's powerful and pretty roomy. I split my load of laundry between two spin loads and that's it.
Since I don't have a handheld shower head, or any other way to fill the washer, I use a ten quart bucket.
At first I really found this to be labor intensive. I would fill the washer with three buckets of water, wash the load, drain it, spin it, refill with another three buckets of water, put the clothes back in, rinse, drain, and spin again.
Well, that's just too dang much time and work!
Soooo, I've learned the best way for me to not spend my entire life doing a load of laundry is to fill the washer using three full buckets (7.5 gals) of water, which is plenty to do a load at the highest water level, and after washing and draining, I skip the extra steps of spinning and refilling the washer to rinse. Instead, I rinse each piece by hand, put it in the spinner, and Bob's your uncle! So much faster!
Also, I only use the soft setting on the washer and I haven't had any problems with my clothes stretching out.
At first I could not get the lint trap out, but using both thumbs to press down on the plastic tab, I finally got it out and it works great for me.
I keep the washer in my closet when not in use and I use it in my bathtub on a container to keep it elevated off the floor, which I highly recommend. It is a tad heavy and a tad bulky to move back and forth, but nothing I can't deal with.
I hope to get about four years out of this for the price I paid. I will update on that when the time comes. Overall, extremely happy with it and it's so stinkin' cute, too!

title: A fabulous alternative to handwashing
text:
Update:
It's been about 2 1/2 years since we purchased this and it's still working well!

Between the two of us, we run an average of 9 loads a month, and like I said, it's been about 30 months of use, which makes it an average, so far, of about 40 cents per load. We've had no problems at all. Just make sure to use a reasonable load size and put it in a ventilated place to dry after use, and it will stay in good condition.

Original Review:
I really dove deep into the Amazon reviews with this before I purchased it, and I encourage everyone else to do the same. It seems like most of the negative reviews on here are from people who didn't seem to fully understand what they were purchasing. This is NOT an equivalent of a full washer-dryer. However, if you don't (or can't) have an in-house washer-dryer where you live and you hate (or are tired of) the laundry-mat and hand-washing is too tedious and time-consuming, this is perfect for you.

Things to note:
-the load size is smaller than the average washer
-the dryer is not a heat dryer, but a high-speed spinner that wicks away water (more effectively than hand-wringing does). You'll still have to hang dry

We've used it 6 times so far and love it. It gets the clothes clean and removes a lot of the water to make air drying faster. It's much faster and more effective than hand-washing and I love not having the hassle of going to the laundry-mat anymore.

title: Shockingly Amazed!
text: My sister owns this machine and when after an afternoon planting and playing in the dirt with my niece my clothes were thoroughly muddied up and I was wearing very light colored clothing.  I didn't think this machine would do much but it totally made my clothes pristinely clean and the spinner part of the machine dried my clothes to a bare damp so after an hour or so of hanging them by a window I was fully dressed again.  Very Impressed with this machine and there is no objections with the landlord since it doesn't need to be hooked up to any plumbing.  A+ A+

title: Shockingly good
text: The reviews are correct, it's amazing. It made my dirty brown socks pure white. And the spin drier takes out a ridiculous amount of water. The only thing is, you need a bucket to put water in, and you're probably going to use a bucket to take water out. It also uses more water than a traditional washing machines, but who cares? It's 120 bucks, you'll save so much money with this thing.

title: Money worth
text: Love my new machine and my clothes came out clean

title: Love it !
text: We purchased this washer for our RV. I love it. Keeps me from hauling dirty clothes home or needing to find and sit in a laundromat. I have even used it at home for those small loads that you don't want to use a regular washing machine for.

title: Yeaahhh, No more public laundromats
text:
Great for small places like my apt. Money and time saver, not so noisy, very light and maneuverable.
Lift it from ground and put it close to sink or bathtub so it can drain itself.

title: Gets my clothes clean!
text: The instructions are very poorly translated. However, once you figure out how to use it, it works well. Strong agitation and spin. I have it propped on 2 milk crates so the drainage hose can reach the bath tub and it's fallen over twice. A little loud. One large wash requires 2 separate spins

title: Great choice!
text: This is a must if you hate going to the laundromat. We use it to wash all the small pieces of clothing, plus my boyfriend’s work uniform. It’s so convenient and silent, easy to use and you end up saving on detergent since you only need a little bit. It is also more gentle on your clothes since you’re not exposing them to the heat of the dryer. The clothes come out 90% dry from the spinner. I did receive mine with a dent in the front and some damage in the back but the seller was kind enough to provide a partial refund. I definitely recommend!

title: A gift for renters
text:
Want to cut your laundry costs by 90%? Then buy this product, and enjoy the simple functionality and thorough clean it provides.

Be advised, however, that it cannot dry anything washed. Every use results in clothing and towels drip-drying in my apartment, with occasional trips to the dryer at our building's shared laundry room.

title: This is the best machine
text:
I love this washing machine for my small apartment. However I would not recommend this for large or tall people. The bigger your clothes, the less you can wash in it at one time. When I wash my husband's clothes it takes FOREVER because he's six foot with very broad shoulders and a large frame. I can only fit a pair of his jeans and a couple of his shirts in without overloading it. I'm a 5' 7" woman and I can wash my week's worth of clothes in about two or three loads. It's amazing my for needs but it does take a lot more time and effort than going to a laundry room.

I also use this machine for my delicate dresses. Its gentle enough for "handwash only" items when you use a garment bag and a little extra water to lessen the literal vortex it creates. It shocked me how much power it really has to wash your clothes.

The spin cycle side is even more impressive. My clothes are nearly dry just after one minute. If you're looking for a space-saving, cost effective, and greener solution this is it. If you have a large family or have big things to wash this is NOT your solution.

title: Can't live without it!
text: Wow! what a neat, handy appliance! Just love it! The spin dry part really gets so much moisture out that clothes are drying in half the time. I highly recommend.

title: Disliked
text:
Stops working really fast!
I would recommend you spend a little more money on something of better quality.

title: Very happy with product
text: Works great we put it in our RV it's easy to use and store and the small amount of water is a plus

title: I LOVE this washing machine!
text: I've had this for 2 years now and I love it. I live in an apartment and this lives in my bathroom. I went to home depot and got a long piece of clear hose cut and I run the hose from my bathroom sink to the washer. I'm also really short, and this machine is just perfect for me. I can wash almost anything in it, except big blankets and comforters. I've washed jeans, towels, and sheets just fine.

title: Hard to clean
text:
Because of Covid-19, I haven't been able to get to the laundromat. Doing everything by hand is tedious and only partially effective.

First, the good: quick and relatively quiet. Spin really does get 90% of water out of clothes so ready to hang without dripping on the floor. Capacity is adequate. Can do a pair of jeans, sweat shirt and underwear in one load. Spin holds half of that.

Next, the bad: fill hose is not made for any faucet I've ever seen. Fill by hand. Drain hose is flimsy. Cleaning is difficult. The basket and agitator tend to hold onto dirt and stray fibers, and the "lint trap" is a small mesh bag that keeps said dirt and fibers in the corners.

Conclusion: Overall, a good purchase...I just worry about the reliability of the machine and the drain hose in particular.

title: One month and I'm in love
text: I would have given 5 stars but it was missing the piece that suppose to lay on top of the spin cycle, I purchased a flat wheeled mover for this to sit on. It easily rolls now from my utility room to my kitchen sink to fill. Its amazing how much this little thing holds. I can't believe how clean my clothes come out. The spin cycle really gets the excess water out. If it lasts I will really be in love.

title: Questionable quality - be sure to get insurance
text:
I originally left a 1 star rating on this product. It died after a couple of loads... I started processing a return.

I tried it again the next day and it worked perfectly. I’m not sure what happened in between but I’m happy!

It washes better than a traditional washer (yes these little ones do.) The instructions include suggested load sizes. I’ve been only doing “medium” size loads to keep from wearing it down too fast.

The filter works amazingly well for what it is. It does need to be cleaned after every load. It can hold the equivalent of two pairs of pants and two tops. The spinner works fantastically. Tights come out dry and clothing is generally dry in about half a day.

I canceled my return and I’m keeping it. I’m expecting it to die again and I’m trying to treat it gently until then. I purchased insurance when I bought this models. I’d strongly suggest buying insurance with it so you can get replacements or a refund when it dies. That’s my plan!

title: Happy with my purchase
text:
I have been very pleased with my purchase as well as the customer support I have received so far.

My only complaint is that the drain hose is a poor quality piece. The design underneath allows for the hose to be directed to the left or right but I knew that if I attempted to switch the direction the hose would fail. It felt brittle, so I never disturbed it.

After a few months of use I noticed a small amount of water under the machine and upon closer inspection I traced the drip to the top of the drain hose where it exited the washer. There was a small break in the hose right below where it connects to the pipe. Do to the surface of this drain hose it could not be taped. I reached out to customer service and we discussed options to resolve and I'm satisfied with how they handled this.

I live in a small apartment and use this exclusively for most of my laundry needs. Although I cannot wash blankets and I will not wash heavy items such as a bath mat, it does wash my towels and jeans. I never attempt to load it with multiple heavy items. I will wash those items individually. I fill it for a regular full load and drop a single item in and use a bin to hold each wet laundered item as I wash each piece in the same wash water. When finished, I rinse those pieces in the rinse water. I find spinning the washed items of excess water helps with the rinse process. Yes it's extra steps but it works and I can wash clothes daily and not be concerned with trips to a laundry mat.

title: So Far, Very Good
text:
After more than a month of regular use, I have to say I'm pleased with this washer. It does a decent job with clothes and holds more than you would think. I can do my double sheets and pillowcases in it and they come out beautifully.

I put the washer in the bathtub and fill it with a bucket. (The comments about the intake water hose being useless are correct.) Even with cleaning the flimsy lint trap with every use, the clothes do tend to pick up a bit of lint, but that's easy to deal with. I do think the distributor would be wise to print a set of instructions in English--and in a font size large enough to read. My greatest concern? Will it hold up?

title: great for cost
text:
I can't say enough good things about this little wonder! Bought it for my daughter's small apartment and saves money and time going to laundry mat
She can do her laundry for a couple of days and good to go. We did as others suggested and used two milk cartons in bathtub with a board on top. I also put a slim rug on top to muffle the sound which isn't really loud at all. Plus found these to keep the lint from going into tub. Plus instead of rinsing in the spin side I just rinse on the wash side, makes it easier because the spin side isn't as large as the wash side. Would take a few rinsings to get one full size load done if done on spin side.
Wish I could have bought it before the price went down tho. In one week the price dropped $149.00 to $119.00

title: Outstanding Apartment Washer and Spinner!
text: Like this unit for all functions

title: The BEST!!!
text: I love this washer I have saved a lot of money not using a pay washer. I wash everyday I'm addicted to this tiny but powerful machine. I was so impressed and still is eveytime I wash. I was sheets, rugs, sweaters this was definitely the best investment. I recommend for sure...

title: Alright, I love it.
text:
The directions on this thing are hilarious. I’m saving them for that reason. If you really want to know how it works, just read the Q&A section or other reviews.

The only con I can come up with is that the spinner is embarrassingly loud. I feel kinda guilty when running it, because it sounds like a pressure washer. I can only hope that my neighbor downstairs isn’t affected.

Everything else is stellar. It’s easy to use, and it gets clothes as clean as a regular washer does. I have been using my bathtub to wash my clothes for over a year and I cannot believe I didn’t buy this before now. I was skeptical about it, even when I bought it, but I am so pleased with it so far. I’ve done 6 loads in it so far and they’re turning out great. If anything changes, I will update my review.

title: Love Love Love!
text:
I've been eyeing these portable washers for some time now and I finally bit the bullet and ordered this one. Boy, am I glad I did! I just love this washer! I live in an apartment complex and the management installed high efficiency washers last year. I hate them! I've been washing all of our clothes in this portable washer without using soap at first because the high efficiency washers leave so much soap residue behind! It's been taking me 3 or 4 rinses to get them back to normal again! Gross!

There's a definite learning curve and as the other reviewers can attest to, the instruction manual is pretty terrible. I learned with a little trial and error, reading other reviews and watching a few YouTube videos. There's really not much to it, clothes go in the larger tub on the left to wash and in the smaller tub on the right to spin dry. The last load I did was 4 t-shirts, 1 long sleeve button up shirt, 2 pajama bottoms, a pair of shorts and some socks and undies. It really fits a lot! For heavier items like jeans, it's best to wash them on their own. To spin dry you will need to break it up into 2 batches, but it only takes 1 or 2 minutes for that step. I find I only need about 1 tablespoon of laundry detergent per load. I bought a folding drying rack and on a warm day my clothes are dry in about 4 hours.

The filling hose did not fit my sink or bathtub, but I found a pretty good solution. I ordered a shower arm diverter for hand held shower heads (the Delta Faucet U4922-PK) along with an extra long stainless steel shower hose. Now when I want to do a load of laundry I set the washer up on a small wood bench next to my bathtub, the drain hose goes in the tub and I can use my stainless steel shower hose to fill the washer up.

As others have noted, there was a strong plastic smell when I first unwrapped the machine. I'm happy to report it faded away and is now completely gone.

If you live in a small space or don't have washer/dryer hookups, get this washer. You won't be disappointed!

title: I like it
text: I like it but don't love it. The reason why I like it because it washes my clothes but it is a spin dry so basically it's like having a regular washer. So basically I have clean clothes but still need to air dry afterwards but if u have an apartment building that doesn't have a washer/dryer in the unit it's great to have in your home.

title: Fantastic! Read for step by step recommendations
text:
I have had this for three years! I definitely recommend either to reduce trips to the laundromat, or in addition to one's regular washer to wash cloth diapers, cleaning rags, sandy beach clothes, stinky stuff, cuddle toys, or delicates. Bought one for my mom at the same time, which recently died. Ours still works. Uses a lot of water, but uses very little detergent. Spinner works better than any full size washer's spinner cycle that I've used, helping clothes dry quickly when hung up. The washer only drains when the dial is placed on drain, but the spinner drains continually so items can be spun while washing or while draining the washer. Use liquid fabric softener so clothes dry soft, without air-dry stiffness. Using a rubber band, attach a sock or pantyhose to the drain hose to catch lint.

Load capacity: Works best with two pairs of teen or adult sized jeans along with a handful of other clothes, or a couple of sheets, or two to three bath towels, or a small blanket, or a single pillow; basically, if you can fit it in the spinner or in a standard grocery bag, it'll wash well in this tub. Though it can wash twice as much, dividing the load in half to spin, I find that the clothes agitate easily and thus they clean best if washing just what fits in the spinner.

Detergent, fabric softener, and deodorizers/laundry boosters: Just put in a little! A tablespoon full or two (or a little medicine cup full, or just a quick dash) of detergent works great, along with that much fabric softener. I use Gain and Downey, and put them in simultaneously instead of doing separate loads. For heavily soiled items, stinky stuff, wet stuff that sat awhile, peed on stuff, etc, just rinse in the spinner until the water is clear, then wash a couple of times with a deodorizer or laundry booster. I like to use Odoban for the bad stuff, or a bit of Washing Soda and a bit of Oxy Clean along with a dash of Gain. Note: Use fabric softener! Jeans, towels, socks, etc will air dry without stiffness, and all clothes will air dry and feel good to the touch if using softener.

Washing and drying process: I just wash, and rinse while spinning in the spinner, then let it spin for a couple more minutes. For more heavily soiled clothes or stinky clothes, I'd repeat the cycle. I used to wash, spin, then put it back in the washing tub for a couple of clean-water rinse cycles, but now I prefer just using a bucket of water at a time as it spins, or attaching a hose, to rinse until clear and not bubbly. Here is step by step for various types of loads:

Very lightly soiled loads, delicates, cuddle toys: Wash once in washer, then rinse while spinning in spinner. 1) I wash once, with three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket), a little detergent and a little softener for nine minutes or so. I have also used a hose from the shower or sink, filling anywhere between the lint catcher and the max fill line. 2) I spin the load for two minutes, then remove the clothes. 3) I place one pair of jeans or another heavy item that absorbs lots of water easily back into the spinner one at a time, or half a spinner full of regular stuff. If only half full or less, I do not bother with the cap that stops clothes from jumping up and over the edge while spinning. I pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, then pour in another bucket and let it spin, then pour in another bucket and let it spin. It usually takes three buckets per pair of jeans plus three buckets per half load, with the final spin time of about three minutes, but it might take another bucket of water. Alternatively, attach a hose to the connector above the spinner, and let water continually run in while on spin; this requires about three to four minutes of water flow (the connector is small) plus three minutes of spin time once the water is off. Basically, rinse until the water is clear, then spin for a couple of minutes. 4) Place everything on hangers, using clothes pins or clips for smaller items, and hang a few inches apart in doorways or, even better, on a line running across the room. For cuddle toys or pillows, place in front of a fan for a few hours, then flip for a few more hours. If the air isn't humid and if the window is open or the fan is on, everything should dry in a couple of hours. If it has been raining or it is otherwise humid, just have a fan on and leave it for several hours, while at work, or over night and everything will dry well.

Moderately soiled or stinky loads: Wash once with detergent and laundry booster, spin or rinse and spin, wash with detergent and softener, then rinse while spinning: 1) Decide whether or not you want to rinse until water runs clear before your first wash. If so, fill the spinner no more than half full, and do not bother with the cap unless you fear socks will jump out. Then, pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, then repeat, continuing until the water is pretty clear; usually, two or three buckets is enough, followed by two minutes or so spin time. Alternatively, attach a hose to the hose connector and similarly allow water to flow in until it runs clear, letting it spin for two minutes or so after turning off the water 2) First of two washes: With three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket), a little detergent and a little softener for nine to fifteen minutes. I have also used a hose from the shower or sink, filling anywhere between the lint catcher and the max fill line. If you want, add a cup of Odoban or a couple tablespoons or so each of Washing Soda and OxyClean. 3) I spin the load for two minutes, then return the clothes to the washer. If I used Washing Soda + OxyClean, I let it spin for a two minutes, pour in one bucket of water, then let it spin for two minutes again. You may want a second bucket if the water is especially dark, because these cause clothes to bleed though they clean very well. 4) Second of two washes: With three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket), a little detergent and a little softener for nine minutes or so. I have also used a hose from the shower or sink, filling anywhere between the lint catcher and the max fill line. 5) I spin the load for two minutes, then remove the clothes. 6) I place one pair of jeans or another heavy item that absorbs lots of water easily back into the spinner one at a time, or half a spinner full of regular stuff. If only half full or less, I do not bother with the cap that stops clothes from jumping up and over the edge while spinning. I pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, then pour in another bucket and let it spin, then pour in another bucket and let it spin. It usually takes three buckets per pair of jeans plus three buckets per half load, with the final spin time of about three minutes, but it might take another bucket of water. Alternatively, attach a hose to the connector above the spinner, and let water continually run in while on spin; this requires about three to four minutes of water flow (the connector is small) plus three minutes of spin time once the water is off. Basically, rinse until the water is clear, then spin for a couple of minutes. 7) Place everything on hangers, using clothes pins or clips for smaller items, and hang a few inches apart in doorways or, even better, on a line running across the room. If the air isn't humid and if the window is open or the fan is on, everything should dry in a couple of hours. If it has been raining or it is otherwise humid, just have a fan on and leave it for several hours, while at work, or over night and everything will dry well.

For heavily soiled, peed on, or truly stinky loads: Rinse, wash lightly with detergent and laundry booster just to loosen yuckies, rinse while spinning, wash or wash and soak with detergent and laundry booster, rinse while spinning, wash with detergent and softener, then rinse while spinning. 1) Rinse in the spinner until water runs clear; works easiest if spinner is no more than half full. Pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, then pour in another bucket and let it spin, then pour in another bucket and let it spin. It usually takes three to six buckets per half load, with the final spin time of about two minutes. Alternatively, attach a hose to the connector above the spinner, and let water continually run in while on spin; this requires probably five minutes of water flow as it spins (the connector is small) plus two minutes of spin time once the water is off. Basically, rinse until the water is clear, then spin for a couple of minutes. 2) First of three washes: With three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket), a little detergent, and a cup of Odoban or a little Washing Soda + OxyClean for five minutes, to loosen up the dirt and yuckies. I have also used a hose from the shower or sink, filling anywhere between the lint catcher and the max fill line. Drain, but do not spin the clothes if they're especially yucky and you do not want to touch them unnecessarily. 3) First of three rinses: Decide whether or not to spin and rinse, or simply rinse in the washing side before washing a second time. If spinning and rinsing, use about three buckets of water per half spinner full, by pouring in a bucket and letting it spin while refilling the bucket, then doing so again until the water runs clear. I have also used a hose from the shower or sink, until the water runs clear, then allowing two minutes of spin time. If you do not want to touch truly yucky clothes more than necessary, leave them in the washer, and pour a bucket of water directly into the washer while allowing it to drain right out. Once drained, pour in another bucket, or simply saturate with water for a minute from a hose. Then fill the washer, let it wash (without adding detergents or anything) for a couple of minutes to loosen yuckies, and drain again. 4) Second of three washes: With three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket) or filling with a hose anywhere between the lint catcher and the max fill line, add a little detergent, and a cup of Odoban or a little Washing Soda + OxyClean for fifteen minutes. Decide whether or not to leave it soaking for a few hours or overnight; if so, be sure to wash for a couple of minutes before draining. 5) Second of three rinses; I spin the load for two minutes, then pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, doing so for about three to six buckets until the water runs clear; alternatively, I use a hose to continually rinse the clothes until the water runs clear, then continue to spin for two minutes. 6) Third of three washes: With three buckets of water (2 or 2 and a half gallon typical size bucket) or filling with a hose, add a little detergent and a little softener for nine minutes or so. 7) Third of three rinses: I spin the load for two minutes, then remove the clothes. 8) I place one pair of jeans or another heavy item that absorbs lots of water easily back into the spinner one at a time, or half a spinner full of regular stuff. If only half full or less, I do not bother with the cap that stops clothes from jumping up and over the edge while spinning. I pour in a bucket of water and let it spin while refilling the bucket, then pour in another bucket and let it spin, then pour in another bucket and let it spin. It usually takes three buckets per pair of jeans plus three buckets per half load, with the final spin time of about three minutes, but it might take another bucket of water. Alternatively, attach a hose to the connector above the spinner, and let water continually run in while on spin; this requires about three to four minutes of water flow (the connector is small) plus three minutes of spin time once the water is off. Basically, rinse until the water is clear, then spin for a couple of minutes. 9) Place everything on hangers, using clothes pins or clips for smaller items, and hang a few inches apart in doorways or, even better, on a line running across the room. If the air isn't humid and if the window is open or the fan is on, everything should dry in a couple of hours. If it has been raining or it is otherwise humid, just have a fan on and leave it for several hours, while at work, or over night and everything will dry well. 10) After drying, does it still stink once it dries? Wash with Odoban or a bit of Washing Soda and OxyClean, then let it soak all day or overnight. Do the typical wash with detergent and booster additives-rinse and spin-wash with just detergent and softener-rinse and spin. If it dries and still stinks, toss it in the trash.

title: Five Stars
text: I love it

title: Great for small apartment
text: This product is great for my small apartment. It doesn't take up much space and I don't have to go down to the laundromat. It is a bit noisy and does become warm near the bottom. I normally just let it rest if that happens.

title: Perfect for small spaces
text: I love this.  I can wash clothes without sharing machine or laundry mat.  Fits perfectly in tub.  I made a shelf for it so it is up off tub floor and I don’t have to move it when I’m showering.  It works perfect for my needs.

title: Works great!
text: This washer was just what I needed for my apartment. It took some trial and error to set up in a way that would work best but once I got the routine of filling and draining down it was easy. So much better than a laundromat!

title: Amazing little big machine
text: I watched videos and read reviews on this and every other portable washer amazon has to offer for months. I waited so long because there were an overwhelming amount of bad reviews amongst the really great ones, especially about customer service if the machine arrived less than perfect. I finally ordered and was pleased it arrived early. The machine came a little dirty but nothing a little bleach and an empty load couldn’t clean. It made a remarkably bad noise unlike any other review video I had watched. I reached out to customer service, who immediately remedied the situation. I am still riding out the defective one and will absolutely put the refund towards the same one when this ultimately kicks it. Clothes come super clean, light on detergent, easy to move although I leave it on my kitchen counter most of the time and I use a stool at 5’2 . The full hose is laughable but the gravity drain is fine in my situation. I use the kitchen faucet hose to easily fill. The spinner is crazy amazing and extracts 90% of the water, there are already dry patches when they come out. I am able to do a good amount of size 6/7 kid clothes in one load, even a snow suit in two loads and a women’s S lightweight winter jacket with no problem. I always make sure I can see the whirlpool and it’s not struggling to turn, and I’m still able to fit a good amount in there. You have to split the load in half to spin but it’s nbd. I keep a clean pail for the not spun yet clothes while the first batch spins and the basin refills to save time. My experience with customer service was great. This is life changing. Makes things so much easier. The bad noise is only when it spins in one direction, and if both directions spin like the “good side” does, is say it’s a very low noise level, and after the first few seconds of the spin start, it stays completely still throughout the entire process. I attached a lint sock that I bought at the dollar store in a two pack(this is a must), I have no problem with lint build up on the clothes. For the price, you can not beat this powerhouse. It beats going to the laundry mat, and has paid for itself in the first month alone. I would recommend to anyone.

title: Total waste

title: Great little machine

title: Not for general use
text:
I got this machine less than a month ago; I've used it for just the third time today (one 3/4 load, a second very small load of a few bras). Part of the ground prong on the plug snapped right off in the outlet, and then the hook on the drain hose keeping the hose up so the water doesn't drain while running snapped off (and dirty wash water flooded my bathroom). Even before things started breaking off every time I touch it, there was no such thing as running a load without minor flooding in whatever room this machine is in. The draining process is flawed at best.
I am incredibly disappointed. I had high hopes after reading other reviews.
This is not meant for home use regardless of advertising. RV camping maybe, or a rare load of delicates, but not general use.

title: Spinner/Dryer started having burning plastic smell
text: I have used this everyday for three months, only today to have the spinner/dryer start smelling like burning plastic/rubber. I felt at the base in two areas that felt very hot to the touch. I will not use the dryer part anymore out of concern of starting a fire, but plan on using the washing side as that still works. From what I have read from other reviews, the seller does not do returns, so keep in mind, this unit will likely not last you long.

title: Nice to be able to wash stuff at home and not spend hours in a laundromat!
text:
Great little washer ....which handles quite a bit actually. I am filling it by hand, with a bucket...which can be a pain. But it's better then having to wash by hand! The 'dryer' spins the clothes extremely well....just have to be sure you keep the items centered and don't fill all the way, so it doesn't go crooked. That is the only time it will make a lot of noise. Otherwise it's pretty quiet.

Will still need to go to laundry for big items like blankets/comforters, etc of course. But it saves me from having to go weekly.

Glad I bought it.

title: Good little washer
text: Does a great job washing small amounts of clothes ... kept my first one for about a year then gave that one to my sister because she really liked it too . That one is still working fine. I bought a second one later to wash my babies clothes . Its easy to use and very convenient.

title: Amazing gets the job done
text: Love it gets the job done

title: great item..great price.  took a bit to arrive..but worth the wait
text: love this little washer

title: Surprisingly Good
text:
I expected that the good reviews were somewhat exaggerated, but after doing a couple of loads of dirty car detail microfiber cloths from the garage, I am impressed. I ran each load in the washer with liquid detergent 3 times since they were covered with wax, dirt, grime, chemicals, etc. I rinsed between each wash cycle. They spun to nearly dry in 1 minute in the spin dryer part. I bought this for car detail rags only so I would not get the muck in my clothes washer. Since I have done a couple of loads of car detail rags in my full size dryer, I can say that this little washer did just as good a job with much less power and water. I have it set up in a tub I do not use, so water and drain are handy. The hose that comes with it can be adapted but the design needs to be redone. The box it came in was barely held together so I expected the unit to be shattered in places. But it was fine.

The washer looks good and appears flimsy at first, but is apparently solid plastic. It seems well-designed for its purpose. I am very happy with this purchase.

title: Amazing little machine

title: It spit out fire!
text: I am not happy with this washer. I bought it October 20th 2019 and have not used it much. The “dryer” started to not spin anymore, I had to open and close it several times. The washer caught fire and blew out my electricity even though nothing else was in use. I tried in in a different room, the washer still worked but blew out fire again so I won’t use it anymore. Dangerous! Safe your money.

title: MUST HAVE FOR APARTMENT FOLKS (or really anybody without easy access to machines)
text:
If you live in an apartment or just don't have easy access to a washer/dryer, GET THIS PRODUCT. I live in a complex of almost 40 people to 2 washers/2 dryers that hardly ever work as they should and are seldomly available for use. Hand washing clothing is ok for the first 5 minutes and then it's old. I currently have mine in the bathtub, set on top of a memory foam bath mat (it's what I had available at the time to absorb some of the noise/vibration) and I rigged an old shower head hose to the hose that comes with this, and I remove our current shower head to attach my rigged one and that works so much better to fill it than having to fill a bucket. I got that idea after reading other reviews of this and similar products.

I'm hoping to get something to set it on top of outside of the tub so I don't have to keep lugging it in and out of there but I really can't complain. This thing has been a life saver. No more hoarding quarters or public machines. This thing is a MUST HAVE. Easy and convenient to be able to pop some laundry in and go about the rest of my to-do list.

title: the hose does not fit sink. However I used a sink adapted shampoo hose to fill washer.

title: Perfect for Apartments!!

Do you want to come over and watch" In 25 years of knowing this person I have never seen him excited about laundry ever!! And he no longer does it have my house for free so thank you!! I blame it on the bad wiring in my old ghetto apartment. The last person that lived here had a fire and then they fixed it back up and rented it to my friend/roommate/ex and I stay here with him. So yeah it busted and I was mad but they refunded me so now I have this brand new but busted little washing machine and I know that if I put it by the dumpster it will maybe be picked up by someone but I don't want someone to have any scary issues so I will put a little note on it with black permanent marker explaining that only someone with electrician background or experience should try to maybe fix it. title: Works fine, lasted longer than a year so far
text:
Works well, the directions another user posted were very helpful, as the manual is pretty much useless. The machine resembles a flimsy plastic children's replica of a washer/dryer at first meeting, I was sure I'd been ripped off. Can't judge this book by the cover.
I work at a garden center, and this little machine seems to get all the dirt out. Much cheaper, cleaner and probably safer for keeping clothing than the coin operated washers in our building's basement! The only issue we have is that it doesn't get rid of lint, tends to stick onto our clothes. The washer came with a tiny lint trap, but it didn't help and was a hassle to clean what little lint it did catch, so I took it off and haven't noticed a difference. The spinner works really well, clothes hang completely dry in less than a day after two spins.
Overall I consider it a very good buy for $110, we bought it in August and it's still going strong as of this review - Nov. 6 - by which time we have saved about as much as we would've spent at the laundromat. I'll update if it breaks or something.
UPDATE 11/2017: It's been one whole year since I wrote that review, and the clotheswasher's still going strong! We're hopefully moving to an apartment with a real clotheswasher soon, but might hang onto it a little longer. I bought two of the flower shaped lint traps that float on the surface, really helped with the lint problem(clean out the lint after every cycle, my husband needed to be told this) It's more than paid for itself in money saved.

title: I am very disappointed.
text: The spinner stopped working after 5 small loads. I am very disappointed.

title: MUST HAVE
text: Looooove this machine. I’m always using it for sometimes 2 hours at a time. Hasn’t died on me. Have used it at least 7 times. Light weight and easily portable. This machine has saved my life!!!

title: Bad machine, Spin botton don't work at 9 months ...

title: good (while it lasted)
text:
Had mine for a year now and its still working. Use it almost every day too. One bad thing though the lint catcher on it broke after the first few uses, still works fine without it but need to use a lint roller on the clothes.

*UPDATE*
It has began leaking water. It lasted 1 year 7 months. Now I have to get it to the dump. I guess if you would be able to use it outside or in a bathtub the water leaking doesn't technically make it unusable, but I can't.

I never overloaded it but it just vibrates and shakes a lot from it's normal operation so I guess it's inevitable for it to leak eventually. I guess 200 bucks for 1.7 years was ok value but it's annoying still. Might have to order another one though I don't like going to the laundry mat.

title: Five Stars

Really cant fit much. You will still have clothes in the washer, while you dry some. After washing, the clothes are soaking wet. I dont know if I'm doing it wrong, but Inhave to wring them out before I out them into dry. Takes forever to dry, to the point I just hang them up. The hose is very short. I dont feel its safe in the tub, dur to being electric. I use a 30 gallan tote fot the water to flow into. And I have to use a bucket to add water to the washer. 15 mins wash, 5 min dry. You dont want to keep drying, you can smell the motor when its getting to hot, so you can to let it cool down to finish. At that point, I just hand to dry. I have mixed feelings about this item.
