I wished I had bought a lighter machine due to my shoulder (its 27lbs) and buy a separate drying machine. Machine is excellent. Performance is great!! Especially now with Covid-19, Delta, etc. It takes a lot of clothes for its size. I even do king size, one at a time as I don't want it to break down. I even use spinner at same time as the washer sometimes for ASAP items. THANK YOU COSTWAY and AMAZON. It's the best item I have bought here. Totally love it❤❤🙏🙏😁😁

title: A little different than I expected, but absolutely a great purchase
text: My fiancee and I live in a travel trailer full-time, so space and reliability was a huge concern for us. We needed to know that whatever we invested in to wash our clothes was going to go the distance. I'm very pleasantly surprised at how great this little washer is! I just got it today, so if my opinion changes, I'll update my review, but safe to say this is 110% worth the investment.

title: Five Stars
text: great!

title: Needs gravity to help release water from machine
text: It cleans well and the spinning side gets most of the water out. It's pretty quiet compared to full sized washers. I needed to put it up on top of something in equal or greater height than my tub because it depends on gravity to let all the water go, or else it just stays in the machine. However you work it, the tube to release the water has to go downward. I also took a note from the other reviewers and used the rubber bulb from a baster to be able to fit it onto my water source.

title: I love it, you can run both sides at the ...
text: I love it, you can run both sides at the same time. The loads are small but it cleans very well!

title: Absolutely love it!
text: I love this washer. I’m not allowed to have one in my apartment but no one even knows and I can hide it in a closet if I need to. It’s not as quiet as I’d like and I wash so much I’m starting to smell a burning rubber smell so I may have to use my service plan I purchased but I’ve had it for about a year and I use it several times a week. I’d definitely purchase one again and recommend it. It hold quite a lot of clothes and I can wash sheets and small rugs also.

title: Wish I had bought this years ago!
text:
I received this yesterday after looking at it for a few months and finally pulling the trigger and ordering. I was worried it would be too small and not get clothes clean. I have been hand washing my own clothes but now that I am doing my 9 year old grandsons clothes I need to have something more powerful. Last night we put 10 white uniform shirts of his in the machine (think dirty, he's 9). I was surprised at how strong the agitator was and how clean the clothes were. They looked like new. A little bit of lint was on the clothes but once they dried it wiped right off. It took me three spins to spin all the shirts. I hung them to dry on a hanger and he wore one to school this morning. It looked like a brand new shirt. I really did not think the spinner would work that well. The directions that come with it are a bit hard to read (poor translation) but I think I figured it out. I haven't figured out when I would put water in the spinner though, any clues? I wish I would have bought this years ago, no more afternoons at the laundromat, now we can keep up with laundry by doing a bit every night. I have not tried towels yet. I can fit sheets but probably not a blanket.

Just wanted to update that after 6.5 years my washer that I originally paid 85 dollars for finally gave out. What a bargain! So much time and energy saved from not having to go to the laundromat. We used this almost daily and all weekend long. As soon as that one died I have ordered another immediately. :) Couldn't be happier!

title: Love this washer
text: This is a wonderful alternative to a full sized washer. It handles about a half a standard load, and is quick and easy to work with. The manual is rubbish, true, but it's not rocket science to figure out how to use this thing. The spinner itself is worth the money, it practically dries the clothes out without the stretching and tearing which can happen in a regular sized washer. It would be a perfect addition to a travel trailer. Frugal with the water, low power consumption, and clothes that can be hung to dry. I love it.

title: One Star
text: Absolutely terrible. it caught fire

title: Super great washer!
text: I would rate it with 10 stars. It's super simple and efficient.

title: Meh! It’s ok.
text: I was excited to make this purchased, upon its arrival I still had to buy a few part. I saw a customers review about certain parts “Hose Mender” unfortunately this part did not work for my shower head. I utilized another reviews advice, which she utilized a PVC part, some metal hose clamp and a third part which I can’t recall the name. All three parts came out under $5 and I must say this did the job! Now.... you’d think it would be fine and dandy, well water still leaks from the shower head even after screwing it tightly. I figured I can deal with it now biggie, we’ll when I turn the water on to fill the washer/rinse; water unfortunately leaks out of the front. It appears it’s not properly locked or insulated properly. I’ve gone a long lengths already to try to make this work and now I have to go a long lengths to figure out the water leak issue.

title: Good product overall
text: Confusing instructions, fairly noisy when operating, accompanying hoses are short so I had to purchase longer ones to reach the bathtub or sink. Wobbles some when in operation.  Good product overall, just could use some fine tuning.

title: Excellent Washer for Tiny Living!
text: I purchased this washer because we are full time RVing and needed something small to wash clothes. This has been perfect. We have owned it for several months and use it twice a week for a family of three.  Motor is still running strong. The clothes also clean very well. You only need a small amount of washing soap. I also add vinegar to my loads and it gets the whites really white. I can fit it in our shower when washing clothes and for storage. We have a small travel trailer and it doesn’t create too much movement or noise when running. Make sure to put a small rubber mat underneath the machine so it doesn’t scratch the shower floor. The machine is plastic and lightweight. The tub is also plastic which could scratch because of buttons or things left in your pockets. The spin feature is really nice and it gets a lot of water out of the clothes, but not completely dry. You will still need to air dry some. The spin tub doesn’t hold as many clothes as the washer so you will have to do twice as many drying loads. It would be great if the machine could do both the washing and spin dry in the same tub. It would go faster and you could wash more. Overall very happy with our purchase and would buy again.

title: Good...but need to come up with your own set up flr best results.
text:
***update 9-22-17 love this washer. It’s still holding up well and I use it daily 3-5x a day.

11-2-16 only problem I have had is the set up is bad for an apartment with no area made for laundry. I ended up buying a utility cart with wheels and a different water hose to fit my shower head. The utlity cart helps the water drain since there is no water pump.

title: Great for Apartment dwelling
text: Great agitation. Great spin. Read some of the reviews on here where people describe how to use it best. Pick up a good drying rack and you dont have to go to the laundromat except to wash bulky items like comforters. Tip: couldnt get the "line in" to work for filling so I just use a bucket. The drain is gravity so you need to elevate your machine. I used cinder blocks.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great

title: Stopped working after 3 months
text: I loved it at first but then the washer stopped working after 3 months and the spinner stopped working just before six months. Waiting to hear about warranty. Also, when it was working, the washer was tearing up my clothes, so it's pretty rough. Would not recommend. I did about 5 loads per week before it quit.

title: Good shop washer
text:
Initially we bought this for our RV, and it worked great.
But then we found a 5th wheel with a full fridge and washer and dryer in it. So now we use it as a washer for shop rags.

title: Giantex Portable Mini Compact Twin Tub 11lb
text: Just love this unit!!

title: LOOVE IT!!
text: We use this for our family of 7! We live in an off grid tiny home and this is PERFECT for us! We run it on our 2000w generator no problem at all. It only pulls 300w  It washes waaaay better than the laundry mat washers and better than any washer i have ever owned. Clothes come out super clean and fresh. Agitator gets the clothes really clean and the spinner gets them so dry you could almost put them on straight out the spinner! My 5 year old can use this washer. And he does! Takes more time cause its manual and smaller loads but soooo worth it. LOVE LOVE LOVE it.

title: Perfect for my daughter that does travel nursing and has ...
text: Perfect for my daughter that does travel nursing and has to constantly wash  scrubs and small loads without using  the washeteria. She loves it!

title: Looks can be deceiving. Better than I expected! Easy enough to operate! Worth the bit of extra work to launder at home.
text:
I live in my 5th wheel. Due to health problems the laundry mat is difficult for me to use. I researched these mini washers for 2 months. Delivery was easy. Delivered to my door. I picked up the box containing the washer with both hands ready to heave it up the stairs. I got a grip on the top of the box with one hand on the shipping strap. I then carried the box into my trailer easily! LIghter than expected. My back was pleased. My mind wondered if something so light would be any good. After reading reviews, I expected to pour in the water due to the hose not fitting my faucets. I got a piece of gray pipe insulation & cut to length. I opened slightly and held one end under the faucet. The other end I hold over the washer.The cut in the insulation with the yellow plastic over the gluey cut allowed me to watch and control water flow at the faucet. I left the yellow plastic on the insulation pipe cover. It fills up the washer tub nicely with out a bucket. My clothes come out so much cleaner than when laundered at the public laundries
The washer holds more than I expected. Trial and error. Today it was Queen size sheets and 3 pillow cases fit fine. The lint catcher is easy to use if you gently press down on the top latch, invert the bag to empty it. Once I located and figured out how to empty the lint catcher did I realize I could fill the washer with more clothes and water than I had been putting in the washer. Only about half the washer load fits is the spin dryer. Patience I will use as I am at home, other things to do while I spin twice for 1 wash load..The spin dryer gets more water out of the clothes than the public laundries washers.. There are drain slots between the 2 tubs to catch water drippings as you load from one to another.
Draining the water...simple enough except for operator error. Remember to turn it on and off as needed for washer use. I have my washer on a dollie that is 5 1/2 inches high. This makes the gravity drain from the washer a hair higher than a dish tub ( the type you wash dishes in when camping) .I hold the hose while it drains into the tub. Any mess was from me filling the dish tub too high or tipping the tub as I lift it to the sink. A mop or towel fixed that fast. A few times I forgot to turn off the drain knob and over filled the tub. Practice will improve that. It looks like a cheap washer. Well it is! But..... I am very pleased and would buy it again if needed! The instructions are a bit comical in translation. The print is so fine I need a magnifier to read it.

title: Extremely powerful.  Love love love this washer and spinner
text:
I bought for my rv ..... its larger than I had hoped but after using i am definitely keeping. Super powerful wash cycle. Then spinner gets clothes amazingly dry.

I set up by my shower and set drain hose on shower floor. Filled tub using shower head. Clothes came out great and I could do other things in the comfort of my rv.

title: Excellent and well priced
text: This thing CLEANS. I was washing clothes at the laundromat and to see how much dirt was still in my clothes was disgusting. This machine gets the dirt out and it spins the clothes almost dry! Just do not overload the ringer. It dries several shirts at once but I only spin one pair of jeans or one hoodie at a time. It easily fits in my bathtub which is great for saving space. I waited 2 months before posting a review just to make sure nothing problematic happened.

title: Five Stars
text: Love it

title: Gets the job done
text: I watched a lot of video reviews before I purchased this unit and I have no regrets.

title: Rolls up everything like a mixer does to dough(into a ball) Wobbles big ...
text: Rolls up everything like a mixer does to dough(into a ball)  Wobbles big time.  Has to be put on something to drain.  For the price and only small loads. it's ok.

title: Not a bad little washer
text:
This little washer surprisingly works really well considering it is coming from China.
You have to do small loads in the washer, and only about 1/3 of that load can comfortably fit in the spinner.

One improvement that I can see could be made is the washer can also spin the clothes instead of having to transfer the clothes to the spin side.
Other than that, this is a great little washer.

title: Does what it's supposed to do
text: It can be a quirky machine but once you figure out how to make it work for your space it is really useful.  I had to buy a separate tube to connect it to my sink. The drying portion is slightly magical! It can only hold about half of the load you wash but it gets them astonishingly dry in only 5 minutes. Overall it is a good machine and I'm very glad I have it.

title: Great for small loads
text: This little does the trick! Nice to have around.

title: Perfect for College Apartment!
text:
[[VIDEOID:cbb0f97b17f838be84b587aa50197a82]] UPDATE: 6 months after purchase:
Her washing machine has begun leaking from somewhere underneath the unit. It's not just like mop up a bit. It's soaking towels and still needs to be mopped. Very disappointed. I've moved my rating from 5 stars to 2 because it worked great at first, however, 6 months on it's money down the drain.
*******

We bought this for our daughter who is in an older campus apartment. There are washers and dryers on each floor but not one in her unit. This little w/d is so portable and it takes a load to work out what is best for you.
My daughter was ready to just give up after the first try. However, it was late, we were tired so I just let it be. The next morning, I woke up and started a load. One of the frustrations was that the water intake tube didn't fit on the faucet. My solution (and a quicker one at that!) was that I filled up the bucket that I was going to drain into and poured that into the wash basin. Much quicker. Then to drain it.
I did a wash and a rinse - something I don't see other people doing - but I drained as much as possible and put in rinse water and drained. I moved it over in batches to spin. Most of the clothes spun to just damp. I then hung everything out on her balcony on the drying racks. Drained the tub completely and then put it up!
She watched me do it all. I told her that it takes less effort than dragging her things down the hallway (clothes, detergent, fabric beads etc) and then running back and forth waiting to see if things were done and worrying about if they would get stolen. Since I left her 4 days ago, she's already done 3 loads:)
I saw a video saying it could take up to 17 pounds of clothes, but I think smaller batches are best. She will be able to do her full size sheets no problem, but not blankets.
100 percent would recommend!

title: Love
text: I love, love, LOVE this washing machine. It’s quick and easy to use and it looks really nice wherever you put it

title: Not my pick
text: Its super heavy to lift. Its got a short hose and needs to be above level, so not really convent for looks or maneuverability. You need really strong soap to get the job done

title: Good buy does the job. But not a real dryer and the water outlet is a hastle.
text: It is easy to use and easy to maneuver , only issue is finding a place to let the water out. The piece at the very bottom to let the water out needs to be high, so you'd have to lift the whole thing really high like chest level so all the water runs out. Or else the rest would be stuck inside. I had to out it on top of the deep freezer and all the water came rushing out. But who wants to keep lifting it that high with water jsndie just to empty it. It has to be a better way . Also be aware it's not a real dryer it just rings out enough water so you can hang up the clothes to dry without soaking the floor.

title: Perfect value for the price
text:
Like most people, I was so tired of the laundromat. We have a dedicated one in our apartment complex, but it was still such a hassle to have to lug the laundry downstairs and two buildings over, and make that trip at least three times to do a load of laundry. Combined with the competition of trying to get a washing machine or dryer in the first place, it was just such a headache.

I was hesitant about buying an "apartment sized" washer, but I have to say I'm really happy with this little guy. Sure, it would be nice if it had an incorporated spin cycle, and was a little larger, but you have to pay more for those things and I wasn't willing to. Maybe in the future I'll upgrade to something that "does it all", but right now I have me, my wife and our two young kids, and this unit is enough to keep up with that if we don't get lazy about it.

I recommend this for anyone who doesn't mind keeping an eye on their laundry process. The separate spin cycle is a little annoying, especially since it's not big enough to do the entire load you just washed. You end up doing two separate spin cycles, but like I said, you pay to get convenience. If set it and forget it is important to you, spring for the $350 versions that are all in one.

Note: As you've probably read on other reviews, the hose for filling up the unit with water is useless. I use this machine in my tub, and I have a hand-held shower head that I just drop in the wash basin and turn on to fill. The unit is gravity drain, and if you use the little hook on the drain hose to keep it pointed into the drain, all the water goes right into the drain without any problems. You have to lift the unit up at the end to get out the residual water before removing the hose, but that's not too bad. I also recommend getting a mat or something if you're putting it on a hard floor to keep it from "walking around".

All in all, I have absolutely no complaints based on what I paid for this. Sure, there are things I wish were more convenient, but at $100, I can't seriously complain about the small things. I just included them so you'd know.

Awesome product!

title: Awesome buy.  Great for RV life.
text: This is an awesome little washer.  I have an RV an no laundry on board.  This is amazing and after the spin, you can hang the shirts in the shower or outside and they dry very quickly.  I’ve only had it a few days but I already love it!

title: Great Product and a Worthy Purchase!
text: This is a fabulous portable washing machine!  From all the tips and advices of other reviewers, I decided to go for this washer as a gift for a family member.  I have assisted with washing the clothes and provided guidance on how to operate it, as suggested by other reviewers. I am currently looking into placing this on a raised platform for ease of use and to drain the water from the washer and spinner's reservoirs directly into a bathtub, rather than a bucket. Lifting a bucket isn't feasible for the family member who received this.  Just need to figure a secured platform that will prevent the machine from tipping over. This truly is worthy purchase for those who have physically limitations to maneuver on stairs and toting heavy loads to a laundromat.  It  amazingly cleans your clothes. The spinner is indeed powerful that it doesn't take very long for your clothes to hang dry.  The family member is one happy camper!

title: It was fantastic till it wasn't
text: This machine is a great idea when it works. When it doesn't im not sure why I have to get their approval to return it. I read reviews and directions and they were easy to follow. Respect that I did my best to not abuse this machine. Please get back to me on this situation of return .

title: reat product and on time delivery.
text: Saves me a lot of time that I spent handwashing

title: Believe the hype, folks
text: I'm the first one to be skeptical of a product with so many good reviews. But this is the real deal for small apartments! I've used it three times in the last 12 hours. I'm absolutely in love with it. YouTube some guides on how to use it too since the instructions it comes with aren't the best but man this thing is a straight up game changer. STOP GIVING MONEY TO THE LAUNDROMAT!!

title: Awesome to use!!!!!
text: i love it so convienient to use. revommendable

title: Convinient for small apartments and a money saver
text: [[VIDEOID:41332fe3e74919a13356065866bce3c1]] I disliked how loud it is, and the hose keeps some of the water in even though I tipped it and have it on a high shelf. I don't like the smell of plastic while it's washing.

title: Glad I bought it
text: This is great for what it is! If you’re on the edge about this working for you I would go ahead and get it. I live in a small apartment on the third floor of the complex building with a communally shared wash room in the basement. This washer and dryer works perfectly for me. The spin drier gets the clothes to a good level of dryness where I just hang the clothes up overnight and they’re good. Using this set up is far from ideal but it bar far beats the alternative

title: Listen this thing is amazing! It took a second to figure out how ...
text: Listen this thing is amazing!  It took a second to figure out how I was going to place mine.  I have mine in the kitchen and I just us a bucket to fill the machine and have it up on a small cheap table from walmart so that it can drain into the same bucket.  This thing has made my life so much easier!  ya it only washes a little at a time but when you need a clean uniform for work one pant one shirt this thing saves time and energy running to and from my apartments laundry rooms.. As far as getting your clothes dry I think you should invest in a drying rack.  The spin dryer is nice and gets your clothes ALMOST dry but you will need to let them air dry the rest of the day!  Also the washer is a little loud but nothing that I'm concerned about.  Just dont forget to close the drain on the machine when loading it with water.... I made that mistake once so far haha!

title: Light and Easy to use
text: Very nifty little device. Extremely convenient, light, and easy to use. Recommend.

title: Efficient and Practical
text:
The whole device is about 13 inches long and about 6 inches wide, my partner and I have it currently sitting in front of the toilet while still having enough room to exit the shower and use the restroom without issue. It can handle one full-sized towel (maybe two), or a medium load of two pairs of heavy jeans and three shirts, and it washes surprisingly very well. My partner had washed his clothes numerous times, but one run in this washer and the clothes bled like they were brand new. The spin load spins very well and by the time I was done with two loads, the first batch of hung clothes were mostly dry.
Issues: the drainage hose is a little short (we have it in the bathroom so that it can readily drain in the tub) and the water intake valve does not have a means of screwing onto the faucet (ours came with a pinprick hole too, we use the shower head to fill the wash tub). Sometimes if not balanced, the spinner will rattle very loudly, but that's an easy fix.
Having to spend $3 per load in communal washers and dryers, this is a delightful change and I'm excited to do the laundry (that may just be me, though).

title: Better than expected.
text:
My first review and update was waay too long, so I thought I'd shorten it..

It works better than I expected, MashaAllah Tabarakallah. The spinner dries extremely well. Up to 95% dry depending on the fabric and thickness in only 2 minutes.

I did have a little trouble with spinner. After some trial and error it seems that if you don't put enough clothes (weight), it won't gain enough momentum to spin properly or if it gets too wet. Found this out the hard way, when I drained the wash side without unhooking the draining hose. The water got backed up and pushed into the spin side of the machine and it couldn't spin. After I waited a while, it spun perfectly again.

Also, I've had it for almost 2 months now and the buring rubber smell is almost completely gone. And yes, the water inlet hose came with mold on it already.

All in all, I would definitely recommend this.

title: WISH I HAD FOUND THIS SOONER!
text:
I watched a lot of YouTube videos on portable washers before deciding on this one. I had seen a video starting that a Giantex was ordered but that a Costway was delivered instead. The same thing happened with me but, they're both made by the same company...not a problem. The washer arrived in great condition and was very easy to unpack...just cut the two packing straps and pull the big straight up. The washer was very easy to set up. The drain hose can be set on either side of the washer and hold on to the side when not in use. It drains quickly and the spin tub gets your clothes pretty close to dry after a few minutes. The washer side really gets the dirt out! I haven't found anything to dislike with this washer and have already recommended it to several family members and friends.
TIP; I have mine set up on two milk crates. With my first load, the washer came close to vibrating off of them...had to hold it in place. With the second load, I put the bottom of the packing box on top of the crates. The styrofoam in he box bottom is molded to fit the washer bottom so, it hold it securely and cuts way down on the vibrations. So glad I bought this! ❤️

title: Giantex is too bad.
text: Terrible washer, couldn't work with 11 lbs clothes. I wash no more than 8 lbs clothes and they were still dirty, just because the washer is too small. There is no friction among clothes. It has been three days I haven't received the respond from the seller. Giantex is too bad.

title: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE!
text: I have used this now for several months. I love it!!!! I saved the Styrofoam base that it was packaged in and use it to reduce any noise it makes in my bath tub (since I live on a 3rd floor). I have had no issues and have washed all types of things from queen sheets to jeans and heavy items such as sweat shirts, etc... It holds a lot more than I imagined. The spinner is better than a full size washer. Any item dries fast, usually within hours, even jeans and heavy items. I love it!! The price is worth it! I shopped around for months prior to purchasing this one. I am very happy with my purchase.

title: Awesome
text: This thing is amazing. Highly recommend.

title: Good compact washer
text: So far so good, my wife and I live in an apartment, and are tired of washing our clothes in other people’s dog hairs and germs, I purchased this and my wife laughed, I spent 4 hours doing laundry, no it wasn’t bad, but all the clothes are clean and nice. I washed like 8 loads, spin portion works really good. I’d recommend this to anyone who does light loads. It’s pretty light I can carry it around with water in it. I’ll update my review in 6 months

title: Washtastic!
text: Just received today. I have washed several loads and I love it! The spinner works exceptionally well. The washer gets my clothes clean and holds more than expected. The draining is a little taxing, however totally pleased. Time saver!

title: Very loud.  Very high maintenance.  Very small loads that ruin your clothes. Negative stars.
text: This thing it's super loud and I feel likes it's ruining my clothes.... It's loud. You have to manually change wash and rinse... then take it all out to spin it. Ya get what you pay for I should have known that when I bought this expensive peice of very loud plastic.  I dunno.  Might work for some.  Definitely not for me.  Im gonna pitch in for the $200 one.  Looks wayyyyyy better.

title: You'll come clean after using this product
text: I bought this for my best friend who lives in apartment with no laundry facilities and he is on second floor.  You must know the hassle to do laundry.  When this arrived Xmas week, he came unglued, so happy to see it.  To date the product runs like a champ with very acceptable noise level when in use.  The biggest help is that YouTube has many different videos from people who bought this item, love it and showed how it works and tips they share so you can use this product with what works best for you.  Again, excellent purchase at an excellent price.

title: My FAVORITE Amazon purchase!
text:
This really was the best thing I've ever bought off Amazon. For the first time in years I don't have to leave my house to do laundry, or leave to go do it!

I picked up a 20' RV sewage hose from Walmart for $10 because I wasn't about to rip out my old shower head installation. For a temporary fix, I literally just used a wire hanger to keep the hose hanging the shower - the water just needs to enter and exit the hose to be able to fill the tub in the machine. I fill the tub and wash with detergent, then drain. Fill again then use fabric softener and rinse, drain again. Then transfer to the spinner, which does not have a heating element, but still gets everything like 90% dry. For another $50 you can get a portable drying rack with a heating element.

I also bought a furniture dolly from Walmart for $15 so I could move it more easily when storing it away or if I decided to use a sink to fill it and I could drain in the shower.

title: I love it
text: I love it! It is small and light enough that I can lift it and set it up on three stepstools duck taped together. (I am 70 and disabled) It is set up next to my tub That it drains into and I use the shower handle to fill it. Yes, it takes some tending with moving clothes back-and-forth from wash to spin tub. But that’s a small price to pay for the clean clothes that come out w a much better smell than a laundromat. I love the compact style- it fits nicely in my bathroom. When it spins out the water the clothes come out dryer than I’d ever seen before.

title: Easy and Convenient
text: Super convenient washer and spin dryer for anyone in a small space or apartment. I love having this is my home! Now I don't have to make large trips away from home to wash my clothing.

title: Great and compact
text: Works well, small hose, but using it as a presoak/backup washer so it's not a big deal, recommend buying a hose extension.

title: Works well
text: I was pleasantly surprised with how well this item worked.

title: The best
text: I was really surprised how well this washer works. It doesn't hold as much as a big machine will but it gets the clothes as clean or cleaner than my old machine did. And because you have to stay with it the laundry gets done faster.

title: Great purchase
text: Needed something that would work for a condo.  This is just the thing.  Fits convenienbtly in front of our toilet for storage and it's easy to use and works really well.  Only drawback is the fill hose (just use a bucket or something to fill).  It's about the size of a standard family laundry hamper.

title: although it can still be picked up and moved quite easily. For me
text:
Rather than continually use the coin laundry machine in my apartment, I bought this to give it a go.

As the videos show, it's actually somewhat sizeable, although it can still be picked up and moved quite easily. For me, the size is enough to pick up a 'regular size' load consisting of either 14-24 pairs of underwear or 10 or so t-shirts.

In terms of ease of use, this can use some improvement at least as far as filling goes. The included fill tube is just that- a tube, and you have to find a way to adapt it to a hose (As you can see in other reviews, people have come up with all kinds of methods to secure it to a faucet). Emptying is not as annoying because the empty tube has a hook so you can leave it upright when not in use; and it's fairly substantial so it can be dumped into a drain. However, because you have to manually fill and empty it, it can get pretty messy in an apartment. Eventually, I took the easiest/laziest way of using this, opting to put the whole thing in my shower so that I can fill it directly with the showerhead and empty it directly into the drain.

In terms of actual usage, the performance of this machine is pretty surprising. As long as you manage how much you're loading it by, it does a pretty good job washing everything. For example, a pair of dirty pants from a day of hiking through the mud was completely clean by the end of a simple 10 minute cycle. A few complaints: the machine isn't quiet by modern standards (though not deafening), and if you do happen to heavily load it, I did notice a metallic smell from the motor that indicates that it's working hard. After 40 washes though, no issues.

The spin-dry function is also very surprising. Again, if you manage your loads, most of your clothes come out to almost completely dry with a < 2 minute cycle. One of the most frequently washed items for me are Ex-officio, Calvin Klein Micro material type of quick-dry underwear, and usually after a 2-minute spin cycle they come out essentially already dry. Even things like heavy jeans (provided you place only one or two of them in at a time) come out relatively dry and only need a few hours hung dry, saving substantial amounts of time. You *can* overload the spin-dry, but it would be pretty obvious as the rotation speeds would end up very slow and the machine would vibrate from the imbalance- make sure you distribute your clothing evenly around the tumbler and you're good.

Overall, the convenience of being able to wash the laundry in a regular apartment without having to use coin laundry cannot be understated, and while it can be a bit clumsy to use, the machine does an excellent job actually washing laundry. And at this price point, it doesnt' even take long to recoup the cost of buying the machine vs. using coin laundry. If the company can improve the filling mechanism to be more faucet friendly, this would get 5 stars!

title: Good for small spaces, washes well!

title: Nice to have at home, best for children's / small items
text:
Update:
I recommend using only or mostly for kids clothes
Also does a good job washing my bathroom mats
Get the Washing Machine Drain hose by mylifeunit, it's much more heavy duty and has larger opening
You can wash tennis shoes (i've washed toddlers) and it works great and the spin dry works great
Always make sure the load is balanced in the spin dry, or else it won't reach the max speed.
To finish quicker, have a bucket on the side to "rinse" after the 1st load, use a new plunger, then spin dry - this allows you to put your 2nd load in the washing compartment.
There is a lint filter inside, clean after each use

why only or mostly kids clothes? because this washer will ruin your t-shirt collars and make a large knot of clothes with adult size leggings, jeans and long sleeve clothing. When you go to pull out each item to put in the spin dryer you'll have to untangle out of the washer.

What made me get this:
No laundry on-site
Have a small child that gets clothes dirty often
Lightweight/portable- i carry it into my bath tub

Conclusion: it's better to have it than not to have it. I gave 4 stars because the plastic on the back was dented upon arrival, and also because i notice a slight burning smell this washing machine gives off from the motor. But that may have been from overloading

title: One year and 100+ loads later
text:
I bought this over a year ago to use on our boat and have done at least 100 loads since then. It works really well for us. The key is to not overload it - jeans and towels should be done separately and with only a few other things, i.e. 1 pair of jeans, 2-3 shirts, socks and underwear will work fine - but 1 pair of jeans and 1 regular towel will get all tied up and won't agitate very well. Ymmv tho, so testing is important. It is still going strong after all those loads, I would definitely buy this again.

On the negative, I did have to buy a hose to extend the discharge tube (used a 6' long 1 1/8" inner diameter bilge and discharge tube I bought at a marine store) and I had to make a custom water hose coupling (I think it was a garbage disposal coupling....you may have to be creative) which was a bit of a pain, but once I got that set up it worked out really well.

title: It was good while it lasted
text: The quality was ok while it lasted. The spinner side was always a bit noisy but it only lasted 6 months. Now it makes a slight noise, as if trying to work but doesn’t spin. The clothes are left full of water after the wash. Not really worth the money for only 6 months of use.

title: Giantex (Costway) Portable Washing Machine 17.6 lbs.
text:
Washes and spin dries clothes very well.

Pros:
1. Separate belt drive motor for the washer and direct drive motor for the spin dryer
2. The 'drain' function is only for the washer. This means you can use the spin dryer without draining the washer. You can reuse the wash water several times if you're off grid and water is limited
3. Very light weight compared to full sized washers
4. Washer and spin dryer is a big enough for most items except comforters and large bulky, heavy items.
5. Virtually no mess moving clothes from the washer to the dryer and there's no need to squeeze the water out before putting clothes into the spin dryer
6. More energy efficient and effective at spin drying than full sized washers.
7. About 90% of the water is removed if you spin dry until no more water comes out (3 - 5 minutes)
8. In my electric dryer, clothes are dry in 1/4 of the time
9. Two wash settings. (I always use 'soft' because it's easier on the machine and the clothes.)
10. Uses very little water and soap. (I use a teaspoon of liquid soup for 3 gallons of water and do several loads with the same water if clothes are lightly soiled. Pretreat heavily soiled areas with spot remover first.)
11. You can rinse your clothes during the spin dry cycle without opening the door. (I spin dry the wash water out. Then I add rinse water to the dryer inlet with a funnel while the spin dryer is still spinning. )

Cons:
1. Cheap, thin plastic case, hoses, and controls. Functional and solid enough but requires you to be gentle
2. Quiet mechanically but even minor vibrations can cause the case to rattle and make noise
3. Washing and spin drying takes more time and is more labor intensive than a fully automatic machine mostly because of the machine's relatively small capacity
4. Light duty but plenty strong enough if you clean a few items at a time and don't overload the machine
5. If you don't use enough water, some clothes will curl up in a ball and not wash well. (You need a bare minimum of 2 gallons but the water can be used several times if you wash lightly soiled clothes first and heavily soiled clothes last. Jeans and heavy bath towels will need a minimum of 3 gallons each and more would be better.)
6. Ideally the machine should be elevated a couple feet so you can see when the water is done coming out of the hose during the spin cycle. However I have used it on the shower floor.
7. To drain all the water out you really need to tilt the machine several times from one side to the other. If you don't do that and don't use the machine for several days, I would expect mold and mildew to grow.

I have a full sized automatic washer and dryer. I bought this for off grid, boon docking, and camping. For the past two weeks I've done all my clothes, bedding, and towels in this little machine. I know it does a better job because it agitates better and removes much more water which means more dirt and soap is removed and drying time is incredibly fast. A full laundry basket typically dries in 10 to 15 minutes (in my dryer) compared to 40 minutes to an hour. I only wash a few items at a time and wash every 2 - 3 days so it takes longer. Also I use buckets to fill and empty the machine. Not bad though. I use 3 gallons of wash water and 1 gallon of rinse to do 3 days worth of laundry. It takes time but I do other things while the machine is working. Next month I'll be using it off grid with a generator.

I would recommend this machine for apartments, individuals and couples without full sized machines, RV's, off grid, and people who want to save money on energy. That being said, everything except the metal electric motors look very cheap. Not sure how long the machine will last but if you're mechanically inclined it looks like it would be easy to get the machine working again. If you remove the back cover, you'll see how simple the machine is. I like the design. The simple mechanical controls are connected to strings that operate switches and valves. No printed circuit boards to burn up that I could see.

title: So far works well
text:
After thoroughly reading many reviews my DH decided to get this for our RV. The RV is set up for a side by side w/d but I didn't want to take up the space and didn't think we needed a dryer. When I first saw this machine, I nearly laughed out loud. It looks like it should be set up in a big Barbie house. I wondered how effective it could really be and was shocked at how well it works.
Best advice I can give is toss the instructions and read the review from Michael dated November 2016. He covers everything very well and has good advice on the load size. Be realistic; less is better. This isn't for comforters and the like, but we wash king size sheets in it (one at a time with a pillow case in each load).
If you keep the loads smaller, pre-treat as needed, it works fine. The dryer drys things about 80-90% of the way, depending on the items.
I can see where it would be great for apartment dwellers who don't want/can't use the laundry facilities. You would have to do more, smaller loads but would be very convenient.

title: Great for small places
text: We love this little machine, gets clothes clean. Best place is bath tub and using shower head to fill. The dryer gets clothes from soaked to well dry (no heat) you can hang clothes to finish drying or take them to local laundry mat to fluff. I do wish the dryer was a bit bigger but over all we have had no problems with it. Dryer has to have clothes sitting a certain way or it will not spin correctly so be mindful of that. It can wash jeans/ towels but only a small few at a time. Highly recommend for anyone with small space and is tired of using a shared laundry mat (just fluff in local dryer). Over all it’s pretty quiet nothing that would bother neighbors.

title: So far - VERY SATISFIED I first washed two TWIN SIZE sheets and a ...
text:
Just used for the first time.
So far - VERY SATISFIED
I first washed two TWIN SIZE sheets and a standard pillow case. I used approximately 6 gallons of water, (and too much soap - my bad).
I used a water bucket to fill the washer, for both hot wash and cold rinse cycles.

The washer really works, very good, reversing spins, and the tub seems to be self-balancing regarding the load.
I used a second wash with just cold water to remove all the soap residue.

After washing, I used one sheet at a time in the spinner ( two seemed to much), and even at a short spin time < 4 minutes, the sheet came out very dry, and totally dried very quickly on my outside line (it is hot here in the Ozarks today, but still I'm satisfied with the starting moisture) The spinner also seems to be self-balancing, unless you load everything to one side.

Next I washed a pair of heavy Jeans and a T-Shirt , (I am a small guy however, but even so they washed very well at less than 6 minutes. (less soap this time). The spinner handled both easily, and as before, the result was fairly dry items when done spinning.

Determining how much water to use will depend on the size of the load, - obviously - , and how much soap to use ( don't need much!).

I will admit, I bought this in case of a SHTF condition, because I could run both the washer and spinner using my deep cycle batteries and an inverter to power it , for both wash and spin cycles. If that happens, I will not have to wash and wring by hand.

In any event, so far I highly recommend

title: Perfect for all!
text: You won’t be disappointed! I don’t know why I Didn’t think about it before! I have been living in NYC for 14 years. Paying for Laundry for 14 years and only because of Covid I bought this for my small apartment. This machine is the real game changer! A family of 5 here happy with this one!

title: Perfect little washer! Love it!
text:
I love this little washer. I've had no problems at all, delivery was fast, product arrived in perfect condition.

It's so easy to use and move. It actually fits in my bathroom linen closet. I removed a lower shelf and that was that! Slides right in!

I didn't have any issues with filling or draining. I have a walk in shower. I fill the washer with the shower head and drain right onto the shower floor!

I will say this, things can get a bit tangled in the washer, but nothing serious, I use a laundry garment bag for items with drawstrings and delicates.

I don't over load it and I fill to the top vent of the lint filter. Perfect.

It worked best when I washed similar weight items together.

The spinner is great! I do squeeze out some water from my items and layer them on the sides of the spinner!
I don't use the spinner and washer at the same time. I wash, spin for one min, rinse, spin for the full time.

I use about 2 tbs of detergent, Gain, and in the rinse I add 2 tbls of liquid softener, also Gain.

The spinner does a great job! I did air dry my things, dried overnight. But I tried the apt building drier,,, the clothes were completely dry in about 10 min on the lowest temp setting. I do like the feel and looks of my things from the drier better. But its not necessary to use the drier!

The lint filter traps a lot for a small washer so I be sure to clean it before I put it away. The lint filter was a bit hard to get off, I hope it doesn't break!

I'm 75 years old, had many, many washers and I can say I really enjoy this little washer! I honestly think its just a great investment considering the cost of going to the laundromat...
I'm not spending $1 per load, and for $1 for 45 min of dryer time I can now dry 3 loads of wash! My calculations say I'll be saving at least $400 a year!

No one gave me anything for this review, it's just an honest review.

title: Save Your $$$ ... This Item Is Just A Big TOY
text:
I really, REALLY wanted to give this product a 5 star rating but in all fairness I can't. First off, I never review a product until I've gotten a few uses out of it. After all, judging it's long-term performance is the true test.

This item was purchased in late July 2016 and by mid-December, the spin dryer just stopped working. Some reviews mention an 800 number to call, however, the instrucitons don't list an e-mail or phone #, so I had to resort to contacting the seller via Amazon. Three weeks passed without a reply, so I contacted them again. The seller has never bothered to even acknowledge my issue.

I should have known that at a cost of only $89.99 I wasn't going to get a quality product. My suggestion? Skip the 2-in-1 units altogether and purchase a portable washer and portable spin dryer separately.

title: This thing is magical!
text: We just moved into a small apartment, and it doesn’t have a washer/dryer unit. I got this as a gift, and it’s been SO great! I put it in the bathtub and fill with a mixing bowl, this thing can hold more than you think! I just washed a queen sized sheet set! The only thing I would be careful about are towels and jeans, and other things that might absorb a lot of water. Having enough water for the clothes to move around is key. I was nervous about noise, but if I shut the bathroom door it’s quieter than the dishwasher. To dry, I move it into the hallway and place two bathmats underneath to muffle the vibrations for my downstairs neighbors. A small metal piece did keep unscrewing itself early on, but I haven’t noticed any issues from just removing it all together. Great value, great machine, entertaining instruction manual!

title: I LOVE this Washer!
text: I can't express enough how much I love this washer. I live alone and have very little laundry to do on a regular basis, so I really didn't want to get a regular washer/dryer set in my new home, using more water and electricity than I need. I set this one up where a normal washer and dryer would go, just across from my kitchen, so I can easily fill and drain it. I've even been able to wash and spin my two cotton woven 2'x3' kitchen rugs and my queen sheets in this washer. They do have to be done individually, but it takes no time at all. The spinner works so well that I can have my sheets and clothes completely dry in just a few hours. I usually do my clothes at night and hang them to dry, and by morning they're ready to wear. I'll have to go to a laundromat to wash my comforters, but that's okay since they don't require regular cleaning like the sheets. This really is a nice unit and worth every penny I spent on it.

title: Capacity is NOT correct in title, Giantex no speak English and is no help on broken items
text:
Here's what I wrote back to the maker Giantex, "MACHINE IS NOT 17.6LBS, IT IS 11LBS WASH & 5.5LBS SPINNING CAPACITY. INCLUDE ENGLISH GRAMMAR INSTRUCTION MANUAL! DRAIN TUBE MUST REMAIN TIP UP THE ENTIRE WASH & RINSE CYCLE AS THE DRAIN IS INTERNALLY BROKEN. I AM A CRIPPLED SINGLE MAN ALONE ON A SINGLE INCOME USING 1 ARM AND 1 LEG. IT IS FALSELY ADVERTISED CAPACITY, UNINTELLIGIBLY INSTRUCTIONS, & IS INTERNALLY BROKEN DRAIN. I WANT MY MONEY BACK!"

Their broken English reply was that I no read far enough in description and to include photos of the broken drain tube. Ignoring the lack of help the manual was in their reply. First the drainage issue is NOT external. If the drain tube is laying down off of the side with the tip lower than the laundry machine's washer basin, it leaks the water out. In other words, internally the drain closure switch is broken. So nothing pictures taken will show. Secondly the issue is in the title listing. It VERY CLEARLY STATES 17.6LBS then lower states the 11lb/5lb capacity. Since they post the same listing for all their washers, only changing the title line, I figured the title is correct and description is generic. It WAS CLEARLY MADE TO CONFUSE CUSTOMERS AND CAUSE THEIR PRODUCT TO BE NOTICED FIRST AND GAIN MORE SALES.

It's pretty self explanatory though, and years ago I had a washer like this so I knew what I was getting into. It's more time consuming but if you live in a small space or an apartment without hookups it beats spending an arm and a leg at the laundromat. I have had so many items ruined at the laundromat. Also using a washing machine or dryer after someone who may or may not have the cooties gives me the heebie jeebies. I've recommended this item to friends who have small spaces or live in an apartment.

title: Does the job, loud
text:
[[VIDEOID:dca609d614471cf0ed2b792bdf6e2803]] Bought this after eyeing it for 2 years.. yeah I was sceptical! So far so good. As a family of 4 - 2 slim adults 2 kids under 6 it's worked wonderfully - it even get the cloth diapers clean. I do worry about the strength, the agitation faded my husband's black shirt & 2 Wrangler jeans, I see the dye going down the drain 😓!!! I now wash things on a 7ish because it doesn't fade the clothes out. I have washed two medium thick body towels in it, dirty aprons covered in food, 3working man jeans, About 15 cloth diapers /load +cloth wipes -they dry faster after being spun out than the laundromat & other washers I've used! I've used it every other day since I've gotten it payed itself off in the first 2 months. It is hard to fill up with water & the drain valve needs to be sloped down at an angle to drain . I just fill it with a bucket as the intake tub is useless. It's so loud in my tub so I surround it and place it on a foam mat to deaden the sound. Saves me $23 / week on laundry. Wish it was quieter but my neighbor thinks it's my dishwasher and doesn't mind.

UPDATE : 5/1/21 Two years later its not wringing/spinning the way it should. Havent used for 2 week . The timer is broken somehow and will only turn on if you press the reset button on your wall plug. I don't want to burn the motor out because it will run while the wash is going and it doesn't sound right. The numbers and words are rubbing off. I am hoping the timer for the wring can be repaired but won't hold my breath.
Hoping a repair shop near me can though.

title: Great little machine
text: Washer came damaged (no error of Giantex), and company was prompt helping sort out a resolution. Don't be afraid to order from this source,  they respond. Love the product .

title: Perfect for camping!
text: I bought this to put in our RV, as I dislike campground laundry facilities.  This little machine is amazing and perfect for camping! title: Five Stars

title: Will NEVER own a traditional washer and dryer again.
text:
5/21 Update, down from 4 stars. Sigh, the Assurant warranty plan won't 'kick' in as it's still under manufacturer's warranty. Guess who will not respond.

5/10 Still love the machine BUT guess what the motor has died (and after I just left an update barely a month ago. TSK TSK TSK). I turn it on and can hear the timer ticking away but it will not spin. Reached out to Assurant, as it is clearly beyond the 30-day window. The price has gone up since I purchased, but still within the insurance plan range. I fully expect them to let me simply order a replacement, but we shall see. If they don't I shall order another one and throw down with the insurance company. Like I said still love the machine, still think it's worth the money and deserves four stars, just go ahead and spend the extra $16 for the 3-year insurance plan.

4/7 Update:
OMG, okay since I spent the first 8 months using with a garden hose I never realized what the purpose of the two intake areas was for. I naively thought you attached the hose to whichever side was closest to your faucet. Nope. The one on the washer side is to fill the tub, the one on the spinner side shoots water into there. This means that you can spin rinse. Thus cutting down on the number of times I have to spin thus decreasing the amount of time I spend doing laundry. It's ridiculous how excited this makes me.

Original Review Below

Okay, first my dryer died. No biggie, I'm a country girl you know I had two old fashioned accordion clothes hangers so we kept right on trucking. Then my washing machine died. SIGH! I'm not dedicated enough to wash in sink/tub. As significant other and I telecommute I guess we could go au natural, BUT my 6-year-old not really gonna be happy about that. The washer died at the end of July 2018, I ordered this on August 2nd and had it within a week. To be honest the shipping box was a hot mess. Dang thing was so busted and torn we couldn't even get it into the house in the box, but the washer itself was fine.

Today is April 3, 2019, so we have been using this for 8 months. The directions are completely useless, not to mention so tiny who can read what is said, but set up is not complicated. Well, it wouldn't be IF the stupid intake hose had an adapter for the sink. That is VERY important for you to realize before you order this item. I had read enough reviews and seen some clever ideas on how to work around this that I was prepared. Not to mention this was not going inside our apartment but outside on the patio, where I used with a garden hose. We bought a weatherproof tarp and covered when not in use. We were living in CO at the time. This bad girl survived the winter in the snow, rain, etc. We have since moved to N.C. and putting her outside no longer an option; fortunately the new apartment has two full baths so we can use in the front bathroom tub no problem.

This, of course, meant I needed to use the intake hose or a bucket to fill her up. Yeah, I did about 5 loads using the bucket method, and while it was nice to be able to use hot water as opposed to only cold with the garden hose, my back was not amused.

So here is what I did. I purchased (all items off of Amazon) a shower converter, Blue Monster Pipe Sealant tape, a plastic flex hose connector, and oh yeah I already had duct tape. I removed the shower head, slid on the converter (I wrapped some monster tape to help with any leaking, but as the shower is never used in this bathroom, the 6-year-old- takes a bath, I don't mind if a bit of water drips when in use) connected the flex hose to the converter, used a pair of scissors to cut off the metal nut/bolt (I'm not a handy person I have no idea what it's really called) on the other end and then simply slid the connector hose about 6 inches into the intake hose. Wrapped some more monster tape (sorry forgot to take a photo of that) then covered that tape with the duct tape. Voila, I can now use the shower to fill up the washing machine.

Please note that while in the photos the machine is NOT in the tub, I do put it into the tub when in use. Mainly because otherwise gravity will not drain it into the tub, the exit/drainage hose rises at too high of an angle, thus requiring that I drain into a bucket. Well hello, I'm trying to avoid buckets. I can pretty easily lift the empty washer in and out of the tub for usage.

THAT being said, let's talk about this baby. Significant other and I are not tiny people. He's 6 foot and about 230 lbs, I'm 5'7 and about 295 lbs. I say this so that you can get an idea of how big our clothes are and how much this will do in a load. The Typhoon, aka 6-year-old normal skinny kid. If I'm doing his clothes I can wash a week of colours in one load. He typically wears a shirt, pants and two pair of boxers (one to sleep a fresh pair to start the day) a day. The machine can handle that in one load easy peasy.

If I'm doing S.O. and my laundry, well that is a bit different. Typically I can do about 5 of our shirts (think t-shirt) 2 pairs of either his or my shorts per load. If long pants are involved it depends. I mainly wear leggings so I can usually do 3 shirts and 3 leggings at a time. His pants are more like track pants and I can usually do 3 shirts and 2 pants. If jeans are involved I only do 1 pair of his jeans with 3 shirts.

One thing I really like is this has a soft (in my head gentle) setting. I use that for all my underwire bras and knickers. Again I'm a big gal so the unmentionables tend to be washed as their own load. My bras are a 44/46 DD with underwire. I can usually do 3 or 4 with 5 to 6 knickers in a load. I do put them in mesh bags, but I'd do that in a traditional washer. If I'm not washing bras I can throw in S.O. boxer briefs from the week with all my knickers in one load.

All of these I use the large load water line setting (FYI it's on the inside of the washer to back right. There is an S line, M line, and L line).

I have washed two bath sheets and three wash clothes as a load; 1 bath towel with about 7 dish towels as a load; and I typically take everyone's socks for the week and wash them as their own load. I have also washed as a load a twin fitted sheet and a twin thin fleece blanket as a load. Our bed is a queen and I can wash the fitted sheet with two pillowcases and the flat sheet with the other two pillowcases as a load.

I don't really measure the amount of liquid detergent I use, I'd guess maybe a quarter of the laundry cap. Fabric softener depending on items anywhere from a quarter to 1/2 a cap. I personally put the laundry detergent and fabric softener in first, start the water running to activate them and then put the clothes. I make sure all the clothes are wet before starting the machine. I just think it doesn't make the machine work as hard to get the cycle going if everything is already wet. If you do NOT see a whirlpool suction in the middle when it is churning, you have overloaded and you need to remove some items.

I typically wash for 15 minutes. Drain. Spin. You will need to do at least two spin dry cycles (sometimes three depending on the size of clothing). I then toss everything back into the washer and fill it up again with water to rinse. Why do I spin in between cycles you may ask. I personally found if I didn't then the detergent and fabric softener weren't rinsing out as well as I liked, by spinning them before the rinse it sort helps jump-start that process. I typically spin for about 90 seconds or until I no longer see water draining. Please note that you can fill up the washer machine as you are spinning clothes, this helps speed up the process.

For the rinse, I typically do for 9 minutes. If I am busy doing something else I'll do for 15 minutes just for the heck of it but I find 9 works well for me. I thin spin them dry again, the same process about 90 seconds per batch, until no more water is being wrung from them. Then hang them up on my handy dandy accordion clothes dryer. In CO I would just leave outside to dry until I had time to fold and put away so never really noticed how long it took to dry. Here in N.C. since they are inside I turn my fan on them as they are drying and typically I'd say anywhere from 30 - 90 minutes (again depending on what was washed) they are dry. Plus since the fan is blowing on them, the fresh smell from the fabric softener is dispersed throughout my house, you'd swear I had been cleaning as well as doing laundry.

We love the money we save on electricity by not using a traditional washer and dryer. To be fair both S.O. and I have white collared jobs so it's not like the washer is being asked to do serious cleaning for someone who does hard manual labor. But the Typhoon has rolled around in some serious mud puddles and this thing has cleaned his clothes INCLUDING his tennis shoes with no issue. I am very pleased when I see the dirty water drain out, I know that the clothes are getting clean.

OH!!! Please note you will need a lint brush. You never realize how much lint a traditional dryer removes from your clothes until you no longer have one. I have two cats so all my clothes tend to be covered in cat hair to boot. I've tried some of the gadgets I've seen for portable washers to eliminate the lint, but have yet to find anything satisfactory.

For quilts and heavier blankets we just take those to the complex's laundry room and wash there. That's about the only real drawback, but not enough to make me regret the purchase.

The machine itself is simple enough to use, even Typhoon has done some of his own laundry. I liked it so much that in January I bought one for my mother, who had failed to tell me that she had been doing her laundry by hand for months or paying to have someone do at her local laundry mat.

I had a video of both Typhoon and me doing laundry but I couldn't get the video off the phone to upload on the website. Shoot.

Now since I love it so much you may wonder why not 5 stars. I docked a star for the HORRIBLE intake hose that will not fit any US sink that I have ever encounter. It would have been nice in the description for them to mention that if you wanted to use a faucet you would need to make some additional purchases. That just annoyed me, but now hopefully, if you have read all of this then you know what else you will need.

In total with all the additional parts I paid less than $130 price a traditional washer and dryer and that price right there is golden. I am a Prime Member so I did not pay to ship on anything I ordered. I was a bit nervous about it breaking so to be safe I did purchase the 3-year appliance protection plan, haven't had to use it and hopefully won't need to, but I didn't want something to go kerplunk after the 30-day return window closed. Nor did I want the seller to disappear. This way my mind was at ease. It's been 8 months and I'm happy as can be.

title: This washer works great.
text: I created my own little setup with this washer because I don't like picking up heavy things. I use a home depot bucket and two pumps and pipes like what you use to clean an aquarium. I use my kitchen sink to pump water into the washer. I drain the water into the bucket which in turns pumps the dirty water into my bathroom sink. Fill the washer halfway with clothes and water, 3 teaspoons of detergent, wash and drain one cycle, then wash again without the detergent, spin, and my clothes come out fresh. I then hang and put into a Panda dryer and voila.

title: An excellent investment
text: I read many reviews for different portable washing machines and decided to purchase this one and I am very pleased with it. It has saved me trips to the laundromat and I've since wondered why I didn't buy this contraption 10 years ago. I love that I can wash in my home. After the spin cycle the clothes are almost 80% I'm like "this is music!" I haven't yet brought the piece to attach to the hose that'll attach to the tap so the water can travel from point A to point B but that's neither here or there - grab a large bowl or bucket, fill it with water a few times, pour it into the washer part, voila! Water in the washer. A few times I forgot to turn the the knob that stops the water from exiting (I was wondering why the water wasn't staying in the washer, duh!), turned the nob back and it was good to go. You won't regret your decision to buy this joyful product and your clothes will love you back. Promise!

title: Sturdy, powerful, effective
text: Wow can this thing wash! At only $100 bucks, this washer is powerful enough to get a small wine stain off my bright white shirt (with the proper detergent of course). I am so excited that I no longer have to wash my intimates with the general public. Setup is easy too. If you really want to get fancy, you'll have to buy an adapter for the hose because it doesn't fit any conventional sink spouts. If not, you can just fill the washer with a bucket no problem. I can also fit quite a bit of clothes up to the fill line. The dryer doesn't dry completely, but if you take the time to wring out clothes before putting them in, they go from sopping to just damp in the center, which you can finish off with a couple hours of hang drying. With all that said the value is excellent! Very happy to have invested in this washer.

I put mine in the tub and fill it up with water using a bucket.  That was just my preference as it does have a hose that you can attach to the bathroom sink with a little tweaking.  The spinner is very powerful and spins half loads.  If you allow it to spin for the full 5 minutes your clothes will be practically dry in very little time on a clothes rack. title: Prefect for a small space

title: Five Stars
text: Really works and a time saver

title: Hey not bad!
text:
My motivations for looking for a portable washer: I needed to give in and just make laundry more convenient by being able to do it in my apartment, huge industrial washers rough up my clothes, I had just ordered a bunch of very prissy workout clothes that needed cold and gentle washing and air drying, was sick of watching my laundry basket overflow and have to do a bunch of laundry at once …list goes on.

I live in a 350 sq ft apartment and honestly this is a little big. Also, as you’ll see noted in the video reviews/how-tos, you’ll need a sort of “rig” since it drains via gravity and may be a little too big to remain in one’s bathroom or have a designated space, ya know.

As everyone says — the water input hose does not fit. Go to an Ace Hardware and I’m sure it’s easy enough to adapt but I haven’t done that yet. So far I’ve either poured water in using big Tupperware. My sink is slow and this takes a while. Big downside.

The instructions are *just* indecipherable enough to not be useful (features a bad word in there too). I watched a couple videos here and then riffed. I fill the wash tub about 3/4 full and used the 2/5 level of liquid in the detergent measuring cup. Ran a gentle cycle. Water does get grody, it’s great. Drain it out. Then, I refilled the wash bin without detergent for the rinse cycle. Makes sense, right? Drain again and plop half the laundry in the spinner — DO NOT forget the little plastic thing on top. This thing SPINS. People were saying clothes were like 90% dry and I assumed that was an overestimate but they really do come out incredibly dry for not having a heat source. Air dry that, spin dry the rest, air dry, done. Might have to relocate the unit. Lift with your legs, kids….not your back.

Will update if any more pertinent info comes up.

Update!
Err on the side of LESS detergent. More detergent will leave your stuff crunchy and weird. A couple of my towels have come out a little misshapen (temporary? Permanent? I don’t know)….other clothing, perfectly fine. This includes washable shoes like Allbirds, which I wash, rinse, squeeze by hand and leave in the sun to air dry without a spin dry.

Honestly, I love this thing. Not perfect but it makes laundry fun and my place smells like clean linen for a WHILE afterward. Laundry is finally manageable. Great for me as a single lady!

title: NO MORE PAYING FOR LAUNDRY *jumps with joy*
text:
This washer is EVERYTHING I have been needing in my life.

I live in a 1 bedroom apartment with my partner. We pay $1.75/wash and $1.25/dry in the "community" laundry facilities in our complex's basement. What a rip off. One day I was poking around on Amazon and I stumbled upon the wonderful world of PORTABLE WASHERS. WHO KNEW?! It was the answer to my prayers.

We put it in the shower/tub area of our apartment. Took basically no time to set up. We hopped over to Ace Hardware and bought a dishwasher hose set (just a long plastic water tube with 2 rubber ends with metal tighteners on the ends) and it fastened nicely to the shower head area and the cheapy water hose they give you. You just have to do a little DYI-ing to get this thing hooked up- but honestly it's so simple and worth EVERY ounce of effort.

We never have to use the apartment complex's laundry anymore, and it saves us a LOT of money. Also saves us detergent I am sure as well, since you only need such a small amount.

It is a VERY powerful machine (much more than I anticipated) and you can actually fit quite a bit of clothes in it as well. The spin "dryer" is not an actual dryer, it mimmicks the spin cycle on a washing machine. However, it does get your clothes quite dry! (Will still need to hang dry or put in actual dryer). Also I will add it does make doing laundry much more time consuming, since you have to tend to the machine every 6-15 minutes to drain, or switch over, or refill, etc. (which I am not even mad about, because again, saving $$$)

Overall, I would say this has been hands-down, the absolute BEST thing I have ever purchased on Amazon, and I have purchased a ton. It is such a life saver. And now we can do small loads of things we would normally have to wait to do (ie WHITES!).

title: Worth the laugh for the manual
text: Don't even expect it to hook up to the sink.  We have had this machine for a couple of weeks and are really working it.  It absolutely cleans the clothing and is actually fun to use.  Just throw away or save the hose for another use and use a bucket to fill or a detachable shower head.  It can be retrofitted with a trip to the hardware store if you wish but I either use one or the other of the above.  They really need a translator for the manual.  It is a hoot!  I highly recommend this product.. A little perturbed that the price seems to have nearly doubled during the COVID-19 time, but as a product it is good.

title: Little space no problem

I have it set up so I fill the water with a bucket instead of having it hooked up to the water which I don't mind.  The spin shakes a decent amount but I don't mind.  I'm just so happy I don't have to drag my husband and my clothes to my parents anymore

It is great! I highly recommend! This lil guy hasn't let me down! Was the best .... under a hundred bucks... i have ever spent! Told my father about it... he even purchased one! HE loves it!!!

title: Save yourself some some time and money!!! Get this washer!!!
text: Was spending $20 and a day off every 2 weeks at the laundromat. $40* 1yr = $480. It takes me just a little spare time to do a load everynight now. So far, durable. Can fit a full size sheet set. Has freed up a lot of my time and money.

title: Effective, reliable, compact machine for washing clothes
text:
This is one of the beet purchases/decisions I have made over the past few years. I love this machine. It is portable, reliable, and effective. I have used it for 2.5 years without any issues. I do at least two loads weekly for any delicates/lightweight clothing that is suitable for air/hangdrying, as I do not have a conventional clothes dryer. *This unit does NOT INCLUDE A DRYER of any kind. The two compartments are the washing tub and the spinning tub, extracting enough moisture such that the clothes can then be hung to air dry.* I use this unit in conjunction with the Tidalpool Portable Clothes Dryer, also purchased on Amazon.

In addition to lightweight clothing, I also wash my jeans in this washer. However, I have found that it is not my favorite way to launder towels, cotton T-shirts, and sweatshirts, due to the fact that I can’t use conventional dryer sheets or fabric softener during the drying of those items.

I love in a small condo that does not have washer and dryer hookups. I use this unit in my bathtub/shower so that the water tube can drain there without any danger of leaking/flooding. I also kept the original styrofoam base that the unit was packed in and place that in the bathtub, and then the unit snug in it. I have found that this prevents any damage to the bathtub/shower floor and cuts down on vibration and noise during the wash and spin cycles.

title: Great machine
text: My husband I live on a homestead where we harvest rain water then store it in large tanks. We had older full size washer that we could fill using water hose to do our wash. The washer was housed in an outbuilding. I purchased this small costway  washer last winter to use inside our home because we winterized the big washer for the winter. I sat it in the walk in shower and filled it using the detachable shower head. I used a tub for rinse water. I was amazed at how well it washed clothes. This summer the full size washer quit working. I purchased  manual wringers and agitator and practically destroyed my shoulder trying to use those darn wringers. We were unsuccessful at finding another full size machine similar to the one we had so I resorted to using the little costway machine to do laundry. I sat it on the deck for rest of summer and it did a wonderful job washing our clothes,and trust me, some of those clothes were filthy from the many farm chores we do. So now I am purchasing another costway machine just to have on hand if the other one tears up. It uses a fraction of the water and electricity a big machine uses and it spins the clothes dry. I store it under my kitchen table until I need it. I can let clothes soak in it for as long as I need to and I can reset the timer on heavily soiled loads. This is perfect for rv. or off grid.

The spin tub spins out about 90%+ water so the garments are almost dried but you must split the load as the spin tub is smaller and understandably so for it's purpose. If you are looking for a small unit for your RV, off-grid, small apartment etc, I highly recommend this unit! Watch a few You Tube videos featuring this product and you will see what I am talking about. I am seriously questioning ever going back to a regular sized washing machine for home use.

title: LIFE CHANGING!
text: I have been living in a travel trailer for almost 3 months. On Nov 8th, my beautiful town of Paradise CA, was burned to the ground, in the WORST fire in CA history. 97% of the town was destroyed.  (Camp Fire on Youtube). Tens of thousands of people were displaced,  and sadly 90 people perished.  This was the most horrific thing I have ever been through.  Sorry, for the sad preface to this review, I'm trying to tell you the reason for buying this little washing machine.  As I said, I have been living in a travel trailer since the fire. I have several health issues that limit my mobility, so lugging laundry to a laundromat, was becoming an issue. After reading reviews on many options, I chose this little LIFE SAVER! I know this sounds cheesy, but it has been life changing! It fits perfectly in the shower of my RV. (pix attached) I use the hand held shower to fill it with water! After washing a load, it drains, right down the shower. This machine might be small, but it is MIGHTY! The key is to not to overload it. When properly loaded, the clothes swirl like crazy, and get very clean. After the 15 minute wash cycle, I drain it, refill with cold water, and let it agitate and rinse for 3 to 6 minutes, then drain again. Then I put a couple of items at a time in the spinner, and spin for 5 min. It's incredible how much water comes out of the drain hose spinning just a few items! It's very powerful. The clothes comes out, barely damp. I have a big wooden clothes rack , that I hang them on, and hangers for shirts, to dry. Doing laundry has become so much easier, plus not having to go to a laundromat,  will pay for this awesome little machine in no time!

title: AWESOME WASHING MACHINE & SPINNER
text: This washer/spinner works great. I use a white plastic pole put together stand. I cut the legs down with a hack saw to measure exactly 12" high, (or use a power miter saw or whatever) but this stand is a bit unstable, so need to stay with it while washing and spinning; so my suggestion is build a mini pallet, using 2"x4" - cut 8" high - 4 deep on ends, and 4 deep 24" long for top and bottom, over the end pieces, not inside. Screws from top and sides make this stable. This gives you a 16" wide solid base to stand washer next to a tub.  (It takes 3-2"x4" and wood screws, about $10.) You can get them cut to measure at H D or L so you have the pieces. Use a drill and wood screws to put together. Put whatever you use on a cushioned backed small rug that is turned upside down, so it will scoot when cleaning. I put a colored towel over the rubber backing so it looks nice and on top I folded a heavy towel for the washer to stand on. These accommodations quiet everything down. Noise is not bad but In apartments we need to keep that in mind. This height is workable and it drains right into the tub. *** This washer cleans amazingly, just DO NOT OVERLOAD it, and you will be happy.

text: This is a pretty incredible little machine! Gets my clothes exceptionally clean and set in stains have even disappeared from my kids clothes.
