title: Great buy, but don’t expect a traditional washer and dryer
text:
This is a great purchase, if you have the space for a mini washer. It fits in my small clothes closet. I bought this as a new Mom not wanting to leave my place to go to the washateria with a newborn.

This can easily be buyer’s remorse of you don’t have great instructions/tips to follow. Someone posted perfect instructions in the reviews so look out for them. Also know a few things:

1) you can sit the dryer in your bathtub
2) use a bucket to fill the water in the washer portion. Just make sure it’s not on drain setting while you’re filling or the water will come out lol (I kept making this mistake)
3) use a few tablespoons of soap. Literally. (The first time, I used half a cup and tried to rinse my clothes 3 times at 15 minutes each and still the soap was in my clothes, so I had to hand rinse em and that was a nightmare!)
4) wring out your clothes after you wash before you put em in the spinner. It will help them dry faster
5) this is a spinner not a dryer so depending on how many times you spin, (I recommend 5-7 times, and hang dry afterwards) it won’t be completely dry
6) the spinner is half the size of the washer
7) you can wash & spin at the same time but it will take some time
8) it may help to use an extension cord because the plug is a bit short if you plan to use it in
9) you can wash full sized sheets
10) don’t put items with zippers and little things that can snag easily in this washer or your clothes may get snagged easily
11) don’t forget to empty the lint inside of the washer
12) you may need a lint roller after you use the spinner on your clothes
13) regular noise level as a traditional washer/dryer if you wash/spin a full load. May be noisy if you don’t have alot of clothes inside the washer or if you forget to use the top inside the spinner on top of the clothes.

(THE SPINNER IS NOT A DRYER)

Overall, if you don’t wanna do a lot of work, this isn’t the dryer for you because it is a bit of work (filling with water, multiple spins, possibly hang drying, etc.).

I’m happy with the purchase and works for me.

title: Worth the money
text: I’ve had my portable washer for about six months. It is a lifesaver for apartment living. It is small enough to fit in my stand up shower on top of a square night stand. This particular machine has a gravity drain so the hose needs to be dangling underneath to let all the water out. I use it for my clothes as well as my husbands and babies. It has washed out all sorts of baby stains. It is a little noisy and has some movement if the spin compartment is slightly overloaded. I probably push this thing to the limit which is why I will sometimes smell something from the motor, but you can surprisingly fit a good amount in this. I like that it is fairly easy to clean so no mold builds up. The spin cycle almost dries clothes completely, but make sure to rinse the clothes well and really shake them out or else they will feel like sandpaper when dry. I would definitely buy again and this has come in such good handy especially now that I am too nervous to use a public laundromat in a pandemic.

title: It’s awesome
text: I took a long time to write this review because I wanted to make sure it actually held up. Let me start by saying I live in Houston TX where it’s super hot. I live in an apartment on the second floor with no washer or dryer. I’m 5’5 125 pounds and carrying loads of clothes every week started to become a headache. Don’t let two weeks go by, ugh. Well let me just say this has changed my life for ever!!!! I couldn’t be happier. I started using it in the tub and didn’t like the way I had to connect it so I decided to put it on my counter when I’m using it which works perfectly. I didn’t purchase any extra parts. I took the little washer thing off my sink and pushed the hose into it!!!!! The other hose where the water drains fits perfectly into the sink. You can was loads with this thing. I will wash about four pairs of pants, five shirts and undergarments at one time. I also wash throw blankets, sheets, bathroom rugs and hallway rugs. So you pretty much can was anything except blankets!!! Hang them up and your good to go. Hopefully this will help someone who goes through the struggle like I did. Free your time and mind!

title: My second!  It is a great little machine
text: This is my second machine.  The other one lasted close to three years with weekly washing for two.  I ordered for hand washables then my basement flooded my washing machine and dryer. So I bought some drying racks and kept going.  I ordered this new one on the 22nd and it arrived via FedEx before noon on the 28th. Just in time for wash day.  It does best when doing what I would call 2/3rd loads.  Overfilling it can strain the motor, which I think I did several times.  My husband wears heavy jeans and I would say use caution there.  Most everything else is appropriate use good judgement.  It can handle a Queen sheet set okay, I usually untangle them before starting the rinse cycle.  Remember to clean the lint trap regularly. I use my timer on my watch to remember to start the rinse cycle and spinner/dryer.  The spinner really does do much better to wring the extra water out than my old washing machine.  Things hang dry very fast.  Overall I’m very happy with my little laundry helper.  I get a lot of things done by staying home instead of going to the laundry mat. And it is light enough for me to move it if I need to.

text:

title: Pros & Cons
text:
Doing cons first so you know what to expect/prepare they are minor:

Cons:
1) the power cord is extremely short, I needed a extension cord. (Get a 3 hole extension cord, not 2)
2) comes with a hose to attach to the sink, doesn’t work out. Definitely get yourself a new shower head that has a hose. (You will be filling bucket after bucket and ends up being a lot of work especially on your back)
3) it drains by gravity you will need to find the perfect stools or something to make sure it’s higher to drain. If you do it in the tub the water could burn out the motor.
4) if you don’t get a stool or something higher, get a rubber mat for the tub.
5) do not put a lot of soap at first will take a long time to rinse

Pros:
1) it’s quiet enough
2) it’s light
3) easy to tuck away
4) for me personally easier, instead of carrying laundry down 3 flights of stairs to go to a laundry mat, and pay a lot of money.
5) it does spin, the water is always colored
6) the dryer works more than I even believe.

I'm giving this 4 stars because the merchant responded quickly to help me, and when it still couldn't be fixed, I received a full refund. So I took my refund and applied it to their more fancy model, and it was well worth it. Sometimes things just break on their own, there's no such thing as a perfect product, but I give the merchant 5 stars for all their effort. P.S. my friend bought this model and it's still working beautifully for her.

title: Worth it for my small apartment!!
text: Got this a few weeks ago and so far worth every penny! (although it has gone up in price since). It’s small and easy to move around, very user friendly. Washer and spinner (NOT dryer) work speedily and the spinner rings out your clothes amazingly! Makes air drying better. It is a good idea to elevate it while in use to make sure gravity drains out all of the water, otherwise water will stay in the machine without you realizing. You can also switch the drain to either side of it, which was very helpful. Haven’t used the water inlet tube to fill the washer with water, as it’s easier to just fill up with a bucket or detachable shower head. Other compact washers may be more convenient with not having to unload clothes from washer to spinner, but I don’t mind it. I’m not expecting it to last long term, but if I get even a year out of it’ll still be money well spent. Also, watch YouTube videos for tips and instructions versus reading the illegible manual. Happy washing 👍

title: Exactly what I was looking for
text: I was doing a lot of research on portable washers as I didnt want to deal with bringing my cloths somewhere, pay, and wait for them to be done. I wanted to do my laundry in my apartment. I decided to go with this washer as it had some good reviews and seemed decent from what videos I could find. I wanted something quiet as the people in my building are known for making noise complaints to each other. I will say the wash cycle was a little louder than expected with an off and on deep hum noise but it's not too bad. The spin cycle I was a little hesitant to try as from what I heard its louder than the wash. I tried it today and honestly I think it's a little quieter. The first two seconds are loud yes but after it dulls down to a hum no louder than a small AC or a portable dehumidifier. Been using this product for almost a week now and enjoy it! My cloths are left smelling fresh like the detergent I use and I found with some fabric softener your cloths dont end up as stiff as normal hand drying! If your looking for a small washer to do your laundry I decently recomend getting this.

title: you need this!

title: Revised to 5 stars
text:
I am revising my previous review on this one. I purchased this 2/16/2017 and am only now realizing the full benefit it affords. Originally, I thought that this unit did not live up to expectations but after giving up on it I decided to give it another try. I'm glad I did.

You have to come up with a way to streamline the process using this machine.

Important factors to consider

Where will you put it?
How will you fill it?
How will you drain it?
Where will hang clothes to dry after spin?

I keep mine in my bathtub and fill it from the tub's spout. It drains down the tub's drain.
I have a drying rack that can be used indoors or out.

Don't overfill the dryer. Put the heavier items on the bottom of the spinner.

After draining water, clothes are still soapy. I keep unit set to "drain" and add more water to "rinse". I also will run clothes under tub's spout sometimes (if needed) to further rinse.

Don't put delicate items in here. No knit sweaters etc.! Best for socks, underwear, etc. Caution putting items you can't live without or spent a fortune on in here.

Better to do small loads frequently than big loads occasionally.

It took me a while to figure out the nuances of the machine and to come up with a way to make it effective for me. Once I put a system in place and realized the machine's limits/benefits I found it to be much more helpful.

👍

Old review:

Hard to rinse soap out of clothes. Have to run several times with just water to try to remove soap. Still seems like soap still present in clothes. Spinner very aggressive. Stretches clothing out. Not good for anything delicate. Gave up. Back to laundromat. By the time you do several loads and hang up to dry laundromat quicker. Wanted to love but is just bleh.

title: PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU BUY
text:
I'm not exactly happy. 1) it requires a lot of my time and involvement. I have to put the water in manually (with a bucket) as the hose it came with is too short and incompatible with all the faucets. Then pour water over the clothes to get some of the soap out then fill up again for the rinse cycle . 2)the lint situation is real. The machine does come with a lint catcher built in, however, you still need to put a nylon or catcher at the end of the draining hose else you get stuck with a whole lot of lint in your bathtub. 3)my clothes that I purchased last season look like they've been around for a few years, threads poking out,beads and buttons popping, sweaters needing a shave, after 1 wash!! 4) the dryer part is more like a wringer. It wrings out the clothing very nicely, but you still need to hang them for them to dry. 5) after hanging, you now need to take off the lint, and steam or iron out the wrinkles.
I thought I was going to save time and money, but I end up spending more time babysitting the machine and my clothes took a beating.
While it does the job, these were some things that I found wrong with it.

title: Does the job! Great customer service
text:
I purchased this washer when our full sized one needed repair over a span of weeks. The first one came broken/ had holes in at least two places. After I contacted CS, the company kindly sent another one and let us keep the damaged one (great for parts!)
Pros: small foot print; easy to operate; lint capture works; spinner is awesome; one load's capacity enough for a day's clothing for 2 people;
Cons: hose size does not fit regular hose/faucet; needs adapter
The unit is now in our cabin where there is no regular size washer. Great for emergency washing needs!

title: Be prepared to be active
text:
I love my little washer. I live on the top floor with the washing machine in the basement so this saves me trips up and down stairs. I do worry about the noise though. I have the washer sitting on the bottom piece of foam that came with the box, on top of a towel on top of a small table. The motor does make a bit of a noise and I think it vibrates a bit. I plan to get some vibration absorbing foam to put under it to see if it helps.

I use it about every two weeks to do my full loads of laundry. I separate colors and whites and it generally takes a nice amount. My bathroom is too small to use this in so I keep it by the kitchen and use a bucket to fill the machine and to put the dirty water in. So it takes some work to use it, but I’m willing to put the work in.

The spin cycle is small but it gets things about 90% dry. I even put a down pillow in and it was fine. I can fit a full body towel in there and it’ll be fine.

If you’re in college or a small apartment I recommend this highly. But it might be too small for two people or more. I’d look at other reviews and take their suggestions, it helped me with my purchase.

title: Wow!
text: This little machine is great! It does everything it is suppose to. You do have to cut way back on the amount of detergent you use and I am going to make my own using the recipe recommended by Paula Codo on YouTube. title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT! Save your money.
text:
I purchased this product in early May. By September, the spin dryer no longer worked. When I used it last, the spinner began to make a very loud mechanical sound and then turned off abruptly. Afterwards, the dial would turn and make a low buzzing noise, but the spinner would not start. The washer works fine, but it is pointless to use without the spinner because it takes so much effort to drain the machine. Even after you completely drain, your clothes are still lying in a significant amount of water. The hose is too small to fit on any faucet. I had to use a bucket to fill the washer manually, which definitely took some time since I had to keep refilling the bucket. To drain, you have to lift the machine into the tub or sink because it will not drain on a flat surface due to how the hose is attached to the machine. The manual is almost impossible to figure out because it was originally written in another language and then reprinted in English using some cheap translation service. You can't make any sense out of the directions or trouble shooting sections.

Also, this machine is loud. So if you live in apartment where washers are not allowed, you should reconsider purchasing this product. The spinner makes a lot of noise and it is obvious that a washing machine is in use once you start your cycle. My neighbors a floor above me told me they could definitely hear it when it was in use.

I reached out to the sellers twice and they have not responded to any of my requests for a refund. This was a complete waste of money and Amazon will not let me submit a report since the purchase date has surpassed the return window.

title: Perfect for RV use!
text: I really love this little washer and spin dryer! It does a great job cleaning and most of the clothes come out about 80% dry. I hang them up and they are dry by morning. The only issue I have is that even when the setting is on normal, some of the water is still draining from the washer while I’m trying to fill it up. I have to keep the hose up and attached to the side so it doesn’t come out. Not a huge deal but it didn’t do that at first so I’m not sure what happened to it. I still love having this in my 5th wheel and it’s saving us so much money instead of going to the laundromat. I originally kept it in the tub and took it out when someone needed to shower but being pregnant that got old fast haha. So I bought a cart from target and keep it on the second shelf (didn’t install top shelf) so it had plenty of height for the hose to drain off into the tub. I also just wheel it over to the shower and use the detachable shower head to fill it instead of messing with the fill inlet. My process for using it to get the best results is: fill washer up to H fill line, add detergent, set timer for 2 minutes to get everything mixed up, add clothes (keep darks and lights separated otherwise you’ll end up with a lot of lint on your dark clothing), run for 15 minutes, drain, fill back up, add 1/4 cup vinegar (helps get all the detergent out and acts as fabric softener, you can’t smell the vinegar when they’re done), swish for 2 minutes, drain, add half clothes to dryer and spin for 3 minutes, then the other half same time. That’s it. They come out super clean and smelling great. I do use a pretreatment spray on my boys clothes to prevent stains.

text: This was well worth the money spent. Great investment for anyone who lives in a small space or needs a compact washer for on the road.

title: Perfect for Anyone Currently Handwashing Laundry or Apartment Dwellers
text:
Life changer for me. I bought this (from another retailer - wanted to be able to use PayPal 6 months no interest, no payments) because I wanted a lightweight portable washer with a gravity drain. A pump (to me) was just another thing that could break and would just make the machine heavier.

Cons:
1). The water intake pipe does not fit any faucet in my home. I tried to find a turkey baster in 4 different stores in town, no luck. I just use a funnel and hold it up to my shower head for ~5 mins to fill for large loads.

2). The power cord is too short. I have to use an outdoor extension cord for it to reach an outlet in my bathroom.

3). Lint trap does almost nothing. Even doing towels, it barely catches any hair or lint.

Pros:
1). Lightweight - very easy for me to lift in and out of my bathtub

2). Quiet - I live in a 2nd floor apartment. To keep it quieter and prevent damage to my tub, I bought some no slip drawer liners and dense scrubby sponges from the Dollar Tree to cushion the "feet". It also prevents the washer from "walking" when the spinner is unbalanced at first from just being loaded. TIP: if you use the water intake to rinse, start rinsing a few seconds BEFORE you turn on the spinner and continue rinsing until the drain water is clear - balances the load much quicker.

3). Cleans very well. Haven't had an issue with clothes not being thoroughly clean after a 6 minute cycle. Uses much less detergent, bleach, and fabric softener too - about a tablespoon each (little less on softener) for full loads.

Overall, no real complaints. While it is not perfect, I don't have to spend tons of quarters on laundry anymore. A few household items or dollar store hacks help where the machine does fall short. I now can't use the excuses of I don't have laundry money -or- It's too cold/hot/rainy to lug this stuff up to the laundromat.

Edited to add: For anyone with kids - this does fit and properly wash/spin a twin sized comforter. I wouldn't put the sheets in at the same time because I think it wouldn't clean as well, but they would fit if you truly didn't want/have a second load.

title: does a nice job with hand washables
text: Been using this for several weeks for all the work clothes I used to wash by hand. I love it. After the clothes are spun, they really are almost dry so I can hang them anywhere to finish drying with no dripping at all. And they are easily completely dry by the next day. This came in less than a week and i was skeptical about whether it could work well, given that it was cheaper than most other models out there. But it cleans out any dirt and stains  from work. My husband has started using it to wash his nicer clothes too and it gets out everything he spills on it. I do only use a scant tablespoon of Tide or it gets too soapy and I have to rinse several times. This won't replace your reg machine since one towel fills it (if you have fluffy towels like I do.)

title: Awesome for small apartments
text: I was surprised with this washer. I wasn't expecting it to be so light and get my clothes as clean as it does. It's not too loud but it's not totally quiet either. It fits perfect in the bathtub.

title: I don't write reviews but...
text: This is like my.... Fifth load, I think? I ordered last week, got it today. I was SO EXCITED but finally got home to use it. I had watched a video that a reviewer on here had done and was already familiar with it. Plus, I compared to other options A LOT but finally decided this was the one for me. Anyways, I filled it up (which no, the hose that should attach to the sink does NOT fit to my sink, but it really wasn't that hard to stand there and hold it up to the faucet to let it fill.) about 3/4 of the way. I used the full 15 minutes wash, but it really wasn't necessary. Loaded the clothes. And was amazed! It doesn't make barely any noise. (I was worried about it since I live on the third floor with a couple neighbors) took barely any soap. Once it's done, it'll stop and you have to get the hose ready to switch it to drain on the middle switch, then switch and it came out (washed SO well too, you could see the dirt!!!!!!). You have to wring out the clothes to put them in the spinner but it's not that bad at all. Throw them in the spinner, and boom. Five minutes and they're almost more dry than an electric dryer would get them! I swear. I still hung them up to make sure but they didn't take long to dry after putting a fan on them. And I don't know why some of the other reviews are saying you can't use the washer and spinner at the same time? Because I was able to. Anyways, I don't ever write reviews but this called for it. I did my research, my comparing, my agonizing over it.... It's going to make my life a million times easier. There is a bit of work involved, but hello it's laundry. Awesome buy!!!!

title: So in love

title: Perfect for if you live in an apartment
text: [[VIDEOID:82460f720c5b100fd77af053b24aafff]] I've had this product for about a year-and-a-half , and it has saved me so much money by not using the community washers in my apartment complex. As you can see from my second photo I used an old shower head line that I attached to the line that was supplied with this unit, so whenever I have to use it all I have to do is unscrew the new shower head line and screw in this washer line it's so easy. Two very important things to note if you plan on buying this product is first it is NOT an automatic washer so if you're the lazy sort don't bother with this because you do need to fill it up with water and drain it each time you use this which can be a lot of work, and second is do not and I repeat do not overfill this product because you can easily damaged it and it won't clean the clothes that well if you overload it. I would say to be safe don't fill it up past the medium line with clothing I would suggest looking at the video that I posted with this review it shows that your wash should spin just as freely as it does in the video oh, if your clothing gets too bunched up and it barely spins then you have overloaded it. Other than that this is a great product and I would definitely buy one again

title: Good machine, here's a fix if your spinner stops spinning
text:
Love this thing, but on day three the clothes spinner (dryer) stopped spinning. Super irritating, but I spent enough time trying to diagnose the problem to figure out that if you tilt the machine back the tub will re-engage with the motor and start working again. So put the clothes in the spinner, turn it on, and then tilt it back so the front bottom edge is 4 or more inches off the floor while the back legs remain on the ground. Adjust your tilt until it's spinning freely again. Not ideal, but I don't care since the alternative is heaps of dripping wet clothes.

Overall I am happy with this washer. Really like that you can use it like a hamper and then just run it every couple days and hang the clothes to finish drying. Also like how easy it is to customize the water temperature, which is not possible on commercial washers. It uses a surprisingly small amount of detergent, yet cleans really well. Much less expensive than quarters in the laundry room.

title: Love it.
text:
I am a laundry hobo as I wait for my house to be built and refuse to use the disgusting laundromat in Hartland, Michigan. I ordered this machine out of desperation. When I initially received it, I was very skeptical for two reasons: A) it appeared that it had been used; B) it seemed very lightweight - as if there was nothing to it. I contacted the seller and they assured me that they “test every one” before it leaves the shop (...ok) and I could return it if it sucked. After a month I can say that I love this little bastard. I have been using it for everything but quilts and towels, although it might be able to handle a few towels I don’t want to risk it. The filthy water that drains out after a wash is very satisfying and may be a testament to my dirty kids OR it’s washing ability (not sure) but I want to think that it kicks so much ass at washing clothes. Better than the disgusting laundry machines at the laundromat in Hartland, Michigan.

If you have a temporary situation and think the laundromat in Hartland, Michigan (or wherever you may reside) is disgusting I strongly recommend this purchase. Or if you are living on your own and don’t mind hanging your clothes to dry. This thing has a separate bin to spin the clothes and it gets them almost dry after a few minutes but they still need to be hung overnight.

title: Laundry solution
text: This is a portable washing machine.  The brand is Costway.  It works by washing clothes in one side and the other side is a spin dryer.  The spin dryer leaves the clothes damp.  They can then be hung on a clothesline or placed on a drying rack.  It does not have a pump so you will need to manually raise the machine higher than the level of the drain to drain the water.  It is heavy when full.  The washing machine was slightly damaged when I received it (cracking around the edge under the lid).  I decided it was not in an area that would affect the functionality of the machine and choose to keep it.  The capacity of the machine is about 3-5 adult size items.  I have also washed twin size sheets, throws, towels and light weight blankets.  In the plus column, This machine does indeed get clothes clean and is much more economical than the laundry mat. In the minus column, the machine isn't built for long term durability.  The hoses which attach to the machine are made of the cheapest possible material and have begun to leak already.  The connector which is provided to attach to the faucet is impractical.  It won't fit anything.  I use a funnel to fill the machine and hold the hose until the machine fills. It takes about 3 minutes.  The spin dryer works inconsistently.  The clothes get out of balance and you have to stop, readjust, try again. All in all,  the concept of the machine works very well.  However in hindsight, it might have been better to spend a little more money to get something that is a little better quality.

title: Great customer service!
text: I avoid writing negative reviews unless something is broken and the manufacturer or seller's customer service is poor when I attempt to get the issue resolved.  If a new machine is broken upon arrival, it is typically simply a lemon. Just about every brand has a lemon out there -- be it a makeup compact containing a crack in the powder or a vase with a chip. It's unfair to trash the brand or the item simply because one has received a lemon. In my case, I received such a lemon. I won't elaborate on the issues, but the washer clearly didn't work as intended. I emailed the manufacturer, and they responded within a few hours. They were gracious, understanding and trusting. They asked that I provide them with the order number and a video or two illustrating the problems. Within a few days of receiving my videos they asked whether I'd like a refund or a new machine. I'm looking forward to receiving the replacement they've sent, as having read all the community questions, answers and reviews, I'm confident that the replacement is going to function as intended. This review is strictly about Costway's (Giantex) customer service, which is outstanding. I'll write my next review when I get to use my new machine.

title: Wonderful for apartment living!!
text:
I’m in love with this little machine. I live in an apartment building with one coin-op washer and dryer for everyone. This is the perfect solution to my public-laundry woes.
Pros:
-It’s compact and fits into a small space in my small bathroom.
-The gravity drainage system means I can place the drain tube in my shower without moving the unit. Because there isna slight lift into the shower, the tube doesn’t empty entirely, but it isn’t enough of an issue to concern me.
-This only requires a standard electric outlet to operate. There is no extra wiring or plumbing needed to set it up and operate it.
-The wash capacity is pretty impressive for a portable machine. I can fit nearly as much into it as the apartment machine I’ve used for the past
6 years. You can add items to the wash cycle after it’s started, so it’s easy to ensure you’re not over-filling.
-It gets your laundry incredibly clean. I included a picture of the water draining after a wash cycle so you could see how much dirt it got out. Embarassing but helpful.
-The spin cycle gets the items so dry! Seriously,
I’m surprised every time.
-I can do my laundry without ever leaving my apartment!! This alone makes it worth every penny!

Cons:
-The water hoses for filling the machine are woefully short, and are equipped to hook up to no faucet I’ve ever seen. I may one day purchase longer hoses to allow me to fill the wash tub from my bathroom sink, but in the meantime I’ve been using a bucket I fill from the bathtub.
-It’s a little labor intensive. Manually fill the wash tub, run a second cycle to rinse, split the wash into two parts to spin, hang everythig to dry. This isn’t the kind of washing machine where you can push a button and let it do its thing. It needs babysat, but for me, the work is worth it for the convenience.
-The spin compartment is so much smaller than the wash compartment. I imagine it has to do with the motor placement, but it’s taken 3 spin cycles sometimes to finish off the load.
-It’s a little noisy. I live on the top floor and am always worried about causing too much noise for the downstairs neighbors. I’m going to purchase a mat for this to sit on to absorb the noise, and to keep it from “walking” across the tile as it agitates and spins.

I’ve told so many people about this machine. It isn’t perfect, but when you live in an apartment in a big city, you take the conveniences you can get, and this is a HUGE convenience. I highly recommend it!

title: Hey
text: Great product use it everyday

title: Big bang for few bucks.
text: I LOVE this little washer.  It spins so well that it is practically a dryer.  Couldn't be more pleased.  Only con...noisey.  May need to purchase a rubber mat to help.

title: but I have gotten used to doing a load or two a day which takes care of my dirty laundry.
text: Have used this washer for just over a year and have had no problems with it! The spin dryer spins the clothes to almost dry, with a lot less energy than a regular dryer uses! It doesn't hold a lot of clothes, but I have gotten used to doing a load or two a day which takes care of my dirty laundry.

title: I love this machine!!!
text:
I love this machine. Im only sorry I didnt but it sooner!
I was always in the fence thinking well how good could this possibly wash? Well I have news for you! It washes just as good as a regular washer! Just be sure when you spin it to have the clothes evenly distributed or else it will want to walk off lol. But other than that I am pleasantly pleased!

title: Has to have a place to drain water out of hose
text: Works great for small spaces.

title: Gets the job done!
text: [[VIDEOID:3aa7d4b959adfef338b239392e085d27]] Bought this for my daughter for her apartment at school due to the small space.  The building doesn't have shared machines either so she has to go to the local laundromat to do her laundry and pay money for each load.  Installation took a little while because I had to go to the hardware store to get an adaptor for drainage but other than that, it was pretty simple.  You have to do a few more loads then usual with this because of the small size but the spin cycle does get everything fairly dry and then I just hang dry the rest of the way.  Saves some money every month too since I don't have to go pay for the janky old machines at the laundromat.  It does take a little more work on my part to get the laundry done, but it's worth the savings and not having to go sit and wait for the laundry to get done somewhere else.  Something I've figured out is that you can wash and spin dry at the same time and it will still drain the water out of the spinning side even if it isn't set to drain on the dial.  The noise isn't that bad and doesn't last too long either so that's not bad.  All in all this is great for small spaces and it does a very acceptable job at getting the clothes clean.

title: Small but powerful
text: I bought this compact washing machine for my brother who lives in a small 2 room apartment and was struggling having clean clothes since he has no means of transportation.  He is able to wash his towels and clothes regularly now and since the machine doesn't take much detergent, the cost is very low.  He tells me that this machine has changed not only his life, but also his outlook on life every single day.

title: Perfect for RV travel !!!
text: Just got it and love it! We travel full time in a small camper. I hate the hassle and exspense of laundromats. I’ve washed all of the laundry that we have accumulated for the week without stepping foot in a laundromat! So much better than going to a laundromat. It takes a bit of practice to figure out this washer since it is different than “regular” washers. But once you get the hang of it, you’ll love it. I was spending an average of $80 per month on laundromat washing for 2 people. Plus the cost for gas to drive from campground to town each week to do laundry. So this washer will pay for itself in less than two months. I will make a video review after I’ve had it for a few month and will update this review then.

title: Impressive washer, didn't get to try out dryer before it broke
text: Was really impressed with the videos I watched on this, and when I did a load, the washer was impressive; however, throwing in a couple pairs of socks, and 3 t-shirts in the spin dry, it started spinning hard, then made a cranking noise, then stopped working entirely. You could hear the timer ticking still, but no movement, no motor noise. Requested a refund. I would keep/exchange otherwise and live with the louder than expected noise and rocking, but not worth it if I cant trust the spin dry to work.

title: Not discreet, uses gravity to drain, money saving but time consuming. Attachments are flimsy.
text:
Yes it's a great price, but other models have a pump that shoots the water out in order to drain it. I've been using buckets to empty the water out for each cycle. Any remaining water on the bottom has to be emptied each time you spin dry something. I put mine on a dolly (frame with wheels) to give it some height so that the water empties. You have to wring out the clothes before you put them in the spinner.

My main issue with this is that it's extremely loud and can be heard from the floor(s) below. Not ideal for an apartment, unless you put the clothes in the spin dryer one by one. There are better options if you want something that is more efficient. On the plus side, the spin dry does a good job. I do put adult sized jeans in there for about 2 minutes. For best results, keep draining out the water. Don't drop the drain hose! It starts flailing all over the place bc it's very light and short. p.s. use vinegar once in a while to clean it nicely and rid it of any odors.

title: Sad it stopped working so soon
text: It was doing well then 2 weeks later it just stopped working.. First the spin dry then the washer part..

title: Can be better
text: Strong motor, which brings a lot power since it is portable wash machine.  But noisy if you can’t bear with it.

title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT
text:
I've had this for about six months and use it regularly. The capacity is about 1/2 a load of a normal size washer. It gets clothes clean. I haven't washed any heavily soiled items, but normal every day cleaning works fine.

I wash everything except jeans, towels and sheets, which reduces my trip to the laundromat to about once every two weeks. I have washed two towels, or two jeans, or one queen sheet when necessary, but prefer to use full size washer for these items.

The spinner is great, takes about a minute or less, and clothes come out damp, but dry quickly. I usually break the load into two parts to spin.

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I haven't found a good way yet to hook it up to the water. I fill the tub with a bucket for wash and rinse.

Great value for money. I highly recommend.

title: Perfect for Rv’s or single person!!
text: This honestly is such a great purchase! We use it in our RV for traveling. It’s stored directly in our shower and the the hookups from the RV shower connect right to it! It spins our clothes almost completely dry. The only downfall is you can only due 1 pair of jeans and a few tee shirts in the wash at a time and then only the jeans to spin, and tee shirts separate due to weight restriction on spinner. Have some patience when using this machine and you will LOVE it!!!

title: Great little washer
text: One of the best purchases I've made in the past year! Love it.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
text:
I can no longer carry my laundry up and down the stairs. This has given me back some independence. I love it! It works fantastic! My clothes get clean and are practically dry after the spin cycle. It was worth every penny.
UPDATE: I still like my whashing machine. After months of use my only complaint is that the lint trapped on my clothes is outrageous. I diligently clean the lint trap and wipe the inside of the tub out after each use. Where in the world is all the lint coming from? Is it hiding somewhere and just waiting to be spit out all my clothes?

title: Highly recommend
text: I love this washer, it cleans clothes perfectly. I do tend to use a fair amount of detergent more than the "teaspoon" recommended in other reviews. You can wash and spin dry at the same time. I didnt understand what "90% dry" meant until I spinned my clothes. They were very close to dry and only took about 2 hours to dry in a heated room. I recommend this to several people and five bought it so far! I spin my clothes to wash at least three times with detergent and fabric softer and about two times with plain water and laundry sanitizer.

title: Strong eash cycle, gets clothes CLEAN!
text: I am in love with this washer! Had a smaller RV washer in the past that worked very, very well, but this one is SO powerful and gets clothes even cleaner. Would HIGHLY recommend to those who are looking for thos type of set up!

title: Dryer doesn’t work
text: The washer portion is great but the dryer is super small and doesn’t heat up making me have to run it multiple times which I’m sure is making my energy bill rise.

title: Amazing
text: I just received this today (very fast shipping) and have only done 1 load and I’m super impressed. The agitation is great, clothes are clean! 4 stars due to inlet hose being practically useless. I just took off the shower head and put that hose in over the side. Also drain hose is a bit short. We are in an rv so it doesn’t quite fit into shower. I put it on an ottoman and have the hose in shower. I also wish you could spin the whole washed load at once, but you have to do it in halves. That’s ok though, beats the laundromat in  these difficult virus times. I’m impressed.

title: 10 stars if I could
text: I LOVE this machine.  I have had to change soaps because my husband has sensitive skin and I was adding to much liquid detergent or he became allergic to our old soap. So now I use 1/8 of a cup of distiled vineger and an eco egg, or a little bit of open nature laundry detergent. I've now used this washer for several months.  I've had no problems. There's been little increase to my electric bill. I use hot and cold water in my machine. It fits perfect in my shower to drain and I wash loads on the light side so I do one pair of Jean's or a handful of shirts. It is a little time and energy intensive buy it beats going to the laundry mat any day. I spend a little bit of time all day one day a week and then I'm done. I also use a portable Panda clothes dryer to finish drying my clothes in the winter and hang dry in the summer

title: Really works.
text: I love this machine, ever since I got it I can’t seem to stop washing clothes!

title: Awesome little machine.
text: Ordered as a gift, arrived on time. Super light weight. Product is as expected. Works wonderfully!

title: A must buy!! Very durable.
text: I dont normally write reviews, but I was surprised with this purchase. I've had mine for about 2 yrs and still going strong. Its extremely convenient if you in a apartment. I've saved money in water. I live on the 3rd floor so it's a huge hassle walking to the laudry mat and can get expensive. I wouldnt put large comforters in it.

title: I'd recommend looking at some of the videos online that show ...
text: The first item was damaged in shipping and the box was really torn up. Giantex sent me a replacement and it works really well. I'd recommend looking at some of the videos online that show best to use this machine. It is very simple and it is amazing how clean it gets clothes. The spin cycle works so well, that there are no sopping wet clothes to hang on the drying rack. Very much a bargain with how much laundromats cost and the transport of wet clothes is a pain. I dry bedding and towels in a machine only, so this solution is perfect for me.

title: Best little washer!
text: I have a small apartment and very little time to be going to the laundromat every few days. This thing is a LIFESAVER! I recommend it to everybody with a small apartment and limited access to coin-operated laundry. That little spin dryer puts in work! I'd say my clothes, when hung indoors with a fan blowing on them, are wearable within 3-5 hours after washing. Not bad! Remember it doesn't have a pump so you'll need a floor drain. I use my shower stall drain.

title: a great little powerhouse,especially when you have a small load tha needs washing.
text: it fits prefect in my small apartment,.

title: Great mini washer, best spend of the year
text:
Pros, space saving, super quiet, and the spin dry actually gets clothes decently dry to put in a dryer or hang up
.
Cons, GET A DIFFERENT DRAIN HOSE the one that's on the machine WILL break from all the moving around and crinkling in the hose from the prongs that hold it in

title: Neat
text: Works great, but I would suggest looking up a YouTube video on how to use it because I couldn’t understand the very broken English user manual.

title: It’s not worth the money.
text:
This thing was so cheaply made it was laughable. Did it work? Yes. Barely. I used it for over a year. My clothes were barely clean. Draining it is a nightmare. You either need a floor drain or have it up on a stand so the gravity drain can drain down a normal washer drain. It’s a pain to move from room to room. It’s awkward, heavy, and takes up a lot of space in a very small bathroom, if that’s how you intend to use it. It’s nearly impossible to clean under the lids. The plastic drain hose gets horribly gross and is also next to impossible to clean. Inside the spinner is ACTUALLY impossible to clean and it gets gross. It’s made of flimsy plastic and a few motors. The timer/on switch began to die. The washing method it employs does not get your clothes clean, and it also takes FOREVER to do your laundry unless you do it every single day. Don’t even get me started on the inlet hose. It is not a real size of standard plumbing. I spent countless hours at hardware stores and on my floor wanting to rip my hair out over trying to get a hose that would attach to my washer hookups and then into the washer. It was a nightmare. The plastic hose provided is trash and ended up with a leak within months. Please don’t waste your money. Go to a local Habitat for Humanity if you live in the states and pick up a used washer and dryer set. It cost me exactly the same to buy a used set there that has served me so well than it did to buy this chinese garbage. If your problem lies in not having transportation or no hookups, look up the small compact washers sold in Japan. Panasonic makes some amazing ones. They’re expensive, but they’re well made and actually get your clothes clean.

I drug this thing to the curb and stuck a free sign on it months ago.

title: Too much work too much time
text: Way too much work to use and can be rough on cloths. It ripped some of my more fragile jackets.

title: Five Stars
text: I love this little washer

title: Very good quality product and cheap price
text: Very good quality product and cheap price

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
text: I seriously love this little machine!  I live in a small apartment and have to share one W/D unit with 15 other residents, so I was trying to find a simple solution to being able to do laundry without hiking to the W/D, paying $2/load, and hoping it's unoccupied.  This mini washer/spin dryer is AMAZING.  WAY bigger washer side than I expected!  Great product/quality and highly recommend.

title: Five Stars
text: I really love this washing machine.I had this washing machine for two years now. The only problem is the drain hose that has hole in it. I was trying to call customer service to get information on where I can order the replacement hose. I left a message but they never get back to me.

title: Cute!!!
text:
I just got it!!! The only thing was that the plastic in front of the spinner was warped a little, but I think it will eventually push itself out. I can't wait to try it out!!! When I first saw it, I nearly split a gut, lolol, cause it's so tiny. It looked like a toy washer like something from Susie Homemaker!!! I will update you in a few days. Oh the box is not labeled, so the UPS man just brought it right under everybody's nose that was downstairs.

Okay. I am using it right now. I expected that thing to be super loud in my bathroom as it is a little larger than most other bathrooms in this building, but all you can really hear is the off and on hum, and when I go into my office, I can just barely hear it. So far so good. I washed all my clothes and am currently letting the washer dry out before I stow it in my closet. I decided while I was washing to go out to the hallway where my bathroom wall is and could just barely make out the hum of the machine. I put a mat on the shower bench I use to keep the machine from walking off of it.

Oh, I couldn't believe how clean those clothes got!! As far as any smell, I just smelled the newness. I rinsed out the washer before using it. I have not smelled any burning smell yet.

Oh, and I had a couple friends walk past my apartment bathroom on the outside halls. They said they couldn't hear anything. I really love this machine and hope it lasts me a good long time!!!

title: 2 years and still works like new!
text:
I've had mine for 2 years! It's awesome! I wash wash everything except blankets and comforters in it. It's very convenient and is perhaps the best $100 I've ever spent.

I pick it up and put it in my shower when I need to wash anything. To fill it up, I use the detachable shower head. This way I have no plumbing issues and don't have to worry about accidentally flooding my apartment.

title: great for a small space
text: Very pleased with this purchase. It may be small but its powerful. The only thing I dislike is that the cord is not long enough to reach the plug so I have to use an extension cord and its super handy to have a bucket for water because the small hose will take WAY too long to fill up the tub. I just use a bucket and it works perfectly!

title: Money well spent
text: Was an awesome investment, really pleased with it.

title: Works great
text:
Pros:
The product is compact, light, yet fits a decent amount of clothing. it is a definite must-have for every apartment without a washer. The spinner is extremely strong and will literally beat the water out of all clothing. once I spin the clothes, I hang them for a couple of hours and they come out crispy dry as if they came out of a dryer.

Cons:
I received the product clearly used and embellished with multiple scratches/stains. However, I reached out to customer service and they rectified the situation by offering me a partial refund. Once I tested the product multiple times to make sure it works, I accepted the refund and chose to keep the washer.

title: I love it! I never knew my clothes were that ...
text: What can i say? I love it! I never knew my clothes were that dirty! Fits great in my shower!

title: You should get it !!!
text: Package was  on time and this washer do a great job ..

title: Perfect for Pet Fleece
text: I have Guinea pigs and use fleece as bedding. I was able to set the washer/dryer on my bathroom counter close enough to drain to the toilet and fill with a detachable shower head. this machine is perfect for fleece, it cleans pretty well but the best part is that the spin wash completely dries the fleece allowing it to be used or put away immediately turning a wash from 2hour job to a 15minute breeze.

title: Awesome!
text: Buy it! Game changer. Cleaner cloths than traditional washer.

title: What a life saver!
text: I have had mine for a few months now and I just love this little thing. It comes in handy in small apartment.

title: Highly recommended!
text: Our oldest daughter lives in a small apartment with her bf and it has no washer or dryer. We got this mainly to get her by from weekend to weekend for her work clothes, etc. So far this machine has saved them time and money as she/they have started using it for slightly larger loads. They still have to go to their local laundromat but don’t spend anywhere near the money they did before! Highly recommended!

title: I love the easiness that comes with it!
text: I’ve had this machine for a few months now. I’ve only used it fifteen times. The fifteen times I’ve used it it’s been amazing. I only give three stars because I notice that only after 10ish washes my left spin is dramatically weaker than the right spin. There sounds like something is grinding and is loose on the inside but when I took it apart I didn’t notice anything wrong. Bummer since I really liked this machine. Not really built to last....

title: Fantastic washer, may need final custom adapting per household
text:
Absolutely love this little champ. Given, as with most things bought sight unseen, there maybe be compatibility issues with attaching the inlet hose to your particular faucet. This is easily remedied, no plumber needed. What I did was use the Danco 10086 VersaSpray Handheld Shower to extend and adapter, you can buy it here: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B003OJ3LP0/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1 If you cannot fit the adapter over your faucet, no worries mine didn't either, you can unscrew the handheld shower head and screw that into you shower outlet (it fits all standard aka 1/2") and cut off the adapter with scissors on the hose I went about an inch under the adapter. Now just slide the cut end into the given water inlet hose in the side with the hard rubber insert and use a small stainless steel hose clamp to secure the seal. I think I used a 16mm one, you can buy them on Amazon in multipaks or just go to Home Depot it's like a buck. I have this in my bathroom standing on Whitmor Commercial-Grade Steel Supreme Wide Stacking Shelf (bc yeah at this price it is a gravity drain, but it works fine just elevate it or if you have a floor drain just stick the hose in it, I don't so I put it on a stand) also can buy here: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B0007MHD24/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 the wide one (14 x 30 x 15 inches) is the perfect height to set drain hose in tub and the width and depth fits the machine with room to spare. You could also just put this directly into your tub and negate the extra cost of a stand or, as a gentleman here stated, you can lay a plank across the tub and set the washer on top, also cheap alt to buying a stand. All in all I spent about $20 extra to make this product perfect for me, but I could have certainly gotten away with buying only a a 1/2" garden hose adapter and clamp for $2-3 dollars at home depot. Oh, also the electric cord was too short for me as well, I had 6' surge protector so I just used that which is probably a better idea anyway, safer plus I can cut off the electricity to it with the switch.

Really though, this guy is great, you should see the filth going down my drain, lol, really works hard, but gentle on clothes, love love love it! It's not very loud at all, mostly humming and some clicks when the washer changes directions, the spinner is louder (not insanely loud or even regular washer loud) but you only use it for <5min so no biggie. Spinner is fantastic, it really does get the vast majority of the water out, I was very surprised, happily surprised. I live in a small loft apt and I am so happy to not have to lug to the laundromat and I can wash my clothes as I need to. Seriously best buy.

title: Get another brand
text: Came broken ,the spin cycle wouldn't work at all

title: wow
text: I bought this thinking well it will get me by during the week for small loads.  Yes it takes small loads, washes in 15 minutes.  I could not believe how much dirt came out of the clothing.  The spin side was quiet and the clothes were almost dry.  Light enough for me to move as needed.  I do wish the cord was a little longer but a surge protector finished the distance.  I can do 90 percent of my laundry with this little machine and be happy with it.  It would not do large thick blankets.  I will save so much money by not having to use the laundry facility at the apartment building.  I love it.  The product showed up 5 days early.  The instructions are hard to read so go to you tube if you want instructions.

title: Is it really worth it?
text:
Received this today after some scheduling mix up. The team told me that the quality of their products was important. The box was impeccable, not a dent on it. The product itself? Damaged. It looks like someone tried to put their foot through it. I can’t just unscrew it and fix it because the pieces are chipped and will no longer screw in. I must say after being assured of the quality of the product I’m extremely disappointed.

Update 1: Company has not apologized or attempted to send a replacement/replacement parts. I urge you all to pick another option. They do not care about their customers or the quality of their product.

title: Perfect unit. Buy it.
text: [[VIDEOID:5c39b32389437e41eb8fad725351427b]] Awesome!! I was able to build it into my camper in such a way that it’s perfect. The size is great, it cleans perfectly, spin is awesome. Couldn’t recommend anything better honestly.

title: Patience requires but worth it
text: I will be removing my earlier 1 star review because now that I’ve given it another chance this machine isn’t that bad. 2 pieces of advice: look for videos and advice from other owners and spare yourself the frustration of trying to decode the user manual and make gravity work for you and the tubs will drain much better. I empty into buckets and keep the hose as low as possible. I also fill it from the hose on my kitchen faucet and don’t bother with the ones provided. So don’t give up on this machine!

title: Happy then Disappointed
text: Spinner broke after three months.

title: This product healed my anxiety!!!!!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:ce99266a7394ba6beb0a8018770ed209]] Ok so boom--I'm currently a full-time graduate student & full-time employee, add to that family + some kinda social life and you've got a busy human. The mere idea of dragging my laundry down a couple flight of stairs, into my car, out of my car, into a laundromat AND BACK causes me a tremendous amount of anxiety. So... I dont do it.. for like 4-6 weeks at a time. Its gotten so bad that my mother drives 30 miles... one way... to do it for me. That makes me feel terrible. BUT I HATE THE LAUNDROMAT!!! Whyyyyyyyy is it even spelled like that? And who are these people Im sharing... hunger games fighting for... washer and dryers with? Also- three American dollars to wash and $1.50 to dry feels like robbery. I. Hate. It. A....lot.

Anyway, I was telling my friend about this hatred when she casually pulled up a link to a portable W/D unit for only $100?!?!?!?!?!?! Ordered.

Its here, ya'll. A few days earlier than the ETA!!! (I was, of course, pleasantly surprised, but upon inspection of the unit I wonder if it was a return? There are nicks and whatnot. Hoping for longevity since there wasn't an insurance/warranty option) I'm midway thru my very first cycle. I pulled together a pile of my favorite items for the occasion.... and it's working.. and it's cute... and my downstairs/upstairs neighbors say they can't hear anything... and all of the videos I watched helped me to hack it right away. I AM SO RELIEVED!!! I don't have to go back to that damn "laundrOmat" anymore. And I don't have to keep buying panties to get me thru the weeks of avoidance. Ugh!!!

BUY IIIIIIT!!!! TREAT YO SELF!!!!!!

title: Small but Mighty Washer

title: Little washer that could
text: I realized quickly that laundromats were the worst. After hunting a bit I choose this one. I have a bad back so I was a bit worried it would be hard to maneuver, happily that’s not a problem. The next trick was getting the adapter for my shower head. Locally didn’t have one so I got a $2 to tide me over. Remember to make sure the drain switch is closed/off before you start filling the washer. Then remember to let the drain hose down when using. (I was excited to see the machine in action). I love it 10 out of 10 recommend.

The clothes need to be evenly loaded or the machine will shake and move around, just stop it and rearrange the clothes around if that happens. Very happy with it after nine months of using it weekly,

title: Works for NYC living
text: Bought this in early 2017 since I live in NYC and a lot of apartments can't have W/D. This was my only option to saving time and money at the laundry mat. If used properly (small loads), it works well. Instructions are in poor English. I recommend you look up youtube videos on how people use it. I place it in my tub, use my shower head to fill up the water instead of using the tube and then just let it run.

title: Wow!!! Best purchase ever!!!!
text:
Life got in the way so it took me awhile to use it. I found a problem & the company was very helpful! My unit was replaced.

Once again, life got in the way & took me awhile to try the replacement. I use it tonight for the 1st time.

I found it very convenient, easy to use & AMAZED how well the “dryer” worked.

My husband is a big guy & his clothes is heavy. Even his clothes came out almost dry. I dried 2 shirts at a time & 1 pair of jeans at a time. I’m only going wash 1 of his jeans at a t. I think it was a little much for his jeans.

I have 3 suggestions.
Get a bathmat wherever you use the unit. One YouTube creator said his last use scuffed up his tub. I personally don’t want risk it. I bought one.

I have drain “protector” that helps keep long hair going down the drain when shower. This came in handy bc last night at one point I noticed the water was draining slowly. It turns out that drain protector was covered in lint. I cleaned it off & the water drains fast. The lint catcher catalog of lint. That’s why it’s there. It doesn’t catch everything. So it’s worth getting something going over your drain so your doesn’t get clogged.

Run the “dryer” 2xs. NOT because the “dryer” doesn’t work. It will help the drying. IMO. A habit I got into when I had a top loader. This is not necessarily just my preference. Especially with heavy items.

title: Miserable experience
text: The bottom was cracked when received, water leaked all over my floor and it doesn’t even work. This was the worst experience I have ever had with a washing machine. :/ it was supposed to be my Christmas present from my husband too.

title: not terribly, but enough that I seldom use it
text:
I bought this for my small apartment and didn't expect much,however i have been pleasantly surprised at how well this machine has performed. It works well and does get my clothes clean. The washing on low and medium water levels is not a problem and it holds quite a few lighter items. The only cons i have are that 1. it leaks when using high water level,not terribly,but enough that I seldom use it. and 2. the hose is useless for any standard American household faucet. I use mine on my counter and I use the spray attachment on my sink to fill it and empty it into the sink which works well for me but if you don't know how to gerry rig it like other buyers have suggested or can not, I can see this being a problem for you. Over all I am very happy with this purchase and would buy again.

Edit 6/8/2020 I should have edited this last year but honestly I was so upset with the seller I didn't even want to mess with it anymore. While it worked well for about a year as far as I can recall,it stopped spin drying suddenly. I tried contacting the seller but never got a reply and numerous searches on YouTube didn't help me figure out the problem. To be fair it did work well and can still be used to wash but my hand strength isn't enough to wring out clothes by hand anymore. My main complaint here is that the seller never bothered to respond to me. Wasn't asking for a refund as I knew it was too long after the purchase all I wanted was help figuring out the problem. Okay product terrible (there is none) customer service. If you have problems with it you may never hear from them. Buy at your own risk.

title: You get to set your cycle time

I really like being able to use a shorter cycle time for shirts, kitchen towels and longer wash times for socks and items that are really dirty. You can also put the washing machine outside on a pallet and use the outside shower to fill the machine and let the gray water from the hose just go onto the grass. I'm on acreage so that works for me. I've used this machine for 2 months and love it. The spinner gets the items really dry for hanging on a clothesline.

title: Great little washer
text:
For not having washer\dryer hookups in my house, this little washer is a life saver! It's relatively light and easy to handle if you need to move to a drain and\or water hookups. It is easily mod-able meaning you would likely not have any issues adding a "permanent" fixture for water in (if you had a utility sink or something of the like).

If you have animals that shed hair, it can be tricky getting all the animal hair to "wash off" of your clothes, typically a dryer works great as it collects all of the hair and lint from your clothes as it dries.

I typically run several wash cycles to ensure there is not a bunch of soap still in my clothes but does the trick for what I need. Have had this unit for nearly two years now with regular usage and it's going strong still! Well worth the price for this little washer.

title: I am thrilled with this machine!
text:
I don't think I've ever written an Amazon review, but after reading (and profiting from) others' reviews of this machine, I wanted to add my tips.

I have lived in my apartment for almost a year, and I was having trouble carrying loads of laundry up two flights of stairs and to the laundry mat. I felt it was a significant waste of time and money, too. So I happened to learn that these little compact washers were on Amazon, and I decided to give this machine a try, after reading everyone's comments/reviews.

When I received the machine, I was happy to see how small and compact it was. I had measured the shower in my second bathroom and ascertained that it would fit. I also ordered a sturdy dunnage rack, so it could drain properly and an extension cord.

I tried installing the hose via the turkey baster method, but found ineffective and not so elegant. I friend of mine (who happens to be a plumber) called while I was installing the turkey baster and he burst out laughing. He said he'd be over in five minutes, and he took me to Home Depot where he found three small connectors (the white thing that fit my shower pipe, a connector, and a metal clamp for good measure). Cost for all three items was around $4. After he helped me install the connectors, it was perfect!

Finally, I ordered a few drying racks -- a smaller one for regular laundry and another one for sheets. I have also washed my bathroom mats in this machine with no problem. Seriously, all of these things were a small investment (maybe $300 total), but the time and effort it saves me is worth it! I do one or two loads of laundry a week, dry things on the racks, and voila! No stress, no danger of falling down the stairs with heavy loads of laundry, and no accumulation of laundry over two or three weeks. I love this machine!

Here are the other things I ordered on Amazon to make the laundry process effortless:

Dunnage Rack
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00962TWS4/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00__o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

10’ Extension Cord:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B075BMVZ2M/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01__o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Stainless Steel Laundry Drying Rack:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01LWUNVDI/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o04__o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Stainless Steel Laundry Drying Rack:
https://www.amazon.com/Cresnel-Stainless-Steel-Clothes-Drying/dp/B00KQU1C60/ref=sr_1_8?ie=UTF8&qid=1548524256&sr=8-8&keywords=folding+laundry+drying+rack

I hope this helps anyone interested in purchasing this machine. I really appreciated reading everyone's reviews with their good ideas and watching the videos. Thanks!

title: Great for Apartments
text: My husband and I ordered this just before the pandemic for our fourth floor walk up since we were sick of going to the laundromat. It saved us from having to go for a few months. This is great for washing all your clothes in small batches. The washer works incredibly well and the spin dryer, while TINY, does a great job. You will still have to hang your clothes after, but most will dry within an hour or so. The only real negative to this machine is the lack of lint trap. You will likely have to lint brush your clothes after one wash, but for what it is. It is great.

title: Loved it.
text: Awesome, great purchase for living in an apartment with no washer hook up.

title: Solution for apartments and condos without washer-dryer connections.
text: I like that this is light-weight so I can easily move it. Easy to use and operate. Doesn't require washer-dryer connections. Just requires an electric AC plug, water source, and water drainage.

title: Love it.
text:
Love this little washer and spin cycle dryer. It holds a lot more than you think it will. Gets close really clean and the spin cycle does a great job of getting all the water out. You only need to hang clothes for a short time after they are finished. The instructions are really bad. It appears they were written in Chinese and then translated word for word rather than for meaning and context so as an American English as a first language reader they are a bit of a mystery.

One thing I found really helpful was to make sure when placing items in the spin dry to make sure there was a definite center. I put my arm in the dryer and wrap the clothes around it creating a natural center. Then, of course, I take my arm out and close the lid. This helps it spin easier.

title: Five Stars
text: Good product, good price, fast delivery, will recommend to others

title: Pipe is cheap and needs a dolly to move easily, but works well otherwise
text:
I had to replace the pipe within a week, it's made of flimsy plastic. So add an extra $20 to get a nice flexible pipe and some strong waterproof sealant. You'll have to disconnect the entire unit to add this upgrade. A real pain.

Also had to add an elevated dolly to the unit so it would actually move with ease. Going back and forth between the washer and the sink with buckets of water was tedious, annoying and back breaking. The only way this unit is worth it, is if you literally have a space to keep it stationary, connected to a water supply, and even then the hose is going to break within a few months at best.

All that said, it cleans well, I've done about 100 loads in it, still going strong. Don't overload it or it won't work at all. This unit saved me a ton of money instead of wasting it all at the laundromat.

title: Love this little washer
text:
For small to medium loads this washer is great. You can literally see the dark water drain after wash showing the dirt it has removed. It is easy to use and very compact. Please not the spin dryer is half the size of the washer so not many things will fit but it still drys things to a damp and then you can hang dry. Now I'm addicted to washing every other day!!!

Please note a large comforter will not fit in this washer so those type of things you will still have to go to laundry to wash those.

title: Larger and more vigorous than I expected.
text:
This is a great machine. My two complaints are:
1) It is a bit too vigorous in the agitation of the clothes for my thoughts. It really does spin those clothes around. My feeling is that the clothes might wear out earlier or fade more because of the vigorous action. Even the 'gentle' cycle is more that I have seen in other machines.
2) It is a bit larger than I expected. It is a bit difficult to life it into the bathtub - not the weight, but it is hard for me to lift it high enough to get over the edge of the tub. Might be a problem for shorter or weaker people.
Otherwise, it is a great machine.

title: I am so glad I took a chance on this machine!
text: I never thought that portable washers would do a great job. But this machine proved me wrong. It's light, easy to operate, and gets clothes as clean as a full size washer (not to mention it's so cute). There are more steps to using it, but for the minimal effort it's worth not having to lug clothes to the laundromat.

title: Saving money, time, and gaining convenience.
text:
I like many others got this washer/spinner because I was tired of paying about $10/week to do my laundry at the laundromat. I figured if this thing worked for 3 months it would effectively have paid for itself.

Now I was mad sceptical. Something in my brain said it would be cheap Chinese garbage. Even a visit to Giantex's US website prominently displayed about zero understanding of the English language. Not to say that nothing quality comes from the place, I've just been burned by Chinese products before.

Took the risk. After all, most of the reviews are positively glowing. The machine is light enough, but sturdy enough too. We do laundry maybe 2-3 times a week with this machine in our apartments tub. It works exactly as it should, and definitely opened my eyes to just how much dirt gets on/in our clothes on the regular. It really is called grey water for a reason.

I'm very pleased with this purchase. Instead of bumming around the laundromat for a few very long hours every week, we can just do it at home and do something productive while the machine goes through it's cycle. We've had the machine now for over a month and I expect it to keep going for quite some time.

Ultimately we're saving time and money thanks to this machine. The convenience factor of not having to throw everything into a bag and haul it out to the car to bring it to the laundromat is pretty great, too.

I only have one minor gripe with the machine. The lint catcher I think sincerely tries to do it's job, it's just not that good. Our shower's drain clogs very easily because of what I imagine it's narrow PVC piping, so after our first go with the machine the drain got clogged with lint. Went out and bought some liquid plumr and a fine mesh shower drain catcher. Now we just make sure the drain catcher is in before draining the machine. Even with the built in lint catcher, the drain catcher gets full of lint every single time. So we have to clean that out between cycles. Minor gripe, only about a 98 cent fix. Not nearly enough for me to dock this product a star.

Just wish I got this thing sooner!

title: Great portable washer and spinner

title: Five Stars
text: Love it

title: Pays for itself
text:
I have done about two weeks worth of laundry with this unit and I am extremely impressed. We don't have room to use anywhere else but our bathtub, that being said with a little ingenuity this could certainly be lifted (possibly on bed risers) in order to drain into a bucket or out of a window.

It holds so much more laundry than I expected and washes/spins fast. The drying rack in the picture is one full wash load, two spin loads (no shaking). This took no more than ten minutes "setup" included (moving to bathroom, plugin, and attach to faucet). The clothes were dry within two to three hours.

Following a previous buyers suggestion I modified a turkey baster to attach to presumably any size faucet and it works great (although I am sure you can buy something more suitable at a local home improvement store).

It is very portable. I am eight months pregnant and could probably lift into the tub if I had to but for the sake of safety I certainly haven't tried.

I am thrilled to not have to hand wash or spend $30+ at the laundry mat each month. This will pay for itself within the next couple of months.

title: Worth it
text: Washer breaks within under a year, it was amazing up until that point. But contacted sellers and they were so amazing 💕.

title: It is a workhorse and I am glad I got it
text: I abuse this little machine and it takes it!  I put it in my shower stall and fill it from the handheld shower head.  I am able to wash a few pairs of jeans, socks and t-shirts, or I wash two bath and hand towels and a queen sized sheet.  The centrifuge is a powerhouse and really helps take wet clothes to slightly damp.  One caveat, I am not sure if it leaks or I am just a mess, but keeping it in the shower helps avoid water and spillage, plus when the load is done and you need to drain the water, I drain it right down the shower grill. It is a workhorse and I am glad I got it.  If you don't keep it in the shower, consider getting a plastic or rubber boot tray to keep it in to catch any stray water...

title: Scam
text: It’s a scam. I got a mouse pad delivered today instead of an actual portable washer/dryer. I need my money back.

title: I had to recently move into an apartment and lost easy access to a washer and dryer
text: This thing changed my life! I feel liberated! I had to recently move into an apartment and lost easy access to a washer and dryer. I have been going to the laundry mat, but with a toddler who is potty training this was just no longer feasible. This portable washing machine is perfect for me and my young child. I can't see this taking the place of a washer and dryer for a 4 person household, but this works for us. The drying cycle is surprisingly effective. However, like other reviews had stated the water hose line does not work with my faucets. So I installed a shower arm diverted switch on my shower head. Then used a hose for a hand shower to fill the washer. This was an easy and inexpensive solution.

title: A lot better than I thought.
text:
Honestly, I have been hand washing my clothes like 5 months because my washer broke and hand washing actually seemed to get things cleaner. I found this and decided to try. Wow. Like, really good. The hose is garbage and doesnt have a way to hook on to a water source, but just use buckets of water. =) its pretty amazing. Oh, you also need to run through a second wash cycle without soap if you want to rinse. It takes less time to do laundry than my old machine, does about the same amount of laundry, spins dry way better than any washer ive had which reduces the drying time by half, and cleans clothes about as well as habd washing.

Its small with a deep washing bucket. Kinda looks like a child's toy. Haha.

Anyways, I will use it until it stops working. If it lasts for atleast one or two years, I will keep buying this unit. Very happy with it.

Thanks, dudes!

title: Just used it today, worked well, had to rinse twice but did a great job
text: Good so far

title: Five Stars
