title: USED
text: I was so excited when I ordered this product, all my wishes had come true. I was really looking forward to receiving this product and Ben thought the delivery date said it was about 2 weeks after purchasing. A little long but overall understandable. I was surprised when this product arrived only about 5 days after ordering it, I was really excited. However after opening the product that all changed. I noticed there was water inside of the washer, a little odd but I tried to pass it off as one of those things that just happens. Upon further inspection, I saw a lot of dirt marks. I tried to pass that off as warehouse scuffs/dirt. I came to the realization this is a used product I received. The tube at the bottom has nasty yellow gunk in it, the legs have dirt stick to the bottom of each one, dirt marks inside of the washer and spinner, the little filter in the washer is dirt and it has a crack at the bottom of the machine. Clearly someone returned this item and the seller deceived to send their used product to me a little earlier than I expected. Watch out! I am hoping to get a NEW replace washer.

I email and I'm told all products have a 30 day warranty there sorry. A waste of 120$ is a lot for a mom on a fixed income. I'm exhausted! I had my brother in law take it apart as he repairs this type of stuff and the belt is fine connected to the washer. The whole bottom is black and looks like something melted onto it.
I can't get any answers from this company, and I'm at a total loss. I hope others do not run into this issues. I can't afford a new one nor the Matt which is why I had ordered it in the first place to save money at home. My brother in law told me to contact a lawyer about liability because the burnt smell and etc, however I just want this company to have enough respect to do the right thing. But, I feel like it was a sale and there done, I looked up reviews on the BBB and the Reviews have a lot of the same issues regarding no help with issues. I'm glad so many people seem to have good rating. I truly feel my was a manufacturer issue. I pray no one else has this scare!

title: Giantex mini washer/Dryer
text:
The only reason I gave it 4 stars as I paid for a new unit this one looks used, and dirty inside, after I cleaned it and used it, holly cow this is one on the best things IV ever bought. I just hope in a year I can still say the same thing, for now Amazing! Like a little tornado , the water was so brown it was some what embarrassing, but amazed at the same time......FOR THE PEOPLE CRYING IT ONLY DOES SMALL LOADS. Try to read what you are buying, and you won't complane about the size! This is there statement.

Saving so much time that you don't have to go to a laundry mat or wash things by hand in the tub. Washing tube: place clothing in the wash tub section, rated washing capacity: 11 lbs.
Spin tube: run the rinse cycle for the desired minutes, rated spinner dryer capacity: 6.6 lbs (half of the washing capacity, you may spin twice).
Then you could take clothing out of the extractor and hang them up to complete drying.
Space Saving
Ideal for small loads and delicate. Light weight and easily moveable. Also the wash motor is powerful. 300w washing power & 110w spinner power will help you powerful use the item. This is a gravity drain which also requires it to be elevated off the ground.

title: great appliance but horrible attachments

title: Strong little machine! Edit: One year later
text:
Edit 2: I tried to get a replacement part but no one responded to my calls or emails. Luckily I bought a warranty but I just got a gift certificate. I won’t be buying another one. The laundromat costs the same as the large water bill I got by using this machine.

Edit: The machine still works, but the spinner has provided many problems. Sometimes it’d take forever to get to a high speed. My fiancé would have to take off the back and tighten a loose bolt. Recently the rim of the spin became horribly torn up. I had to take it off. It still spins but it can’t be filled fully or else the clothes fly out. I posted a pic of the spinner without the cover

This is a pretty good machine! I had a towel stained with old tomato sauce and it got rid of majority of them without stain remover. I give it 4 stars because it took some rigging to do. Like everyone else, the water hose didn't fit my faucet. I wanted to keep the drain hose by my tub so I got a funnel to put in the water hose so I could hold it up to my shower. The power cord isn't that long either (maybe 4ft). The instruction manual was missing the installation page and was worded weirdly. I had to look it up online. Otherwise I have no issues! The rest of this review is just FYI stuff.

One thing I didn't know about this before I bought it was that you need to switch the clothes from the washing tub to the spin tub and back. A wash will take about 10min then you need to put it to spin for 2min, put it back in the wash tub to rinse after changing the water, put it back to spin, and so forth. It's not hard work but you can't just put the laundry in and go watch TV. (EDIT: I found a tip online that said to rinse right after the wash so you only have to spin once)

I bought this thinking the spin tub was a dryer for some reason, but that's my fault. It actually dries really well though. I was in doubt about how something so small can dry so fast but it does. It can't fit many towels but when it comes to shirts there's plenty room. The spinner is smaller than the wash tub. It can only hold the same amount as a low load

title: It’s great having to share a laundry with other apartment complex
text: Only thing I dislike is that the clothes don’t dry all the way it feels dry but it’s a little dampy like but here’s a hack : tired of turning the dryer nob back to 5 mins ? Put a piece of duck tape on the nob to keep it in place while it dries it really helps dry the clothes a little more and longer doesn’t mess up the nob at all ! Just pull the door up to see how dry the clothes are and gently remove the tape ! Highly recommend getting a drying rack to dry the clothes though I bought one off Amazon for $20 easy fold up and set up and  to put away!The hose could be longer and you have to position it just to get all the water out either with a bucket or putting it in the tub but everything else to stain removing is amazingly great for a one bedroom apartment and having to share a laundry room with other apartment complexes this is for one for you!!

title: Amazing Tiny (but not so tiny) Washing Machine!
text: This washing machine far exceeded our expectations.  When I described to my boyfriend what I had purchased he immediately envisioned me with a plunger and a five gallon bucket washing clothes in the bathroom.  This thing is amazing. The motor REALLY agitates! I love the power of it.  And it holds A LOT of clothes!  When I was describing it to people and telling them what I could wash in one load it all was about what they would wash in a small load of clothes in their regular washers!  The spin dryer is also amazing.  While it doesn't dry (and doesn't claim to dry) it really wrings the clothes out a lot.  We hang dry our clothes on a line with a fan in the room and they are dry in an hour or two after the spin dry cycle!  The water input as other reviews have stated does not work well as it doesn't fit our faucet, but I went out and purchased a hand held showerhead with a long hose and use that to fill the tub.  I love this washing machine.

title: Mucho Amazeballs
text: This little baby is awesome! If you are ok with washing only a handful of outfits at a time, then this is the machine for you! I was shocked to see how much power this thing had...bc it is UNREAL. As I plugged it in, I didn't know what to expect...and then BOOM, this little birdie took flight!!! Spinning and thrashing around all strong and crazy...and it IS crazy bc it's so cute and little and made of plastic but impressive AF.  You may want to get a clothes line or hangers bc the spinner side takes washed clothes from sopping wet to a tiny bit damp. idk tho...that could be nice on a hot summer day, you know? The spinner is so fast and so furious and even tho the clothes are slightly damp after drying...it only spins around (no heat) for 5 minutes and for it to be thaaat dry is weird. It makes me question why regular dryers take 70 or 90 min...I think something is up with that.  I like this bc I think it is neat.

title: Really great option for apartments with no washer/dryer
text: This machine honestly has changed my quality of life. As a long-term resident of NYC where buildings with washer/dryers are too expensive for me to afford, it has become an amazing option. I don't have to have my laundry picked up/don't have to sit at the laundromat for hours!! What a gift. That said, you should know a few things about this machine because it does have its quirks: 1) It's best to set it up where you can drain it into a tub. I move it in and out of the tub every time I use it, simply because it's easier to add the water with my showerhead, and because it's not as messy to drain it (vs. using a bucket). 2) Best to elevate it for draining. I use bed lifts. 3) Laundry loads should be small i.e. one pair of jeans, two to three tshirts, one sweater, underwear and socks

I use the washer every day and with the spin cycle the clothing comes out almost all dry so it does not take long to hang dry at all I can get about 6 Loads in a day and have everything dry by the next morning on a drying rack (switching life’s out as dried)

I’m so happy I got this washer and I recommend it to anyone who needs a washer in there apartment or smaller spaces.

title: Giantex waste of money
text: So my wife had me buy this compact twin washer/spin dryer so she could wash clothes here at home. The stupid thing doesn't fit our hook ups nor will it even attach to the sink. The drain is gravity only, so it's a ton of effort if you even want to use the crap machine because you have to haul it, while full of water, away from the kitchen or bathroom outside to drain, and you have to do that every single time you put a new load in, and being a compact, it doesn't hold very large loads, so to do what would normally be a full load of laundry, you would have to go back and forth at least three times. I emailed the company asking if I could send the thing back because we don't have any way to hook up the water to it. They say I can, but because it isn't a quality issue, I'd have to pay the shipping, which costs 50% more than I paid for the darn thing, so sending the thing back wasn't an option. On top of that, my wife is determined to keep the stupid thing and insists it's worth it to try to use it and will not let me even think about getting on LSN or Craigslist to just get a full size washer and dryer. So, I guess I'm stuck with this useless piece of garbage that I can't return and I can't replace because my wife is too in love with it to see that it isn't worth the hassle all because it was cheap, but I can't throw it away or give it away because then I would be throwing away money. I'm so frustrated with this piece of crap that I just want to beat the thing to hell with a sledgehammer, pour gasoline on it and set it on fire, then take the remains and toss them off a cliff into the ocean. I will not ever recommend anyone ever buy one of these things.

title: Game changer for a small apartment in quarantine
text:
My husband and I bought this washer for our apartment to avoid having to go to our building's shared laundry space during corona quarantine. LOVE IT. It agitates the clothes surprisingly well and spins them mostly dry. We were really pleased by the results. How we use it:

1) We fill it via bucket, as some others on here do. The water intake hose it comes with is garbage and we didn't want to go to the hardware store to rig up something new. Bucket method works fine! We fill the left washer bin about 2/3 at MOST then add 1/4 cup of soap (or less) and then clothes. Do NOT overfill this machine! Aim to have clothes and water level off around the middle of the filter piece at max.

2) Since the directions it comes with are useless...One washing cycle looks like this for us: 15 mins in left tub at normal agitation with the soap; then remove in batches into right tub to spin out for maybe 1-2 mins (as needed, right tub is smaller than left); Spun clothes go back into the left side and are rinsed/agitated with water again for 15 mins; Spin out again for 2-3 min. Hang up clothes to dry.

3) It is lightweight enough that we store it away when we don't need it and lift it into our standard bathroom tub for use. The drain tube works well this way and it makes filling it easier. Each of us can lift it into the tub pretty easily.

Even though we love this washer and are very happy with the purchase, here are a few caveats we noticed that you may want to consider before buying.

A) Other reviewers have said it and it's true...this is NOT a hands off washing process like a regular washer. You do need to go back and forth to the machine to fill/spin during the cycle. BUT that said, going from your couch to bathroom to fill a bucket is an improvement over running to the basement to switch out laundry loads.

B) The capacity is about half of a regular load of laundry. So this means that for every "regular machine" load of laundry...this machine will require two full cycles. In order to not over-stress the machine's motor, we usually limit our full cycles to 3 in a day. And then do laundry a couple times a week. (Again we're in quarantine, so this is big entertainment!) We have successfully washed our queen sheet sets over two loads...came out great. We wash our waffle weave towels (another life game changer for a different review), sweats, hoodies, PJs, undies, and other items with no problems. I cannot speak to how this machine would handle traditional terry cloth towels or jeans. I'd say do just a couple at a time, as those items would be heavy when wet.

C) Because you will line dry all of your items after washing and spinning, items will of course be a little "crunchy" instead of having that nice commercial dryer fluffiness. Is this an adjustment for regular laundry? Yes. However, if you use this machine for sheets, polyester-based clothes, or blended fabrics like sweats or exercise gear, the items honestly come out pretty normal. It's the 100% cotton items like dish towels or some underwear that get crunchy. If it bugs you a lot, I have found that steam ironing specific items will make them feel softer and obviously get rid of those washer wrinkles.

Overall I am very happy with this machine, esp. for the price. It has saved us a lot of anxiety and added convenience.

title: Powerful motor but the dryer broken after 7 months
text:
I have read many reviews and compared with other portable washing machines. Many reviews especially videos did help me to find the right washing machine. Finally I decided to order this one. It delivered to my place next day! I was worried about connecting with the faucet. I read many reviews about using a bucket to fill in water. I did and it works perfectly. I don't need to run to a hardware store to purchase the connectors. I didn't even read the instructions. After I unpacked it, I set up in the bathroom and place the hose on the floor near shower drain. Then i used a bucket to pour water and detergent (don't pour too much) in the machine. And I'm ready to go! I am so grateful to own this washing machine. The motor of washing is quite powerful. The drying is good too even it didn't dry the clothes completely. It did save me lots of time and money. I can wash my clothes any time without worrying contacting with others. I just wish the company can improve the capacity so I can wash more clothes at once but I still love this washing machine. No complaints. I think the next thing I'm going to purchase is a drying machine :). One advice for washing:. Do not put too much clothes at one time. If you see the washing motor is slowing down that means you probably put too much clothes. I tried to be careful not to put too many clothes and break the machine. The machine needs cares too!!

title: Excellent Portable and Spin dryer. Looove it!
text:
I loooooove this machine!
I couldn’t wait to try it out. And it works very well! Excellent washer and spin dryer!
I love to do laundry but hated going to laundry mat. I have a LG combo machine but ever since we move to this house on the 2nd floor we are not allowed to use our wonderful LG machine. So we have been sending our clothes to be washed because I have no time to go to the laundry mat for hours. So I’m very happy to have found this gem by Costway - washer and spin dryer.
The washer holds a lot of clothes. I have two boys and a 6 feet 2 inches husband and I can wash their clothes in this machine. No wringing required after washing you can transfer to the spin side and begin to wrince and spin dry. I’m so excited about that part of the machine. No more hand washing and having to wring out pieces. All done in this wonderful machine! If I could tak a picture of me kissing this machine I would but that TMI lol.
The only reasons I didn’t give it 5 stars is the hose. The hose is way too shore and fragile. I used the set up of one of the other reviews. On two chairs (until I can a stand with wheels) in my bathroom and attached the hose to my shower and the drain hose in the bathtub. You can not turn on the water and leave this machine it does not shut off your pipe automatically. Remember to keep middle knob on normal or soft. Not drain or the water your using to wash will drain out. So you must keep an eye on it. Which is still better than going to the laundromat. There is no Assembly needed. Just connect the hose to water, have some where to drain water out and plug in and let the magic begin. You will start to love doing laundry again. I would give it 4 1/2 stars but I only can give 4 or 5 stars. Anyway well worth the price and highly recommended. Don’t wait to get one. You won’t regret it. Looove it!

title: Get Something Else
text:
This is the first time writing an Amazon review but I feel like I have to.

I researched FOREVER to find a good washer/dryer for a decent price. I read the reviews and saw the worst of the worst, and also the best. I finally came around and bought this one.

For the first few days this thing was god-sent. Washed and dried beautifully, and the dryer got the clothes SUPER dry, like, unbelievably dry.

However, its only been a few days. I thought I heard strange noise coming from the washer as it ran, thinking it was jean buttons racing against the inside and ignored it until it happened the following day with a few shirts and socks. I knew there were reviews about sparking, but I thought that was a one in a million chance and cant possibly happen with my machine.

I was wrong.

Inside the washer right under the dials there were blue sparks that lit up when the agitator stopped. After seeing the sparks, the strange noise sounded like electric currents, so I turned off the machine instantly and unplugged it.

I contacted the seller and they are giving me a full refund and have advised me to STOP USING THE MACHINE IF IT SPARKS. They said i can either toss it or find a repair man to fix it, so I tried finding someone to check it out to see if it can be salvaged or fixed.

Nope. Not a single person in NYC services these lil washers. And if they did, they told me the parts and repair would cost more than what it’s worth. No idea why it sparked but water and open NOISY electric currents do not mix.

I kept it unplugged and figured I should just dry the clothes in there regardless (might as well since that still works). I was wrong again.

The entire time both worked beautifully but in a matter of DAYS the dryer stops spinning and the washer is trying to kill me.

At least they're giving me a full refund. Now I just have to figure out how I’m dumping this and finding a different company washer/dryer.

Also for those whose machines are sparking and keep using it, DONT. If the company itself is refunding me without hesitation, you probably shouldn’t keep using it.

Totally sucks because this thing was awesome :/

text: My wife and I don't have a washer in unit at our new apartment and figured the cost of this upfront beats the laundromat, money saving and knowing that the machine is clean. When we unboxed it today though we found many dents, scratches, and dirt on the machine that would imply normal use wear and tear. There are scratches around the knobs, a big dent in the front, the feet were all dirty straight out of the box, and the outlet hose had a weird stain. That being said this is an amazing little washer. It agitates arguably better than some full size household washers. The spin dryer is great too it gets the clothes about 99% dry. I can wash a load in about 20 minutes as well so that is also a big plus. If you buy this I would recommend watching a how to video  on YouTube because the instruction booklet was no help at all. I recommend this washer dryer just be careful and check yours out of the box too. I have contacted the seller and have had no response yet.

title: GREAT FOR AN APARTMENT
text:
Alright - I recently rented an apartment and bought this one because it was the cheapest... There are some pros, and cons I've now discovered.

1. Like everyone says, the "line" to hook it up to a faucet is garbage, just get a bucket and heed the water marks with the amount of clothes you have in in mind.
2. The gravity drain is truly done by gravity. I have an electrical issue in my bathroom I learned about the hard way and had to do this in my kitchen. I prop the system up on an empty storage tote and it doesn't wiggle too much. This was after four attempts to get this thing to work. I WOULD DEFINITELY USE IT IN MY BATHTUB IF I COULD. If the drain hose is not lower than the machine it can back up and leak... which is problematic if you have it just on a floor that isn't your bathroom. Even when I get my electrical issue fixed I'll be propping it up for more efficient drainage in my tub. Even when I had it propped up on a flemsy storage tote it really didn't rock, fall, etc. It's fairly sturdy.
3. It will drain out just as much water as you put in, so be prepared if you're draining it in to a bucket or something. It can get heavy.
4. Make sure you don't have it on drain..... water just runs out every where and it's a mess..................
5. It REALLY does work!!!! I had some stuff that had had stains on it forever that I thought were just going to be there for good. NOPE!! Guess teh smaller loads took care of that!

I would give it 5 stars, but the cord being so short and the elevation necessary is a little annoying. I think once I get it in my bath tub I'll be in love because I'll be able to walk away and let it do its thing. Also, you clearly have to move it to a space, so casters would be AMAZING. It's kind of heavy to lift while there's water in it.

title: Works for me for all the right reasons
text:
This was not the first machine that I had tried, but the best choice for my needs after becoming more knowledgeable about the offerings available. I live on a boat so having a pump to push water to a sink or over the edge of a tub (though i found that the one on the first unit i tried worked well) was not an issue for me as the water drained down to the shower pump built into the shower pan floor. What was important was the rated power (watts) of the washer motor and that of the spin dryer because that's what ultimately churns out the work of agitating the clothes and spinning the water from the clothing that fit into the dryer. The washer is well rated and the dryer gets to the rated 1300 rpm effortlessly with very little initial wobble of the dryer basket and stabilizes quickly which let me know it was adequately powered as it never struggled under load. I washed everything - jeans, queen sheets, double sided curtains that cover the windows and sliding entry door - no problem either washing or spin drying. I tried this with a different, less powerful (watts) combined washer/dryer machine with lesser results and ithen wth a separate washer and a separate spin dryer setup, I had to stand and hold the dryer so it would not wobble and move across the counter. That all changed with this purchase. This one is powerful and smooth. Needless to say, I've returned the other items and am satisfied with my purchase. Though this one is inexpensively priced, it packs a good punch and fit and finish was fine. One final observation note, there is a raised rim that borders the washer and dryer area that helps keep the water from spilling onto the floor during clothes transfer from washer to dryer. You really don't know how important that is until you own a machine that doesn't have a means of keeping the water under control when you transfer your items to the spin dryer.

I was not paid for my opinion, but wanted to pass along an honest assessment and what went into my selection. If you need a machine with a pump they are out there, but I'd also check stats and look at the supplied pictures to help my decision process. You may decide to pay more for your features, but this was a good choice for me.

title: SO GLAD I PURCHASED THIS!  Worth the Wait.
text: Love my Giantex.  So glad I purchased it.  I'm a senior citizen (71) living in a basement unit and find it hard to continue carrying laundry bags up stairs and to the car etc.  Giantex has been a life changer.  After spinning the wash, the clothes come out so dry that it doesn't take long for them to hang dry.  I feel I've already gotten my money's worth in the few months I've had it.  I sit it in front of the shower stall, place drain tube on shower floor and use the detachable shower head to fill the tub.  When I finished all my washing, I lift the washer up or tilt it to make sure no water comes out of the hose. The mini washer is light enough for me to handle.  I purposefully leave the tops of the washer and spinner open overnight to make sure any undrained water dries.  Then I'm done.  Thank you Giantex!

title: This thing is incredible!!!
text: This thing is incredible.I kicking myself for not finding out about this thing sooner.I'm using it to wash clothes for a family of 7 ATM.This washes everything we toss at it excepts for blankets and comforters. This thing is really compact leaves clothes very clean and spin cycle wrings out a lot of water from clothes.There are three levels marked in the inside of the washer for amount of water to fill up too low med and high. But it best just to eyeball it. Just toss in your clothes and soap first then fill it with water until water covers the clothes being sure not to exceed the high marker. I can fill it  up to the high mark with things like shirts,underwear and socks and it will work no prob.Really heavy items like jeans or jackets I try not to top off the machine with.A good rule of thumb if you do not see your clothes spinning in both directions the load is too heavy and you will need to split it  to assure they get cleaned well.

title: Great washer! Works well but needs a few accessories
text:
This washing machine works really well once you get the hang of it. The washer has a decent capacity and the spinner leaves the clothes slightly damp. It cleans clothes thoroughly and the process maintains a great smell on the clothes if you use enough detergent for 1 load. Add a bit of fabric softener to help your clothes stay soft after drying. Be sure to rinse the clothes before and possibly during the spin cycle.
The instructions were in broken English and difficult to understand, so reading the reviews before using the washer was very helpful. The water intake tube does not attach securely to any faucet. I purchased a universal shower attachment for my sink that has worked wonders. It is great for filling up the washer, rinsing clothes, & cleaning the washer after.
The washer does not drain well unless it is raised quite a bit. You can go through the labor of lifting it up to get all of the water out, but I chose to purchase a sturdy shelf to place it on. The water drains out quickly and completely when the washer is placed on a shelf...and it also serves as a great place to store my laundry supplies. It is very convenient.

title: Satisfied!!
text:
I’m actually impressed with this product! It’s a LOT different than the traditional washing machine, but it suits me well. I am a minimalist living in a small house, so a small washing machine like this one is very ideal. It’s also very energy efficient. Regular household washing machines are generally more electronically controlled. But compact washers, like this one, are more manually controlled.
My greatest con was not having a good place to drain the water out of it. But I came up with a simple solution to that. For an extra 20 dollars, I built a platform out of furring strips to put on top of the bathtub. Placing the washer directly on the bottom of the bathtub was more of a problem for 3 reasons. It wasn’t quite level. The discharge hose was completely submerged during the draining process. And vibration caused the machine to slide towards the water faucets. But a simple platform took care of those issues. Plus the platform can be hung on the wall when it’s not in use.
Another downside that I was already aware of, is that small washing machines like this one are not designed for large bulky items, like a king size bed quilt or a full body carhart suit. Those type of things either need to go to a laundromat or washed at a friends house (which is what I do occasionally).
As for drying clothes, traditional dryers, for the most part, are just a luxury. Unless you’re in a hurry, air drying is all you really need. The onboard spinner does most of the work, but it’s still makes sense to hang clothes in front of a fan or out in the sun for a more thorough drying. There were days when I hung clothes on hangers with no fan or sunlight and they STILL dried thoroughly! Natural drying just takes a little time if you’re up to it.
I hope my review is helpful to others. If you have a more specific question about my product experience, ask away!

title: Investment Worthy
text:
Worth every penny and to be honest...the price isn’t that bad for the convenience of it. Saves money on electric and water. It actually cleans and the spin cycle works surprisingly well. You will have to buy a couple of things such as the attachment to hook up to the faucet (I bought a rubber piece that suctions to it...$3), and a longer tube but I didn’t need one for my set up. It’s not quiet but not loud either. If you have paper thin walls, the noise shouldn’t bother your neighbors. The drain tube, just make sure that your machine sits higher than your drain.

Steps I take to use:

Fill tub with water (I fill til I cover the lint vent inside) and add detergent
Add clothes (typically 4-5 shirts, socks and underwear) or (2-4 pants unless jeans than only 2 at a time)
Set length of wash cycle
Drain water after and refill and I set my rinse cycle for 3 minutes...I might repeat this step as well)
Drain again and put clothes in spin tub after. (The spin side is very small so you might have to split your load)
It spins very efficiently so I only spin for 1 minute.

I also bought a small portable dryer as well. My clothes dry within 20 minutes because the water has been spun out of clothes.

Overall, I will definitely recommend and I plan on buying a second one. 👍🏾

title: No drain pump, impossible to drain with ANY ease.
text: At first glimpse of this unit I was very hopeful. After seeing how bad the quality of EVERYTHING is on this thing, I was very disappointed. Both the intake water hose and the drain hose are so bad, it ridiculous. There is NO way to connect the intake water hose to any water tap. None. You will have to manually add the water either by hold the insanely crappy intake water hose up to a faucet, by shower head, bucket or a hose. I had to use my hand held shower head to fill it as the intake hose has no way to be attached to anything.  All of these are a major, major, wet challenge. The first load I did was 3 dress shirts, socks and 2 tee shirts. After 3 minutes of washing the water turned a very dark grey. The clothes I washed where not even remotely that dirty. I work in an office, not a construction site. After the wash cycle, I turned the switch to drain, only to find out that the drain is a gravity drain ONLY. So unless you have a floor drain or can drain it to the outside, your out of luck. I had to lift the unit onto my bathroom counter to get it to drain into the sink. Not an easy task with water and clothes in it. The only way, the ONLY way this thing would be a good fit is maybe for camping. The gravity only draining is absolutely ridiculous. I will be returning this boat anchor ASAP.

title: Does the job.
text: I used this in my apartment for a year and it was a life saver. That doesn’t mean I don’t have complaints though lol. The filling hose they give you is too narrow for most American faucets so I ditched that thing almost immediately. My set up ended up being in my bathtub while using my removable shower head to fill the wash tub. I’d say the noise level is medium. You can definitely hear it especially the spin tub but honestly I liked that I could hear it. That way I could know the cycle was done from another room. The spin tub obviously isn’t supposed to fully dry your clothes (you’ll need a drying rack for that) but it gets pretty darn close especially on the smallest loads. When you take the spun clothes out however, sometimes theres a lot of lint stuck to them so you might want to get a lint roller if you don’t already have one. What I disliked the most however was the lint build up because the built in filter doesn’t really do anything. If you’re emptying down a drain you will most definitely need a hair catcher because it will clog. but in the end it never stopped working until I sold it and I ran it about 8 times a week for a year. I say its worth the money 👍🏻

I was so excited because I love using this machine and for $100 dollars I got enough loads of laundry in to pay itself off so I wasn't bummed about the money spent just that I wanted to continue to use it! Finding that size fuse was a chore... After checking all stores I finally found the fuse at Frys electronics.. Don't think twice! Worth the money and time saved going to the laundry mat! Oh and be careful not to use too much soap & softner you just need a tad.. And don't under estimate this machine I find it can handle a good size load both in washer and spinner! I only have trouble with the weight of adult jeans and large sweatshirts and towels.. I still wash towels at laundry mat. Love it! Love it! Love it!

title: Small but mighty machine!
text: "You get what you pay for" Or in some cases you get more than what you pay for. I have had the machine for just a week now but so far I love it and everything about it. It does require more work than a fully automatic machine but if you live in an apt with no hookups like I do and are tired of wasting $40-50 dollars a month at the laundry machines you will gladly exchange the extra work for the hassle of spending unnecessary money and using machines other people have had their dirty clothes in. Plus no more walking all the way to the laundry room for me. I had reconstructive knee surgery a few months back and walking long distances is hard and sometimes painful. So this is how I use it. We put our clothes in the machine instead of a hamper. When it gets almost full I take the clothes out and move it into my bathtub. I use my detachable shower head to fill the machine. There are two fill lines, one about halfway up the lint filter and another near the top of the machine. Then I add detergent and switch it on for it to mix. Then add clothes and run it on soft unless I have towels. Normal will tangle your clothes! Then drain and spin them for about one minute. Then I repeat the process to rinse but spin for longer to get the water out. The lint filter is excellent, I have no idea why I keep reading it's useless. I have to empty and rinse it after almost every load. The capacity is awesome. I washed 15 adult size small and medium t-shirts at once with no problems. If you have heavy items like towels or jeans though you can only wash one or two along with your load. Otherwise the weight prevents the clothes from spinning in the wash tub properly. But you can wash a pair of jeans with plenty of light items with no problem. So there are very few cons to this machine, and solutions to all of them. I'm very happy with my purchase.

title: Got my instructions from the reviews here's my version
text:
I've been using this washer for about a month and it has worked great. Here's my method:
1. Put it in the bathtub and plug it in with an extension cord (I know that's technically not allowed but I tried carrying it there to drain after it was full which was a nightmare)
2.Set to normal or soft (accidentally had it on drain for a little while when I was adding water whoops)
3. Add liquid detergent (whatever looks good I now do enough to see bubbles in the water)
4. Add items to be washed (I started with filling only halfway but I now do up to 3/4 of the way because they compress when wet, also one or a couple at a time is a good idea.)
5. Fill with 12qt pot (my largest loads need 6 full pots worth you can also use a bucket just cover the items)
6. Turn the nob to 15 (minutes)
7. When the load is finished (no noise it just stops) unhook the large plastic tube from the side
8. Turn nob to drain
9. Place items in spinner basket in a spiral (this helps them more easily orient that way when it spins super fast and prevents it from clanking around and giving you a momentary heart attack)
10. Pour a bit of clean water in to rinse the items and set spin (right-hand nob) to 2 (minutes)
11. Pour a bit more clean water in for a final rinse and then set spin to 5 (minutes)
12. Hang everything to dry
Honestly, this method has worked great I don't feel the need to get the faucet adaptor and especially since our building only has one washer and dryer and I bought this during the pandemic it has saved us time, money, and prolonged contact with other people.

title: I love it!
text:
Came packaged perfectly,and I was able to unpack it and carry it upstairs without assistance. I "installed" it in my bathroom against the wall perpendicular to the tub, I bought a small cabinet to put it on which puts it at the perfect height to drain into the tub. The hose doesn't fit but I pull the shower head over and fill it that way.
The directions that come with it leave a bit to be desired, here is how it works best for me: set the dial to normal, fill 2/3 of the way with water and add detergent then clothes, set the timer and let it go. Then set it to drain, it drains into the tub, take clothes out and put in spinner for a minute or two to get suds out ,still while set to drain so water spins out (spin side is small so separate into 2 or 3 sessions), set back to normal and fill with clean cold water and no soap, put clothes back in and set timer again, this is like a rinse cycle, then drain and spin again and hang to dry.
It's a few steps, I know, it's hands on more than set and forget, but this machine works fantastic. It's quieter than I thought it'd be, it's balanced and doesn't jostle around. Plus it's adorable.
This may not be right for everyone, it's absolutely right for single or couple, small space, apartment dweller, someone who doesn't want to commit to large appliances in a rented space.

title: A few things to note (and suggestions)
text:
I love this washer, and it’s still going strong a year later! (Although the washer I got is definitely by Costway, so not sure why it is sold as Giantex?) You definitely won’t be wanting to wash anything heavy duty like big blankets in here, as you won’t be able to fit it into the spin dryer to wring the water out. The spin dryer WILL smell a little funky after about 3 spin drying cycles (almost fishy?), but it’s really just that it needs some time to “rest” and cool off. It is not malfunctioning, it is just the way it is. I try not to do more than 5-6 spin drying cycles in a row, although if it takes 3 to do a small load of clothes (and none of these loads should ever be big) then by the time I wash the next load, the dryer will have had some time to rest before I do another 3 cycles. I don’t usually wash more than 2 loads in a row though, so that comes out to 5-6 spin drying cycles close together. It’s a learning curve.

We put this in the shower and stand it on top of a set of bed risers to help the water drain down through the plastic tube (which is kind of gross looking inside after a year, but I don’t know if there’s anything I can realistically do about that). We have a removable shower head, so we just prop it in there to fill when we need to.

Most people have already said what needs to be said about this washer, so I’ll only add a few things.

Two small negative things I want to note are that the spin dryer plastic lid insert...thing...(you see it in the photos), a) doesn’t serve a purpose as far as I can tell, b) if not inserted at the top correctly, it makes a really loud noise clacking around in there, and c) finally got sucked into the spin dryer bin at one point and got itself chewed up in the process being spun around at such a rapid speed. But, like I said anyway, it didn’t seem to provide a real benefit, so I wasn’t too torn up about it.

The other small negative, was that at one point, we did not insert our lint catcher into its slot securely, and it got whacked around the washer during the cycle and the plastic of the catcher cracked. So it no longer fits into the slot. Now, this is entirely our fault, but I tried emailing the company asking if I could at least pay to purchase a replacement for the lint catcher. They wrote back saying that my washer was past its 6 month warranty, and the best they could do was provide $20 compensation for me to get my washer repaired locally. But who is going to repair a plastic lint catcher insert? (For the record, I did try super glue.) I wrote back explaining that I didn’t need a refund, and it was not the washer that needed to be repaired, I just needed a new lint catcher and would be happy to pay for it. Their response to that second email was, and I quote, “Thanks for your reply. Have a nice day!“ So I wasn’t really impressed with their customer service team.

My solution ended up being buying a pack of those foam flower lint catchers (those cheap ones that have really bad reviews? Yes!) because they actually worked pretty well for catching lint and fur in these types of washers! I think they’re usually rated so badly because people try to put them in commercial washers, not these Asian portable ones. I usually just throw one in on top and it has more than made up for the broken lint catcher I can no longer use. Those flower lint catchers may catch even more than the one the washer originally had.

I would also recommend (if you’re draining this down the tub or something) to purchase a set of lint snares/traps so that you don’t clog anything up. I don’t think I can directly link to other products in reviews, but the exact item name of what I purchased is “ Lot of 50 Washing Machine Lint Trap Snare Fabric mesh with ties,” which are plastic mesh catchers that I put over the end of the tube with some finagling with a zip tie. I would suggest inserting one trap into another just to ensure the mesh is fine enough, and with the amount of pet hair and lint we have, I wind up throwing the inner trap out every 2-3 weeks (when the water starts having to squirt out of the trap instead of simply draining). Not very eco-friendly, and I feel guilty about it every time I do it, but you can’t really scrape the lint out of long skinny tubes like that.

So anyway! The washer itself is great, just be aware of potential minor issues (and how to deal with them). That’s all I got.

Second my guess is that the instructions are translated which is fine but they can be tricky to understand sometimes. I had to watch a couple of YouTube videos and I didn’t rely much on the instructions.

And finally, the cord is way too short and so are the hoses. The hose that goes on top will reach some places but then trust me when I say it will not work with your sink, so now you either use a bucket or buy another hose. The draining hose is small and The washer needs to be raised to drain all the water, so now you have to buy or use a small table you already own to put the washer on top just to drain the water.

text: So I ordered this about a week ago, it arrived and everything was fine arrived a bit early. I opened it and it was a tad smaller than what I expected. I decided to return it to just get a refund since I was dissapointed that it didn't resemble the one in the pictures. The thing that irked me was it says it's eligible for a return, which not even 2 days have passed since I got it that I processed the return, I didn't even take it out of the box, and it still has the box that it came in. So earlier today, I printed out the return label, and dropped it off at a postal carrier, and it's on it's way. That's when I get a message from the company saying that they will give me 2 options, 1 is to refund me $25 and keep it (what would I do with it), and 2 is charge me $40 so that my refund will be just $149. Which is bollocks to me, they didn't even want me to print the return label I got off from here. That $40 was gonna be the cost for a shipping label. It's a freaking joke.

title: Great little "mini-laundromat" for apartments!!
text: This thing is awesome. My wife and I have been using ours as our main laundry appliance For 3.5 months now, and it's great. It's not our favorite mode of doing laundry, but for an apartment with no washer/dryer hookups, this thing is great. It has paid for itself already in the amount of money it has saved us. My only thought complaint is that the clothes will sometimes get tangled in each other and cause long sleeves or hoodie strings to stretch. If you are a DIY kind of guy like I am, I recommend cutting a PVC pipe to fit over the center of the star-shape agitator at the bottom of the wash tub and securing that in place. This will help prevent clothes from getting tangled as much, reducing wear and tear on the machine and your clothes. Also, this machine is able to run both the washer and the spin dryer simultaneously, we do it all the time.

text: Is an okay machine. Definitely noisy. Im a girl and while it was a little difficult to move, i could move it. Kept it in my camper bathtub so it could just drain and wouldn't take up what little space i had, and took it out each time I had to shower. Plastic fill tube wouldn't fit my faucet either, just used my showerhead. Used it outside a few times and filled with a bucket but that was fairly inconvenient. I wish the filter was closer to the bottom of the machine, i don't like that's its near the top. If you do plan on draining this into a tub, especially a  camper tub, i recommend getting a filter for the drain. I don't think the one for this machine took out much, and i noticed a fair amount of tiny fibers in the water, all of which were ending up down my drain. My machine lasted about a year. I did a load of laundry in the morning and left afterwards, forgetting to unplug it. Im not sure what happened, but when i came home it smelled like burnt plastic, and the back of the machine was very hot. After that you could hear it turn on, but the wash drum wouldnt spin. I'm worried that if i had not come back when i did there could have been a fire. It was also 119.99 when I bought it, and theyre now selling it for 189 which is a bit steep to me. Washing clothes is very hands on since each load only takes 10 minutes to wash, then 5 minutes for the spin dry (but do this twice since spin drum is half the size of wash drum) and finally to hang up the clothes. But it worked for me at the time as a college student living in a camper. Slightly convenient than a laundromat

title: Honest review!
text:
This is just my honest opinion. I’m only leaving a review because I rely on reviews before buying items on Amazon. So, I’m just trying to help out the next person who can relate.

This item came in pretty dirty on the inside, which I thought was weird but soap and water fixed that. I live in apartments and it’s pretty loud, so I try not to use it too early or too late in the day. This is my second time using it - I had a regular size hamper full of clothes along with three full bed sized sheets I needed to wash. I started around 8am and ended around 2ish pm. (I was washing dishes, cleaning my apartment and working on hw in between). Very portable, and not heavy. I was able to lift it onto my kitchen counter (for the elevation) and I just stand on my kitchen chair while I’m using it. To get the water in, I just used buckets for now. The hose it came with is too small for my sink. I’m waiting for my detachable shower head to come in so I can just input the water from there and drain the water in my tub.

Washing:
For my clothes, if it’s heavy like work pants or jackets, I put only about 3-5 items and it worked well. For regular items like socks and underwear or light shorts and shirts, I was able to fit it about 8-10 items. Really depends on your clothes. But just know the spinner side will only fit half of what you washed. Example: I put 4 work pants to wash, but when I put them in the spin side, one two fit.
For my bed sheets, two were super thin and I was able to wash both together but had to spin them separately. I washed a bedsheet that was thicker and had to wash and spin it on its own.

Spinner: it’s true what they say. It won’t dry your clothes completely but it depends on the material. Some of my clothing came out dry and some didn’t. Whatever didn’t, I just hung up and opened the windows and by the end of the night - everything was dry.

Overall, I love how this machine washed everything. On the first drain, the water was gross but after the second drain, the water came out nice and clean. The spinner does it’s job and spins most of the water out of your soaking wet clothes to 85% dry.

Steps I used:
I wash my clothes on “normal” with detergent first (left side) for about 12 min, drain the water, then throw my clothes in the spinner (right side) for about 2 min, then throw clothes back to (left side), put the cycle to “normal” to wash with fabric softener for about 12 min, drain water, then back to the spin side for about 5 minutes to finish off.

Tips:
1. Use only a little bit of detergent and fabric softener.
2. Don’t over do it. It’s a small machine so it’s obvious that only a certain amount of items will fit.
3. Clean out your filter after you are done using the washer side (left side)
4. Wipe the inside of your machine down (on the spinner side there will be hair, lint from clothing and whatnot), and keep the lids up and open so it can dry out.

One thing I didn’t like at all - there’s a weird smell that comes from the machine while you use it, it made me a bit dizzy and nauseous. I’ll update this review after I’ve done a couple more washes to see if the problem continues.

I hope this review is helpful!

title: The right product at the right price!
text: This washer has been great for the money spent! I am able to do a couple pairs of jeans/pants with shirts and smaller items so I would honestly say about a half of a normal sized washer load. Maybe even 3/4's depending on items. I was able to do sheets in this too, however comforters seem unrealistic so therefor have not tried it nor would I recommend. With this washer I would say that I can keep up with normal laundry for two adults once a week and be fine. The spinner is also fantastic, the clothes come out almost fully dried and only take about 4-8 hours to dry fully (12 hours for thicker items/denim/jeans). The negatives of this product is of course that it has no pump so it does require a setup to which you can drain all the water from it, and with that, I personally use buckets to fill it as the house it comes with is difficult to setup to the sink I have to use for it, however I know that with other reviews and usage from other people that it can work with some life-hacking. The only other con I would say is the slight grease smell that remains for several uses, not bad nor does it leech into the clothing but the room it would be in will have a faint smell of it for some time. With all that being out there I would say that for the money you are spending and if in a situation where you would like to have normal options for washing clothes in an apartment or smaller space this is top of its game and would highly recommend.

title: It does exactly what it says it will!
text: The product arrived in perfect condition, it even got to me a week sooner than Amazon said it would take. One of the box corners was a little smushed but the way it’s packaged protected it just fine. I’ve had it for almost 2 months now and so far so good. I just set it in my bathtub (use my handheld shower attachment to fill it) on a cushioned mat and have a long extension cord that I run over the shower curtain rod to keep it well out of reach of water. It feels a lot sturdier in person than what the pictures portray. The spinner side does an awesome job at getting as much water out of the clothes as possible. Depending on the item itself some stuff is dry within an hour. I’d highly recommend that you use a detergent that doesn’t make a ton of suds, just makes it easier to get the clothes rinsed better. It’s definitely something that you need to be around to keep the load going. Cause once it’s done the wash or rinse cycle, you have to drain the water to get to the next step. Some people just drain it and then fill it with rinse water and cycle again for the rinse. I actually spin the clothes for a couple of minutes to extract as much of the soapy water as I can before I do the rinse cycle and that’s really helped. The main thing is that you want to make sure you have someplace to dry your freshly laundered clothes. I got in laundry mode, did too much that first day. I had to improvise for drying spots cause I don’t always like to use hangers since the items can wind up getting those funny shoulder bumps. Walmart sells a cheap drying rack for $9 that you just angle in at its folding point and then can lean against a wall. You don’t have to worry about them dripping cause there isn’t enough water left after the full 5 minute spin to drip off. The only other thing is to remember to turn the dial back to the normal setting before you start filling it again cause otherwise while it’s filling on one side it’s draining out the tube on the other. Also- if the drainage tube is coming out of the opposite side that you need it to, it’s designed to snap out and come out the other. Easy peasy, just turn it on its side and you’ll see. It’s not a real washer and dryer but when you don’t have hook-ups for those it’s absolutely worth the purchase!

title: There aren't enough stars in the galaxy - With Update
text:
I got this little beast for Christmas and I cannot tell you how amazing it is. I've been living in a small 500 sq. ft. apt for over a year and the laundry is at the front of the complex, which was enough for me to procrastinate doing my laundry on a regular basis. Now, all I have to do is pull this little monster out and all my problems have been solved. It's not heavy and because it is compact, it's not a nuisance in my small space. It's not noisy and it has some power! I'm on a laundry spree as we speak and this little guy has been worth it's weight in gold. Don't even hesitate purchasing one of these. It's easy to use and is phenomenal.
Now, the instructions are very very very tiny and in a bit of broken English, so I would recommend watching one of the videos posted just to see how it works before you try it for the first time. But honestly, it's so easy. I use it in my tub so I can fill and drain it rather easily and when it spins the clothing in the spin tub, they come out so close to dry it's shocking.
I can't say enough about this washer. Please, don't even think twice. It's a great machine and well worth the money!

UPDATE:
I felt like I needed to come back and update my review because I purchased this washer in Dec. of 2018 and I'm using right now and have without any issues. It is still going strong, and is just the best tiny washer one could ask for. It does get this low hum when the washer is running as it turns but it's not a deal breaker. I also run it in my tub, so it could be louder because of the closed in area it's working in. I did break down and purchase a small electric dryer just to finish the clothing and fluff them up so they aren't so stiff. But I wanted to update that in over a year of owning this and it has never let me down.

title: Works great. Lint trap in the washer is ok, but not great. needs to be cleaned out often.
text:
I have a 500sqft apartment and this works perfectly for me.

Box it was shipped in was tattered and falling apart as if it was dropped a few dozen times. Opened it up thinking I would need to return it but other then the cardboard box ripped the foam padding cracked the washer was in good condition.

The instructions it comes with are terrible, it would be more productive if the manual was not provided as attempting to read it is a waste of time. You are better off watching a quick video tutorial online.

I Placed it in my bathroom tub and put 4 spunges under each leg to cushion/minimize any rattling. Filled it using my corded shower head (the tube it comes with is garage). And tossed a set of clothes into it. I found that a shot glass full of liquid laundry detergent is the perfect amount for this size of machine. I run it twice at 6min to flush out all the soap (wash/rinse cycles).
The spin dryer is amazing. It is terrifying when it starts up because the clothes in it cause the machine to shake violently but after a few second the weight is distributed better and it stops shaking (until it slows down/stops at the end). The water is about 90% rung out at the end of this.

I've done a few loads of wash with this and I am pleased with it. Lint is a slight issue as the catcher in the back of the tub is good, but not great.

Power cord is short and you will need an extension cord most likely. So be careful when figuring out how to plug it in and not get it wet.

title: Buy some zip ties and make sure the internal wires are secure.
text: This little washer has seen heavy use for most of year but not without problems. After the first month it had suddenly stopped working. When I opened it up to see what was wrong I discovered unsecured wireing had been laying on the belt and the belt had eaten through them. I bought industeral grade wire desgined for underwater use and a $50 rewiring job later she runs like a dream. Also made to zip tie the new cable out of the way of the belt. The current struggle is with the centrifuge for the spin dry. First the steel cable had streched meaning the break was still engaged when it was trying to spin. If Ihad caught the problem faster I only would have had to change the position of a hook. Unfortunately I didn't catch it in time and the brake twisted. To make matters worse this thing uses a piece of cork for a brake pad which had worn to almost nothing. Still trying to figure out what I can use to replace the pad. A bike break pad won't work because this break is curved inwards. It took a few days to twist the metal back into place and it's sort of spinning like it should. I suspect too much strain was put on the centrifuge motor when the brake let go. Currently it takes it about 2 minutes to get up to speed to ring out any water. As it stands I probably have six months before the motor completely goes. Even with the rewiring job I've already saved more money doing laundry this way then I would have taking it to the laundromat. It's been annoying but worth it

title: I recived my mini wash on 2/20/18 have done easy over 10 loads in this machine
text:
I recived my mini wash on 2/20/18 have done easy over 10 loads in this machine.
1.I make sure not to over load it and fill the water (at or below the "M" located inside the wash tub)
2. I add my soap no more than 2tbs( i use arm and hammer santitive) . I use cold water for all my washes so alway put 2tbs.for most loads
3. I turn on the mechine and let the soap mix in and add cloths( your cloths should be fully submerged in the water) you can add a little more water if you need to at this point but sure to keep our loads small)
4) when i us the spinner i ususally do a total of 4 spinns( sliting each load)
5. First spin, you need to connect the intack hose to the spinner side and turn on your tap while the spinner is on( this step get all the soap out of cloths)
6. I leave what in the wash tub while i spin to keep the machine balanced while the spinner is on.
7. After i am done spinng i emtpy the water and fill the tub up again with water to the M line again
Note: make sure you don't forget about the water being on( time the amount of time it takes for your tub to fill to the "M" inside machine to ensure you dont leave the water running
8. Add no more than a 1tbs and a half of fabric conditioner( i use snuggles). I set the timer for no langer than 6mins or so
9. For the last spin you do not turn on the water but also, split your conditioned loads,for 2 spinnes. I set the time for 5mins and stop it half way through and arrange the cloths, bring the bottom garments to the top to get the best results ( your cloths will be still damp when you take them out of the spinner)
I love this machine, it has changed the way i look at laundry. I will Deffinently recommend every one to have one of these in your home.
P.s. And its fun to use.

title: DON'T BUY!!! I THINK I WAS SENT A USED MACHINE!!
text: I purchased my washer on July 13, 2018 and as of Sept 1, 2018 my machine does not work anymore.  I suspected right out of the box that my machine was used.  The lettering was all faded out around the dials.  Within a week, I noticed the spinner side was filling up with water at the same time the washer was filling.  Then one day the spinner just stopped working all together.  I unscrewed the back of it, thinking maybe it was a blown fuse or something noticeable. I discovered the whole thing was covered in black mold.  I just threw the piece of junk out.  I will never again purchase anything from this company. title: Better than the laundry mat
text:
Although overall it does ok, there are several things I was not aware of when I purchased this. I had to do a lot of research to figure things out.
First the intake hose is a joke if you live in an apartment or where there are regular nozzles. I guess it’s for a camper. I ended up purchasing a pet shower sprayer (you attach it to your shower head- it was fairly easy because my shower head wasn’t hard to get off- but some may be on tight and you’ll have to loosen it with a wrench(?))and filling it up that way. It cleans pretty good and it takes only about 15 minutes. However, it does not rinse, you have to drain it and refill it and do the wash again(at least that’s what I do).
I put mine in the bath tub on top of the styrofoam that it was packed in.
The drain hose is very small as well but I believe there are extensions for that.
The ‘dryer’ is just like the spin cycle on a washing machine. It does not dry your clothes. It just spins out excess water.
I washed 3 pair of women’s jeans and 2 tops (it can hold a little more but I wanted to be sure they would get clean). The spin part is very small so you can’t put the whole load in the spin part. I put 2pair of jeans in and it spun them out ok. I tried to spin several times but it didn’t seem to make a difference, once all the excess water is spun out. I use a clothes dryer rack to hang them on. It takes at least over night to get dry.
I chose this one because the more expensive ones (which have more features) seamed more complicated to hook up. You had to hook them under the sink (to hot and cold pipes) and unhook when done. I’m older so that was an issue for me.
I also purchased casters but it’s not heavy when empty. It’s just easier to maneuver.

Using this washer is more time intensive than a normal sized washer/dryer because of the spin-dryer, and also needing to rinse the clothes with a second wash cycle, but it's much cheaper and easier than lugging clothes down my fifth floor walk-up.

title: An essential for those starting on their own.
text:
This little machine has been a godsend. It comes ready to go and was very easy to set up. I work with uniforms and I wash mine on the daily as my white cuffs turn black by the end of shift. This holds enough for my entire uniform and cleans better than I would have ever expected. You will need to do a bit of extra work though, as the soap will likely not drain out all the way and requires a second rinse. However, it beats me spending the 5 dollars daily to do my uniform.

The spinner, while it doesn't produce heat, works fantastic. You will have to hang dry your clothes for a bit, but for the most part the clothes only come out slightly damp. I have a small space heater in my bedrooms closet that drys my clothes in about 10 minutes.

title: In the end, I am very satisfied with this washing machine
text:
[[VIDEOID:e93015e635617c937edf7623a2ef9bfa]] It's a lifesaver for an apartment dweller like me. I have been using it for more than 2 months. After using it for a while, I wanted to give my opinion. It is very easy to operate. There is a max 15-minute washing function. I always leave 15+15 and wash for 30 minutes. After that, I drain the water with detergent (then you need to switch to the Drain function) and fill it again and drain the water for 5 minutes. Finally, I put it in the dryer for 5 minutes. It dries very well. The price is very reasonable. Washes clothes very clean. Very good in capacity. It is possible to wash many clothes at once. It does not make a lot of noise, just like normal washing machines. You have to be at home to wash clothes in this machine, as we know, you have to drain the water by hand.
There are only 1-2 important things that I wanted to share.
-1st problem the cord didn't fit my faucet so I used a showerhead.
-The 2nd problem is that this washing machine must be higher than the bathtub so that the water in it flows out. For this, it is better if you buy a tall piece of furniture. I haven't found furniture that fits my bathroom yet
In the end, I am very satisfied with this washing machine
